Issue: Dealing with your lender or servicer
Sub-issue: Received bad information about your loan
Consumer complaint narrative: I am writing to formally request the discharge of all student loans held by XXXX  due to the companys deceptive practices, misrepresentation, and failure to provide proper guidance regarding my loan repayment options. XXXX  misled me by steering me away from income-driven repayment plans, which would have made my payments more affordable and eligible for eventual forgiveness. Instead, I was repeatedly encouraged to enter forbearance or deferment, causing my loan balance to balloon due to capitalized interest. This manipulation has led to years of financial strain and has profoundly affected my ability to meet my financial obligations. Also, XXXX  has a history of misreporting my payment status to credit agencies, severely damaging my credit score. The misinformation provided by their representatives has delayed my pursuit of more favorable repayment options and contributed to an overwhelming amount of accrued debt, well beyond what I originally borrowed. These tactics are consistent with the widespread fraudulent behavior for which XXXX  has been sued by numerous states and the Consumer Financial Protection Bureau ( CFPB ). XXXX  conduct has caused me significant financial harm, mental distress, and a long-term burden that could have been avoided with honest and fair guidance. As a borrower who relied on XXXX advice and entrusted them to manage my student loans, I believe I am entitled to be fully discharge all related debts. Their misconduct has created an unjust financial situation, and I ask that my loans be fully forgiven. Thank you for considering my request. I hope the CFPB will swiftly and decisively take action to hold XXXX  accountable and provide the relief borrowers like me desperately need.

Consumer complaint narrative:
I believe that i was a victim of XXXX separate instances with my student loan. 

First, I felt like I was being pressured and mislead into taking on a loan at such a young age not knowing exactly what i signed up for. I was promised to be helped in finding a job and told this was the best decision i would i make and it would pay itself off. Non of that happened, the education was sub par at best. 

Secondly, I feel i was a victim of XXXX XXXX tactics to steer me into forbearances when there were other options. Most of this happened at the beginning of XXXX  and throughout the following years. If i called them and was unable to make XXXX payment or a full payment, they would steer me into a forbearance without offering me any other options for months at a time. This has happened repeatedly while my loan was being serviced by them. 

I'm not sure what actions can be taken now but if you need any further information from me, feel reach to back out. 

Thank you for your help, XXXX XXXX XXXX

Consumer complaint narrative:
Well this is a long history of unorganized and in my an unfair money grab scheme. I have always done my best to make my payments, with that being said there have been some tough patches financially for me through out the many many years of dealing with my student loans. Although, 90 % of the time I always make my payments. Sometimes a couple days late but always make the payment. It just never seems like the amount goes down like it should, when I pay over {$300.00} a month year after year you would think it would be noticeable but its not. Below I will list the many frustrations over the many years I have had to deal with when trying to figure out how to navigate the best re-payment plan for myself. 
- Over the past XXXXyears or so I have had to put my loans into either forbearance or deferment several times and was always charged a ridiculous amount of fees, which I thought was not right considering the reason for forbearance is one is struggling financially. 
- When I asked the company what my options were for some temporary repayment relief I was always put directly into forbearance or deferment immediately in which I have used both over the many years paying fees and not realizing the interest accrual. 
- Late fees became a norm for me only because of how my payday landed bi-weekly from my employer, but the payment was made only a few days late which in my mind one should not be charged a late fee in this case. I was making the payment regularly every month for years. 
- When speaking with individuals over the phone I asked several times if they could mail me a hard copy of my loan history because it just seemed like the balance wasn't going down like it should be. Several times I was told they can't do that and several other instances they said " sure no problem '' but I never received the documents. 
Overall, I am not sure what is going on here with the company " Navient '' but my balance seems like its never ending for some reason even after years and years of repaying.

Consumer complaint narrative:
I filed a CFPB to assist with my concern of Navient reporting that I owe a student loan to the Credit reporting agencies. The company responded that they are not the appropriate company to address my issue. 

The credit report has Navient 's name. Thus, Navient is responsible to remove the incorrect information. Navient has sold the loan to XXXX and still reports the information under Navient. The loan has been forgiven under a Total and XXXX XXXX, yet it is showing up on my credit report under Navient. Because the loan was forgiven, a loan should not show in my credit report under any Student loan servicer, much less Navient, which no longer serviced the student loan. This is definitely the responsibility of Navient to remove Navient 's incorrect reporting from my credit report.

Consumer complaint narrative:
I am writing to formally address my deep frustration and concern regarding the ongoing handling of my student loans, which were originally with XXXX XXXX, later transferred to XXXX and have since been resold multiple times. I have been dealing with this situation since 2010 and, over the years, have seen various government forgiveness programs and opportunities that I should qualify for. However, none of these options have been made available to me, nor have I received any notification or guidance on how to take advantage of these programs. 

The lack of transparency and assistance from XXXX XXXX, Navient, and even the Department of Education has been both unfair and unacceptable. On top of this, I have been consistently harassed with legal threats, frequent phone calls, and letters, all while trying to negotiate a resolution. This has caused significant financial distress, as the unresolved status of these loans has negatively impacted my credit, my wifes credit, and our household 's financial stability. This ongoing issue has prevented us from achieving basic financial goals, including the ability to purchase a home. 

If a prompt and satisfactory resolution is not provided, I will have no choice but to seek legal action to protect my rights and rectify this matter. 

I expect a detailed response with clear steps to resolve these issues moving forward.

Consumer complaint narrative: On XXXX I filed for bankruptcy and Navient Solution- was included in the bankruptcy. I have my student loans with XXXX, who is the official servicer of Federal student aid, and during bankruptcy they were placed in forbearance until my bankruptcy plan was complete. I completed my plan in XXXX and I have worked with XXXX to consolidate all of my direct subsidized and unsubsidized student loans, submitted the PSFL paperwork, and applied for the SAVE repayment plan. However, in XXXX XXXX of last year, I started receiving paperwork from Navient- stating that my loan was past due. It was my understanding that all of my loans have been consolidated or discharged in the bankruptcy. I received a letter from Navient in XXXX, dated XX/XX/XXXX, that states they received notification that my bankruptcy case has concluded and that I am now responsible for the remaining balance of the loan, according to the promissory notes. In the same letter, there was also another letter that stated the loan was placed in forbearance ; however, I did not submit any paperwork requesting a forbearance from Navient. One that document it states that I agreed to repay the loan after the forbearance period expires- However, I did not submit the request, nor did I agree to the terms. Navient started calling my phone day and night leaving messages that my loan was past due. I reached out to Navient on XX/XX/XXXX and told them about the account being discharged with my bankruptcy and they told me I had two account and that one of the loans was included in the bankruptcy but not the other one. Unfounded to me, I asked to speak with someone and they told me, the loan was transferred back to the guarantor during the bankruptcy I asked who the guarantor was and they gave me the following number XXXX, with no other name. I reached out to the company XXXX who states the did received {$480.00} from the courts but once the bankruptcy was completed they transferred the account back to Navient and they opened the account back up. I told them I did not understand how, when the Courts included Navient in my bankruptcy and discharged it- they said because it was a student loan ; however, as mentioned above all of my loans were consolidated with XXXX and Navient could not tell me who the lending source was. And original the young lady told me my account was closed- until they reopened it- causing it to show as two different loans. I asked the young lady for a copy of the original paper work and who the loan was originated with, and as of date, I still have not received that information- but continue to receive harassing calls from Navient and negative ratings on my credit report, as a result. I do not recall receiving a student loan from XXXX, which is what the letter states as the Loan Program- that is why I asked for verification.

Consumer complaint narrative:
Improper Forbearance Steering, Missing Loan History, and Financial Harm Dear CFPB, I am submitting this complaint regarding improper and deceptive loan servicing practices by Navient and now XXXX, which have caused ongoing financial harm. After Navient transitioned my loans to XXXX, my complete loan servicing history has been lost, and I am unable to verify critical details regarding payments, forbearance periods, and accrued interest. 

Issue Overview : While Navient serviced my loans, I frequently contacted them for assistance during financial hardship. Rather than offering XXXX XXXX ( XXXX ) plans, which would have been a more appropriate solution, Navient steered XXXX into forbearance repeatedly. This practice increased my loan balance significantly due to capitalized interest and prolonged my repayment timeline unnecessarily. 
After Navient transferred my loans to XXXX, my detailed servicing history disappeared, leaving me with no way to confirm the accuracy of my loan balances or repayment status. 
XXXX has continued to offer forbearance as a default solution without properly guiding me toward XXXX plans or forgiveness options. 
XXXX XXXX : XXXX XXXX XXXX : I no longer have access to my servicing records under Navient, including payment details, forbearance periods, and accrued interest, making it impossible to verify the legitimacy of my loan balance. 
Inaccurate Credit Reporting : Despite being in forbearance, Navient reported XXXX late payments, which remain on my credit report and continue to harm my credit score. 
Ballooning Loan Balances : Due to repeated forbearance periods under Navient, my loans accrued significant interest that was capitalized, unnecessarily increasing my total debt. 


Context and Legal Precedent : These issues are consistent with the deceptive practices outlined in XXXX {$1.00} XXXX multi-state settlement in 2022, which confirmed that borrowers were frequently steered into forbearance instead of XXXX plans. The transition of loans to XXXX has compounded the harm by erasing loan history and perpetuating poor servicing practices. 

I respectfully request the CFPBs assistance in resolving this matter promptly, as the financial and credit damage caused by these practices continues to affect my life. 

Thank you for your time and attention. I can be reached at [ Your Phone Number ] or [ Your Email Address ] for any further questions or clarifications. 

Supporting Evidence ( Attached ) : Recent credit report showing inaccurate late payment entries. 
Correspondence with XXXX regarding ongoing forbearance offers. 
Documentation of financial hardship during the forbearance periods. 
Sincerely, XXXX XXXX XXXX Attachments : Credit Report Screenshots Correspondence from XXXX

Issue: Dealing with your lender or servicer
Sub-issue: Received bad information about your loan
Consumer complaint narrative:
I write on behalf of myself, XXXX XXXX, concerning Navients unlawful servicing of their federal student loan, culminating in both negligent misrepresentations and unfair practices that have caused serious financial and emotional harm. Pursuant to the Consumer Financial Protection Act of 2010 ( 12 U.S.C. 5531 et seq. ) and other applicable federal statutes, we respectfully request the Consumer Financial Protection Bureau ( CFPB ) investigate and facilitate appropriate redress. 



BACKGROUND Erroneous Forbearance and Withholding of Income-Driven Repayment ( IDR ) Options Navient inaccurately informed me that their loan was placed in forbearance. During this period, I was led to believe no payments were due, and that interest accrual would be managed appropriately. 

Navient further represented that, upon conclusion of this forbearance, I would be approved for an income-driven repayment plan, thereby reducing monthly obligations in line with federal regulations designed to ease borrower burdens. 

Sale of Loan to Trellis Without Adequate Notice Contrary to Navients assurances regarding an IDR plan, I later discovered that Navient had sold the loan to Trellis. No timely or transparent notification was provided. 

After the transfer, XXXX failed to communicate essential loan details, repayment instructions, or any path to the promised IDR plan. 

Charge-Off and Resulting Credit Harm Without mys knowledge or an opportunity to cure, XXXX proceeded XXXX charge off the loan. This action has severely damaged mys credit standing and made it difficult to secure alternative financing or better repayment terms. 

Relevant Regulatory Actions On XX/XX/XXXX, the CFPB announced a proposed order against Navient, permanently barring it from federal student loan servicing and mandating a {$120.00} XXXX payment for its longstanding, wide-ranging failures in servicing student loans. This order directly addresses Navients practice of steering borrowers away from IDR and into forbearances. 

In light of the CFPBs findings and other state and federal enforcement actions, it is evident that Navient routinely engaged in misconduct detrimental to borrowers, including myself. 

VIOLATIONS Based on the foregoing, we believe Navient engaged in practices that are : Unfair or Deceptive in violation of the Consumer Financial Protection Act ( 12 U.S.C. 5536 ). 

Potentially in violation of the Fair Debt Collection Practices Act and/or the Fair Credit Reporting Act, given the misinformation and adverse credit reporting suffered by myself. 

Contrary to Department of Education regulations governing servicer communications, forbearance approvals, and IDR enrollment procedures. 

REQUESTED RELIEF Retroactive IDR Evaluation That the CFPB require Navient ( and/or its successor servicer ) to review and recalibrate mys loan as though placed in a proper income-driven repayment plan when it was first requested or offered. 

Any interest capitalizations, fees, or additional charges accruing due to Navients deceptive or negligent conduct should be eliminated or refunded.

Credit Reporting Corrections Removal or correction of any negative marks resulting from the erroneous forbearance and subsequent charge-off, including the restoration of a positive payment history to the extent permitted by law. 

Reinstatement or Proper Transfer of the Loan If the loan remains with Trellis ( or any other entity ), ensure I have clear information on repayment options and IDR eligibility, along with complete and timely disclosures. 

If XXXX is unable or unwilling to manage the account in compliance with federal standards, we request an orderly reassignment to a servicer fully compliant with Department of Education and CFPB guidelines. 

Monetary Redress ( If Applicable ) Compensation for the harm I have experienced, including any excessive fees, interest, or other costs arising from Navients ( and its transferees ) conduct.

Given the CFPBs own enforcement actions, it is apparent Navients misconduct is both widespread and well-documented. We trust the Bureau will take swift action to redress the specific injuries I have suffered, as well as to safeguard against any ongoing or future harm. 



Please do not hesitate to contact me should you require any additional information or documentation. I am prepared to provide payment histories, correspondence, and any other evidence relevant to this matter. 



Thank you for your prompt attention to this complaint.

Consumer complaint narrative:
Demand for Loan Payout, Justice, and Compensation for Predatory Lending Practices To Whom It May Concern, I am writing to formally demand compensation and relief for the severe financial and emotional hardships I have experienced due to the predatory lending practices of XXXX XXXX, later taken over by Navient. My situation aligns with the XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX findings against Navient, and I seek justice and remedy for the harm caused by their actions. 

As an XXXX from a low-income background with limited credit history, I took out private student loans with XXXX XXXX in XXXX, later managed by Navient, to finance my education XXXX XXXX XXXX. Despite consistent payments over 15 years, my total debt has increased by 51.87 %, with my current outstanding balance now totaling {$100000.00}. 

This figure is the result of unsustainable interest rates, compounding debt, and mismanagement of my loans. Below is pertinent information regarding my loans and my experience with Navients lending practices : Loan Origination Dates : XXXX through XXXX Initial Loan Amounts and Current Balances : Loan # XXXX : XX/XX/XXXX, originally {$2600.00}, current balance {$2700.00} ( XXXX % reduction over 16 years ). 
Loan # XXXX : XX/XX/XXXX, originally {$8200.00}, current balance {$8300.00} ( XXXX % reduction over 14 years, 8 months ). 
Loan # XXXX : XX/XX/XXXX, originally {$8200.00}, current balance {$8500.00} ( XXXX % reduction over 15 years, 1 month ). 
Loan # XXXX : XX/XX/XXXX, originally {$16000.00}, current balance {$23000.00} ( XXXX % reduction over 16 years, 1 month ). 
Loan # XXXX : XX/XX/XXXX, originally {$14000.00}, current balance {$26000.00} ( XXXX % reduction over 18 years, 1 month ). 
Loan # XXXX : XX/XX/XXXX, originally {$22000.00}, current balance {$38000.00} ( XXXX % reduction over 16 years, 11 months ). 

Employment Information : I have dedicated 14 years to working in the nonprofit sector, fulfilling all requirements for XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX ( PSLF ). However, XXXX high-interest private loans have unjustly excluded me from XXXX, XXXX me in a cycle of unmanageable debt and preventing me from receiving the forgiveness I deserve. 

Financial and Emotional Hardship : XXXX XXXX of my loans has resulted in severe financial and emotional consequences, including : Misleading Repayment Options : Navient frequently steered me toward temporary solutions, such as forbearance, which drove up interest without offering sustainable, long-term relief. 

Misallocation of Payments : My payments were often misallocated, leading to unnecessary fees, negative credit reporting, and additional interest. 

Credit Damage : XXXX inaccurate reporting and payment mismanagement have left me unable to secure housing, auto loans, or a mortgage, impacting my employability and causing significant emotional distress. 

XXXX XXXX : My cosigners, misled about their obligations, have also experienced financial strain and emotional distress due to XXXX practices. I request their immediate release from these obligations to relieve them of undue hardship. 

Denial of XXXX XXXX : Despite fulfilling PSLF requirements, I was excluded from the program due to XXXX high-interest private loans. This exclusion has caused unnecessary stress and long-term financial harm. 

Requested Documentation : I am prepared to provide additional documentation upon request, including proof of nonprofit employment, credit denial letters, and records of payment misallocation. 

Demands for Justice and Compensation : Given the documented impact of Navients practices, I respectfully demand the following : Loan Discharge : Immediate cancellation of my loan balance due to the predatory terms and unfair loan management. 
Compensation for XXXX and XXXX XXXX : Compensation for the financial hardship, mental health issues, and lost opportunities resulting from XXXX actions. 
Removal of Negative Credit Marks : Elimination of Navient-related negative marks on my credit report. 
Protection for Cosigners : Full release of my cosigners from any obligations tied to these loans. 

The harm XXXX practices have caused extends beyond financial strain, impacting my emotional well-being and quality of life. I urge you to acknowledge my experiences and provide swift relief to rectify the damage done. 

Thank you for your time and attention to this matter. I look forward to your prompt response.

Consumer complaint narrative: On or about XX/XX/XXXX, a student loan was taken out in my name if the amount of {$4000.00}. The current amount owed on the loan is {$11000.00}, for XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX This loan is a fraudulent loan and is not my loan. I have never attended XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX and have no student affiliation with them. In XXXX I filed a XXXX  XXXX in the XXXX XXXXXXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXXXXXX and all student loans were included in the filing to include this loan. Although the loan was not or is not dischargable it is still required to listed as a debt and is still subject to protection under the automatic stay. The XXXX  XXXX was XXXX in XXXX the same filing year. The only thing I knew at the time was that there was a loan serviced by Sallie Mae and I had no knowledge of this loan being tied to XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX or XXXX. In XXXX I under false allegations from my now deceased ex husbands attorney was required to reopen my XXXX  XXXX and include certain parcels of real estate. This case was reopened on or about XXXX of XXXX and remained on the docket until XXXX of XXXX. Again all debts were listing to include this loan. Still having no knowledge of this institution for which this loan was obtained I assumed it was either for XXXX  XXXX XXXX or XXXX XXXX XXXX  where I actually did take classes and utilized student loans. During the course of the reopened XXXX  XXXX Navient now the serving agent of the loan continued to attempt to collect on the student loan and on numerous occasions was advised that the XXXX  XXXX was in place that this loan feel under the protection of the automatic stay and that they were in violation of the federal bankruptcy laws for attempting to collect on a debt included in a bankruptcy. Navient continued to report the loan past due and reported to the credit bureau this information and eventually dropping my credit score by the illegal and inaccurate information by XXXX points. Numerous contact was name with Navient and they refused to verify the bankruptcy information, refused to respond to cease and desist letters by my attorney and simply stated that they would not abide by the federal laws because they did not apply to them. All of the conversations are recorded and should be on file for verification. In XXXX of XXXX after an intense and accurate of XXXX documents provided to the bankruptcy court for a period of time covering approximately XXXX to XXXX it was determined that the XXXX XXXX was again a no asset distribution and was dismissed as such. In XXXX of XXXX I received a letter from XXXX  XXXX XXXX XXXX that they had paid Navient approximately {$11000.00} for this loan as Navient had reported to them that the loan was in default and XXXX paid to them the amount Navient advised was in default. I contacted XXXX and advised them that I was in a XXXX  XXXX from XXXX until XXXX of XXXX and they advised me on a number of occasions that they did not care. That they paid Navient that the loan was in default and that they were going to garnish my wages. Finally I reached out to the Ombudsman for XXXX XXXX XXXX on XX/XX/XXXX, and told her about the situation. Her words to me were that my account was a mess and that there were no student records for me at XXXX XXXX and that this loan money was supposed to be returned to XXXX XXXX XXXX many years ago. She had me fill out an unpaid refund application and email it back to her. She advised me that she was going to approve the refund and that it would be sent to XXXX XXXX XXXX  to be processed. At this time the form has not been received by XXXX of XXXX according to their records and this loan has not been refunded to XXXX XXXX XXXX. It is still outstanding. I was not aware until XXXX of this year that this loan was for XXXX XXXX. This loan is a fraud and this money was embezzled or used for something other than education for or by me. All of this years I was never advised that this loan was for alleged educational use at XXXX XXXX. I have never taken classes there and this loan in not a responsibility that I am willing to assume. This was a fraudulent conveyance of funds either to the university which I was advised was suppose to return the funds and didnt or by the servicer who at the time was Sallie Mae . This loan has devastated me financially and has damaged my credit and has put me in a hardship. Had I known it was a fraudulent loan when I filed the XXXX  XXXX in XXXX I would have filed it as such fraud as it is with the XXXX XXXX  XXXX. I have secured a court date of XX/XX/XXXX at XXXX in the XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX  to file a motion to reopen my XXXX  XXXX and filed a motion for sanctions, motion to rule for show cause, and motion or fraud and or embezzlement if this matter is not cleared up and this loan removed from my name and off my credit report and these funds returned to the XXXX XXXX XXXX. I have also spoken with a consumer protection law firm and if this is not removed from my name will also be filed in the federal court for fraud and damages. This loan is not my loan. I did not take classes or benefit from the distribution of these funds/student loan and I will not be held responsible for a fraudulent loan. If necessary I will file a XXXX  XXXX and have this matter brought before the federal bankruptcy court by the attorney and will have sanctions and or fraud charges criminally brought before the court and an order by the court to return the funds. This matter is being taken very serious and I will by whatever means legally necessary file with the courts to see that all parties involved in this fraud are prosecuted to the fullest extent of the law.

Consumer complaint narrative:
Pursuant to CFR Title 35, Subtitle B, Chpt VI, Part 682, states as follows : ( 5 ) For Federal Consolidation loans, the period that begins on the date the loan is disbursed and ends no later than 10, 12, 15, 20, 25, or 30 years from that date depending upon the sum of the amount of the Consolidation loan, and the unpaid balance on other student loans, exclusive of any period of deferment or forbearance.

For the two outstanding loans attributed to me, the loans are Loan Type : XXXX XXXX : XXXX Current Owner : NAVIENT XXXX XXXX XXXX Guarantor : XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX Disbursement Date : XX/XX/XXXX While I made payments throughout deferment and/or forbearance, I went into regular extended standard repayment on XX/XX/XXXX ( understanding repayment would end XXXX ). 

However, on XX/XX/XXXX, I received a " updated payment schedule '' with the following statement : " If you make all remaining payments on time according to this schedule, we estimate that your loans will be paid off in XXXX/XXXX. Your updated payment schedule : Number of Payments XXXX Payment Amount ( $ ) XXXX Due Date XX/XX/XXXX. '' ( See correspondence attached. ) Extending my loans through XXXX results in a total pay period of 36 years from disbursement, exclusive of any periods of deferment. Therefore, it is beyond the 30 years permitted by law. 

I objected to my loan being extended beyond the allowable terms, which resulted in no correction thereof. 

Instead, Navient ignored my legitimate concerns and fraudulently pushed me into an ISR plan I never applied for without consent ( see approval attached ). I reported the identity theft to the FTC ( attached. ) To date, I have never received documents substantiating the alleged XXXX ISR plan and copies of all correspondence despite multiple requests.

Issue: Improper use of your report
Sub-issue: Reporting company used your report improperly
Consumer complaint narrative: Violations of My Consumer Rights and Monetary Relief for Gross Misrepresentation : Title 12 establishes that cases involving securities automatically fall under Federal Court jurisdiction. I am seeking to mediate with the involved parties before pursuing federal litigation. Per 16 CFR 433.2, the holder ( XXXX XXXX ) of consumer credit contracts is entitled to uphold all consumer rights, including exemptions. According to 15 USC 6802-6805, 16 CFR 433.2, 16 CFR 433.3, and 16 CFR 313.7, I was not provided an opt-out request and have the right to opt out of any and all agreements. Misreporting on my credit reports has occurred, which constitutes a violation of the Fair Credit Reporting Act ( FCRA ). Under the terms and privacy policies of the Department of Education and the Educational and Privacy Act of 1974, my school and banks were not authorized to disclose transaction history or personal financial information to third parties such as XXXX, XXXXXXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXXXXXX, violating my privacy rights. Furthermore, under 15 USC 6802 and 5 USC 552A, I was not given the option to exercise my non-disclosure rights, and my social security number and other personal information were unlawfully shared. Per IRS Publication 4681, canceled or closed debts, including " charge-offs, '' are considered income and should not be reported on credit reports. Reporting such items violates the law. Credit reports include non-mailable addresses, further infringing on my privacy. Additionally, promotional inquiries occurred without my consent, violating 17 CFR 424 and the terms outlined in the XXXX and XXXX reports of these entities. The Early Warning Services report provides evidence of these violations, including unauthorized disclosures. These violations by XXXX, XXXX, XXXX, XXXX XXXX XXXX, the Department of Education, XXXX, XXXX XXXX, XXXX Bank, and other entities have caused financial and emotional harm due to gross misrepresentation. I reserve the right to file an FTC identity theft claim and escalate this matter through legal channels if necessary.

Consumer complaint narrative:
I am formally lodge a complaint regarding the management of my student loans previously serviced by Navient. My concerns stem from a series of issues, including : 1. Misleading Forbearance Advice : I was repeatedly placed in forbearance, which was misrepresented to me as the best option for managing my loans. This has resulted in a significant increase in my principal balance, which I believe to be an unfair outcome.

2. Incorrect Reporting to Credit Bureaus : Despite being placed in forbearance, my payments were reported as late to credit bureaus, negatively affecting my credit score.

3. Inability to Release Co-Signer : My co-signer passed away in XXXX  and despite my numerous attempts, I have been unable to have their name removed from my loans. This has caused unnecessary distress and complications in managing my loan obligations.

4. Public Service Loan Forgiveness ( PSLF ) Denial : I have attempted to apply for PSLF multiple times, but I was continuously informed that my loans were ineligible. I believe this guidance was misleading, and I may have missed out on a valuable opportunity for forgiveness. 
5. Ongoing Harassment : Despite my loans being transferred to another lender, I continue to receive calls from Navient representatives regarding my account. This is unacceptable and disruptive. 

I request that Navient takes immediate corrective action by : Discharging all of my student loans that were serviced by Navient, given the history of mismanagement and misinformation. 
Correcting any inaccurate reports made to credit bureaus regarding late payments. 
Confirming in writing that my co-signer has been removed from my loan account due to their death. 
Ceasing any further communication with me regarding these loans, as they are no longer serviced by Navient as by the email received by Navient.

They had on record a Florida address. I live in XXXX. They had a XXXX phone number ; I am in XXXX. I was told the information was changed via phone. In XX/XX/XXXX, I notice a XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXXXXXX XXXX my credit report. My wife does a change of address request through USPS which confirms it did exist. This was the same address who was on my student loans. I requested my information from the student loan servicer and am sent somewhat helpful information which I lost while moving. I attempted to request a copy of the same information and am getting the runaround. I have called every company related to my loans, but they all tell me they sent my records with the consolidation. This happens with XXXX servicers. Finally, I talk to someone who reports to me that at that moment my address in their computers was the XXXX  address still. I ask them to leave the address as it is and request the documents and it seems as though this lady understood but I did not receive my documents. She told me to call Navient. So, I call Navient and request the records and I am denied. I find an email address to request records, and I am told I need a subpoena to receive a copy of my own personal records. I am working on obtaining a subpoena but do not feel like I should have to since I have received the information before and am only requesting a copy of that same information and it is for my own personal records.

Im reaching out once again because as a consumer I firmly believe we should be protected by US LAW from criminal fraudulent activity and behavior from corporations.

I was scammed by a for profit institution and now Im being coerced to pay for a fraudulent product by a criminal corporation.

We, thousands of defrauded students/consumers, need protection.

Consumer complaint narrative:
Dear CFPB, I am writing to formally file a complaint against Navient, a student loan servicing company, regarding their predatory and negligent practices that have significantly impacted my financial, emotional, and mental well-being.

I initially took out student loans to finance my education, expecting that I would be able to repay them responsibly with the assistance of income-driven repayment plans. However, instead of being provided with information and access to such plans, I was repeatedly placed into forbearance. This decision was made without fully explaining the long-term consequences to me, resulting in an accumulation of interest and a ballooning loan balance that I simply could not afford.

Navients practice of steering borrowers into forbearance rather than assisting them with income-driven repayment options has created an insurmountable financial burden for me. Despite my attempts to seek help and clarify my repayment options, I was met with inadequate guidance and support. This lack of proper assistance has led to severe financial distress, emotional turmoil, and mental stress, affecting both my personal and professional life.

The financial stress caused by Navients actions has left me struggling to make ends meet. The constant pressure to make unaffordable payments has taken a toll on my mental health, causing XXXX  and XXXX. I believe that Navients actions constitute predatory lending practices, as they prioritized their financial gain over the well-being of their borrowers.

Given the circumstances, I respectfully request that my student loans be discharged. I firmly believe that Navients predatory behavior and negligent practices justify this action, as they have caused significant and unjust hardship.

I appreciate your time and consideration in this matter. I am hopeful that the CFPB will take appropriate action to address these issues and provide relief to borrowers like myself who have been unfairly treated by Navient.

Thank you for your attention to this urgent matter.

Consumer complaint narrative:
In XX/XX/XXXX, I entered into repayment for my federal student loans, totaling approximately {$92000.00}. During my initial contact with Sallie Mae/Navient , I was offered a standard repayment plan, which I accepted without being informed about potentially more affordable options. 

In XX/XX/XXXX, I encountered financial difficulties due to job loss. Seeking assistance, I reached out to Navient to inquire about more manageable repayment plans. During this conversation, Navient representatives encouraged me to enroll in a more expensive repayment plan instead of discussing income-driven options that would have suited my financial circumstances better. 

Timeline of Events : - XX/XX/XXXX : Entered repayment for federal student loans amounting to {$92000.00}. Offered and accepted standard repayment plan. 

- XX/XX/XXXX : Contacted Navient due to financial hardship. Requested information on more affordable repayment options. Representatives did not provide adequate guidance and instead recommended a higher-cost repayment plan. 

- XX/XX/XXXX- ( Still requesting for help of this year ) : I continued to communicate with Navient on multiple occasions, specifically requesting details about income-driven repayment plans and potential alternatives. However, I consistently received vague responses and pressure to remain in more expensive plans ( Please request the call record on how many times I called ). 

Actions Taken : 1. Contacted Navient multiple times seeking to lower my repayment amount ( dates of each contact ). 
2. Requested information on income-driven repayment plans and alternative options years of XXXX - XXXX. 
3. Documented all conversations including the names of representatives and the exact information provided to me ( I don't have the rep numbers ). 

Summary : Due to the lack of transparent communication and guidance from Navient, I was guided into more expensive repayment plans, which exacerbated my financial situation. I believe these practices warrant a thorough review and request assistance in resolving my current student loan burden.

Consumer complaint narrative: My parents took out a loan when I was XXXX XXXX XXXX and attending XXXXXXXX XXXX XXXX XXXXXXXX. Because I didn't have enough money to pay for school and didn't fully qualify for XXXX even though my parents ' income was not high. I struggled to pay, and they were convinced by financial aid to take out a private through sallie mae at the time now navient. My parents ' credit was not great so my grandmother was my cosigner so I could finish college and graduate in XXXX which I did. After struggling through the recession and jobe market from XXXX where navient called XXXX times a day threatening me and at the time my XXXX XXXX XXXX grandmother about taken her house if i didnt pay. I was make less then XXXX dollars a week and had agreed to be in foreberance. I was never given deferement private loans and the coustomer service was horrible calling late at night or ealry morning. From XXXX, I spent time in school earning a masters to hopefully find a job that I could pay my provate loan off, I was denied forbearance as well as lowering payments. They would only offer me a program to pay the interest which only lasted 6 months and then they would increase my payments again and call to ask when are going to pay us and if you don't we will sue your or take your grandmother home. At this time in XXXX my grandmother was sick, and they still called her repeatedly after I asked them only to deal with me leave her be. I agreed to pay what i could which was about XXXX dollars or so monthly. Not until Navient was in the news recently did they change their stance of threatening calls and willing to lower payments in XXXXpresent but only for 6 months and interest only nothing was ever going towards my loan. I fully understand that this is my loan and now at XXXX I regret it every day. I have lost a family member to XXXX which I spent a lot of money on for XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXXs well as my mother is sick with XXXX as I have struggled to pay them as been threats of been sued and wages garnished. They call me 5 times a day saying they are willing to help but they only want me to pay in full. They send letters and then when I speak with them on phone, they claim that what was stated in the letter wasn't entirely true. Ive been told that they know I will never be able to pay this debt off and they know I will be stuck my payments for life, I know that I will probably be dead when I see myself free from a loan I never wanted. I know, I maybe a lost cause but I hope that others know what can happened when an institution lies to you to get you stay and your stuck with the bill. XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXXXXXX XXXX  XXXX, GA XXXX XX/XX/year> Navient Finance Service XXXX XXXX XXXX, XXXX, PA CERTIFIED MAIL, RETURN RECEIPT Account : XXXX Tuition Answer To Whom it may concern : I am sending this letter in regard to the servicer referenced above to inform you all that I am disputing this debt. I am requesting that you please contact the three credit reporting agencies, letting them know the debt is disputed, and kindly ask them to delete it from my credit report. Lastly, please make notice that I do not wish to receive further telephone calls or letters, harassing me concerning this debt that is inaccurate. The Fair Debt Collection Practices Act requires you to respect this request. See 15 U.S.C. 1692 ( c ). Thank you for your quick attention to this matter. 

Sincerely, XXXX XXXX

Issue: Dealing with your lender or servicer
Sub-issue: Received bad information about your loan
Consumer complaint narrative:
To Whom It May Concern ; I would like to file a formal complaint against XXXX XXXX for their improper denial of my school misconduct application. Despite Navient saying they are committed to getting relief to borrowers, their blatant refusal to properly review applications and evidence, but also their inability to give sufficient explanations as to why denials are being doled out, indicates they have very different motives. 
On XXXX XXXX, XXXX, I received an application from Navient to file a claim of school misconduct in order to have my private loans XXXX. I was shocked, and very skeptical. Like a greedy, fraudulent, corrupt fox offering to guard the hen house, it seemed unlikely that Navient would hold up its end of the bargain. I mean, XXXX XXXX did conspire with for-profit schools to meet XXXX XXXX in cases where the schools otherwise wouldnt have been able to. But I had to try. So I spent the next XXXX  months gathering mountains of evidence and filling out the application in a way that was clear, concise, and left very little to interpret. After all, I didnt want to risk my application being overlooked simply because I gave them too much work. I laid everything out in an easy to read format with an evidentiary table of contents. I grouped pictures and articles and lawsuits as they related to each question asked in the application. Most importantly, I provided copies of my borrowers defense approval, screen shots of XXXX website, catalog, and brochure, highlighting and outlining their own contradictions and predatory tactics, and showing the tangible aftermath of my direct experience. That along with my application answers, would have been enough, if Navient had actually looked. 
I submitted my application on XXXX XXXX, XXXX. Even though the first page of the application said it would take up to XXXX  days, they requested I give them XXXX  days instead. So I waited. I knew the transfer of my loans over to XXXX was coming soon. So at XXXX  days, I checked in just to see if any progress had been made, and to verify that the switch to XXXX XXXX going to affect the decision. I was told there had been no progress, but the change wouldnt affect anything. So I continued to wait. When the XXXX  day mark came on XX/XX/XXXX and I still hadnt heard anything, I inquired again. Later that same day, I suddenly received XXXX denial letters in my XXXX inbox. Both back dated for XX/XX/XXXX. Since submitting my application, I checked my XXXX XXXX inbox, my email, and even my regular mail regularly, waiting for the results. So when XXXX responded on XXXX stating my denials were sent on the XXXX, I was confused. They hadn't been. I checked before I even reached out. But that wasn't the only thing that didn't make sense. The reason for being denied according to the letter was as follows : A variety of factors are considered in determining whether a private loan should be XXXX based on school misconduct and you do not meet the requirements for discharge based on misconduct by your school. 
In no way does this explain specifically what those factors are, nor does it explain what constitutes misconduct in their eyes. Furthermore, they offered no insight as to why the evidence I provided didnt meet those requirements, but that same, or similar evidence, when submitted by other victims, did. So I emailed XXXX again, asking for clarification. I have yet to get an actual response. 
As has been mentioned countless times by XXXX XXXX and other prominent lawmakers, Navient would easily be able to identify all of the fraudulent debts for borrowers who have been harmed without requiring any type of application, if they bothered to look. If Navient was really interested in addressing all valid misconduct claims, there wouldnt be any need for borrowers to apply at all. Inviting us to apply without providing a clear path to cancellation only serves to give them carte XXXX to deny requests, thus taking away any rights we have as consumers, as borrowers, to appeal the decision under the XXXX Holder Rule. This legal somersault should in and of itself open Navient up to an investigation by the FTC and the CFPB. This is far from being the first time Navient has tried to run a different play out of the same play book. There have been countless lawsuits pushing back against their aversion to accountability. I dont know why we thought things would be different this time. 
For Navient to say the discharge process is in the early stages despite having already denied a majority of the applicants, is incredibly insulting to those of us who have worked so hard to complete their confusing and convoluted application. This feels like nothing more than a ruse, a ploy to pretend they were willing to do the right thing, in an attempt to distract lawmakers and students, to keep us busy while they waited for all these questionable loans to move over to XXXX. Now that Navient is no longer the owner of these debts, and can no longer be held liable under the XXXX XXXX, there is no incentive for them to forgive fraudulent loans. This is an epic game of whack a mole. These lenders can abate responsibility by sending debts around to other lenders while the courts and govt agencies get mired in bureaucracy and red tape. At this rate, if the FTC and CFPB dont hold these lenders accountable across the board, justice will never come to those of us who deserve it. 
I suspect after I submit this complaint, any response coming from Navient, or XXXX, will probably come with a tone of condescension, as they have in the past. XXXX apologize and try to gaslight me into believing that they really did look through my application, and that despite all the evidence I submitted, somehow it doesnt apply to me. But Im not the scared, XXXX kid I used to be, I cant be gaslit into submission. And Im no longer alone. 

CFPB, please hold these lenders accountable. Something has to give. 
Sincerely, XXXX XXXX

Consumer complaint narrative:
You are in violation of the law! 

As per federal law and the FDCPA, regulation under the following 15 U.S.C. 1792 et seq.15 U.S.C . 1692g, you are not allowed to propagate misleading information. Currently Navient is knowingly making false and misleading statements about my student loan debt. 

As per the XXXX Emergency Relief and Student Loan guidance from the XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXXXXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX  owned loans are suspended from payments, collections and default from XXXX XX/XX/XXXX through XXXX XX/XX/XXXX. This is solidified in the Coronavirus Aid, Relief, and Economic Security ( CARES ) Act ( P.L. XXXX ) and invocation of the Higher Education Relief Opportunities for Students Act of XXXX ( HEROES Act ). Based on these acts the Department of Education put for the following policies : Accrual of interest on ED-held student loans and certain non-ED-held student loans was suspended from XX/XX/XXXX, through XX/XX/XXXX. 
ED-held loans were placed in a special administrative forbearance ( payment pause ) for XX/XX/XXXX, through XX/XX/XXXX. During this time, borrowers were not required to make payments on their loans. This special administrative forbearance counted toward the 120 monthly payments required to qualify for XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX ( XXXX ), the maximum repayment periods under the income-driven repayment ( IDR ) plans, and the XXXX voluntary payments required for individuals to rehabilitate their defaulted loans. 
Debt collection activities, including involuntary collection activities such as wage garnishment and offset of certain federal benefits ( e.g., Social Security benefits ), were suspended on ED-held student loans for XX/XX/XXXX, through XX/XX/XXXX. 
Multiple rules related to the 120 monthly payments required to qualify for XXXX were waived. 
A one-time revision was made to the accounts of borrowers with ED-held loans to provide credit toward the XXXX plan maximum repayment XXXX for any months in which they were in repayment status and for specified periods of deferment or forbearance. 

My Navient student loans were owned by the XXXX XXXX XXXX ( proven by the XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX approval ). As per court order ( CFPB vs Navient XXXX ) Navient has been banned from servicing student loans based on decades of systemic predatory and deceptive practices, my loans have been moved to another servicing agent. Navient is no longer responding to my verification requests. 

Navient is still responsible for removing incorrect and inaccurate reporting information on my credit report, in accordance with federal law and the FDCPA. 

As per CARES Act and HEROS Act any and all Navient late payment information from XXXX XX/XX/XXXX through XXXX XXXX is inaccurate and incorrect. Any and All late payment information from that time period needs to be removed immediately.

Consumer complaint narrative:
Thousands of students were scammed by Navient into taking out predatory private loans to attend for profit online schools such as the one I attended, XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXXXXXX. As a matter of fact, because of the numerous claims of fraud and misconduct perpetrated by these online for profit schools, such as XXXX XXXX XXXX, I was able to file a Borrower Defense claim with the Dept. of Education against XXXX XXXX XXXXXXXX, and my Fed. loans of over {$70000.00} are currently being discharged and my credit currently being repaired. 
My Borrower Defense Claim was also part of the XXXX XXXX XXXXXXXX settlement for which I was a post class member. 

I am aware that Navient was sued by 39 state AGs regarding their predatory loans to attend these online for-profit schools and that Sallie Mae/Navient were a " preferred '' lending company in a " deal '' with these schools during the early 2000 's. These private loans with a high risk of default were part of a package deal offered to " for profit online schools ''. But loans made to students in states outside of the agreement, or those who were not in default for 7 months or more during a " specific '' time frame, were excluded. 

I am sure this was a big win for Navient, but what a sham of a settlement deal for the rest of borrowers scammed into taking loans to at least 150 for profit online schools. After the AG settlement, didn't Navient also get out of the Federal student loan business due to scrutiny from lawmakers and borrower advocates? Didn't Navient have to pay restitution to the Federal student loan borrowers for not informing students of IDR/IBR payments students could have enrolled in, but instead steered toward forbearance? Furthermore, hasn't Navient been sued at least a half dozen times for other predatory loan practices and illegal collection practices? 

I am also aware of a " pilot '' program by which Navient is sending out " applications '' to select students who may have filed Borrower Defense claims against their schools and were approved. This application is a sham. Why do we need to prove anything? Navient knows who we are. Under the FTC " Holder Rule '' Navient is liable for giving predatory loans in connection with online for-profit schools. Time is running out for Navient to do right by students who were scammed into taking out private loans to attend online for profit colleges who have committed misconduct and misrepresented themselves to the public to entice students to enroll. XXXX XXXX XXXX has sent a letter to Navient 's CEO asking to discharge these loans NOW! It's time Navient do the right thing and discharge all these predatory private loans made to attend online for profit schools NOW!

Beginning in XXXX, Navientknown then as Sallie Maeengaged in predatory loan practices with fraudulent, for-profit colleges in exchange for a steady supply of borrowers. Many of these loans still remain in Navients portfolio and are eligible for cancellation due to Navients misconduct and under the FTCs Holder-In-Due-Course Rule ( Holder Rule ), which allows borrowers to raise the same claims and defenses against a loan provider that they could raise against the original seller of the good or service.

During the return to repayment, at least 2.5 million XXXX borrowers were affected by servicing failures like backlogs, payment miscalculations, and late bills. 

I was denied by Navient for the School Misconduct Discharge Form even though the school I went to - XXXX XXXX XXXX was already shown by courts to have deceived students. Navient is acting in bad faith by not allowing us to discharge these loans.

Sub-issue: Problem with customer service
Consumer complaint narrative:
Thousands of students were scammed by Navient into taking out predatory private loans to attend for profit schools such as the one I attended, XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX. 

As a matter of fact, XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX, XXXX XXXX ( XXXX XXXX ) was investigated. 

Because of the numerous claims of fraud and misconduct perpetrated by these online for profit schools, such as XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX  XXXX XXXX ( XXXXXXXX XXXX ), I was able to file a Borrower Defense claim with the Dept. of Education against ( your school ), and my Fed. loans were discharged and my credit repaired. 

My Borrower Defense Claim was also part of the XXXX XXXX XXXX settlement for which I was a full class member. 

I am aware that Navient was sued by 39 state AGs regarding their predatory loans to attend these online for-profit schools and that Sallie Mae/Navient were a " preferred '' lending company in a " deal '' with these schools during the early 2000 's. These private loans with a high risk of default were part of a package deal offered to " for profit online schools ''. But loans made to students in states outside of the agreement, or those who were not in default for 7 months or more during a " specific '' time frame, were excluded. I am sure this was a big win for Navient, but what a sham of a settlement deal for the rest of borrowers scammed into taking loans to at least XXXX for profit schools. After the AG settlement, didn't Navient also get out of the Federal student loan business due to scrutiny from lawmakers and borrower advocates? Didn't Navient have to pay restitution to the Federal student loan borrowers for not informing students of IDR/IBR payments students could have enrolled in, but instead steered toward forbearance? Furthermore, hasn't Navient been sued at least a half dozen times for other predatory loan practices and illegal collection practices? 

I am also aware of a " pilot '' program by which Navient is sending out " applications '' to select students who may have filed Borrower Defense claims against their schools and were approved. This application is a sham. Why do we need to prove anything? Navient knows who we are. Under the FTC " Holder Rule '' Navient is liable for giving predatory loans in connection with for-profit schools. Time is running out for Navient to do right by students who were scammed into taking out private loans to attend online for profit colleges who have committed misconduct and misrepresented themselves to the public to entice students to enroll. XXXX XXXX XXXX has sent a letter to Navient 's CEO asking to discharge these loans NOW! It's time Navient do the right thing and discharge all these predatory private loans made to attend online for profit schools NOW!

Consumer complaint narrative:
Thousands of students were scammed by Navient into taking out predatory private loans to attend for profit online schools such as the one I attended, The XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX. Because of the numerous claims of fraud and misconduct perpetrated by similar online for-profit schools, I was able to file a Borrower Defense claim with the Dept. of Education against The XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX, and my Federal loans were discharged in XXXX. 
My Borrower Defense Claim was also part of the XXXX Vs. XXXX settlement for which I was a full class member. 
I am aware that Navient was sued by XXXX state AGs regarding their predatory loans to attend these online for-profit schools and that Sallie Mae/Navient were a " preferred '' lending company in a " deal '' with these schools during the early XXXX XXXX ( I attended from XXXX ). 
I am aware of a " pilot '' program by which Navient is sending out " applications '' to select students who may have filed Borrower Defense claims against their schools and were approved. The notion of this application is frustrating to me. Why should I need to prove anything? Navient knows who we are. Under the FTC " Holder Rule '' Navient is liable for giving predatory loans in connection with online for-profit schools. I contacted Navient directly XX/XX/XXXX, and was not informed of any applications when I requested them. Instead, I was told that my loans were " going to be reviewed ''. I do not trust them with such a process, and do not feel like they have been forthright about a topic that should be very clear-cut. If my federal loans were discharged because my school committed misconduct, why are my private loans still in question? And, at the very least, why have they not prepared a plan to relieve these borrowers ( at least partially ) when the rulings against my school is nearly dating back a full year at this point? 
Senator XXXX XXXX has sent a letter to Navient 's CEO asking to discharge these loans. It's time Navient do the right thing and discharge all these predatory private loans made to attend online for profit schools.

Issue: Struggling to repay your loan
Sub-issue: Problem with your payment plan
Consumer complaint narrative: To : Consumer Complaint From : XXXX XXXX XXXX I am writing to file a complaint against Navient, the loan servicing company, regarding their persistent harassment and unfair practices in relation to my loans with the account # XXXX. My loans were originally XXXX  XXXX XXXX but were subsequently refinanced to Navient. The transition was motivated by need for a more flexible and reasonable payment plan. However, despite the refinancing and lacking the ability to pay {$2000.00} a month payments, Navient continued to harass both myself and my immediate family and extended family members, creating undue stress and hardship for us. I was contacted by Navient stated I need to consolidate my loans and I was placed with XXXX and I was promised a income driven payment plan. XXXX was unwilling to collaborate on establishing a livable monthly payment plan. Both Navient and XXXX insist on exorbitant monthly payments over {$2000.00} despite knowledge of my federal loans. This lack of cooperation and consideration has compelled me to seek a more reasonable arrangement. The primary issue I am reporting is the relentless and intrusive communication from Navient and XXXX. Navient has not only failed to be truthful about having me sign paperwork into consolidation with XXXX who is doing exactly the same thing with the same behavior as Navient. These proposed solutions not only fail to address my underlying issue but also risk exacerbating my already substantial debt by incurring additional unlivable interest. Furthermore, I have expressed the stress on my health and yet Navient has refused to explain why they transferred me into a worst predicament with XXXX. I kindly request that the Consumer Financial Protection Bureau conduct a thorough investigation into this matter and take appropriate action against Navient for their violation of fair debt collection practices. I believe my rights as a borrower are being egregiously disregarded and I trust that the Bureau will intervene to rectify this situation.

Issue: Struggling to repay your loan
Sub-issue: Problem with forgiveness, cancellation, or discharge
Consumer complaint narrative:
RE : School Misconduct/Predatory Loans XXXXXXXX/Earnest Account # XXXX I took out private loans through XXXX XXXX for my XXXX XXXXXXXX XXXX XXXX  XXXX ( years XXXXXXXX XXXX  ), owned by Career Education Corporation, in XXXX XXXX XXXX California. I have been making monthly payments on these loans for well over a decade, have never defaulted, and have already paid beyond my original principal amount. I consolidated my loans through XXXXXXXX XXXX XXXX. Ive included my most recent XXXX ( formerly XXXX XXXX ) statement. As you can see, these predatory loans have been hanging over my head for 20 years and will without relief despite recent court rulings continue for XXXX more. 

XXXX claims my debt is not eligible because it has been refinanced. They can rebrand their company and rebrand my loans as many times as they want, but the fact remains it is the exact same debt that others are getting discharged, and to punish me for being responsible about repayment is reprehensible. Of course, I expect them to seek out every loophole they can ; its how they operate, and its exactly why they have been ordered by courts to discharge so many students debt. The truth, which they acknowledge, is that they worked in conjunction with XXXX XXXX XXXX to mislead and defraud students, and that courts have already confirmed this as FACT. 

As demonstrated in the recent XXXX XXXX XXXX ruling, the school I attended during the years I attended has been found guilty of misconduct ( listed on the For-Profit School List on the XXXXXXXX XXXX  ). My story is similar to many students in the same boat : we were lied to and given false promises by recruiters and suckered into high-interest private loans through XXXX XXXX XXXX Of course the promised job placement never occurred. I received no help from the school, and in fact also discovered that theyd lied about regional accreditation. In short, like so many victims of XXXX XXXXXXXX XXXX XXXX XXXXXXXX, I was scammed. 

Because I did not default, I have not qualified for any of the settlements or lawsuits that have come up over the years directly pertaining to my XXXXXXXX XXXX, my years of attendance, and my exact XXXX XXXX loans. Recently, I was told I did not qualify for the XXXX AG Multi-State Settlement precisely because I had not defaulted. Ive been lucky in that many student debt groups have popped up in the wake of the XXXX decision ( XXXX XXXX, by the way, graduated from XXXX XXXX XXXX years after I did, so our stories could not be more similar ), including the Project on Predatory Student Lending, with whom I have also shared my story. 

It was on the XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX ( there are so many victims that we have multiple social media groups to keep each other abreast of the happenings ) run by XXXX XXXX that I first heard whispers of a pilot program to aid in discharging these predatory private loans, whispers that offered me the first faint glimmer of hope in 20 years. 

There is now established legal precedent that my school acting in conjunction with XXXX XXXX ( XXXX XXXX ) lied to XXXX deceived, and defrauded students. In my case, this debt has defined the last XXXX years of my life, and at XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX, trying to survive month to month, while my top financial priority each month is my loan payment. 

On XX/XX/XXXX the XXXX XXXX sent the department of education the XXXX XXXX XXXX : A Borrower 's Investigation details the specifics of the predatory nature of the school, including XXXX pages of evidence they have collected against XXXX and XXXX XXXX the borrowers themselves. The evidence comes from lawsuits, settlements, congressional testimony, and federal investigations. Furthermore, the Ask Letter cosigned by XXXX organizations including, XXXXXXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX and others collectively recommends the broad cancellation of all XXXX XXXX loans. 

I am filing a complaint for the Department of Education to take notice that the borrowers deserve to be made whole from a governmental system of oversight that has failed them.

Consumer complaint narrative:
XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX TX XXXX XXXX Cell : XXXX XX/XX/year> Navient XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX, PA XXXX Dear Customer Service Team, I am writing to formally request a review of my account and potential reimbursement concerning my federal student loans, given the recent settlement plan offered by Navient to borrowers in similar situations. While I have successfully paid off my private student loans, I believe that my experience with the associated federal loans warrants attention due to the following factors : 1. Excessive Interest Rates : Throughout my repayment period, I faced interest rates that were significantly higher than the average market rates, creating undue financial stress. 
XXXX. Limited Repayment Options : The repayment plans available to me were not adequately flexible to accommodate my changing financial circumstances during that time.

3. Insufficient Communication and Transparency : I often found the communication from my loan servicer lacking, making it difficult to navigate my repayment options and obligations effectively.

4. Customer Service Challenges : My interactions with customer service representatives were often unsatisfactory, characterized by long wait times and limited assistance in addressing my concerns. 
In light of these issues and the recent settlement plan from Navient, I respectfully request that my account be reviewed for potential reimbursement. I believe that addressing these concerns would reflect a commitment to the fair treatment of borrowers and enhance customer satisfaction. Thank you for your attention to this matter. I look forward to your prompt response and a resolution to my request. 

Sincerely, XXXX XXXX

Issue: Incorrect information on your report
Sub-issue: Account status incorrect
Consumer complaint narrative:
The issue is during when Navient was servicing the Loan. See attached file. 

You are in violation of the law! 

As per federal law and the FDCPA, regulation under the following 15 U.S.C. 1792 et seq.15 U.S.C . 1692g, you are not allowed to propagate misleading information. Currently Navient is knowingly making false and misleading statements about my student loan debt. 

As per the XXXX Emergency Relief and Student Loan guidance from the XXXX XXXX XXXX ; all XXXX XXXX XXXX owned loans are suspended from payments, collections and default from XXXX XX/XX/XXXX through XXXX XX/XX/XXXX. This is solidified in the Coronavirus Aid, Relief, and Economic Security ( CARES ) Act ( P.L. 116-136 ) and invocation of the Higher Education Relief Opportunities for Students Act of 2003 ( HEROES Act ). Based on these acts the XXXX XXXX XXXX put for the following policies : Accrual of interest on ED-held student loans and certain non-ED-held student loans was suspended from XX/XX/XXXX, through XX/XX/XXXX. 
ED-held loans were placed in a special administrative forbearance ( payment pause ) for XX/XX/XXXX, through XX/XX/XXXX. During this time, borrowers were not required to make payments on their loans. This special administrative forbearance counted toward the 120 monthly payments required to qualify for Public Service Loan Forgiveness ( PSLF ), the maximum repayment periods under the income-driven repayment ( IDR ) plans, and the nine voluntary payments required for individuals to rehabilitate their defaulted loans.

Debt collection activities, including involuntary collection activities such as wage garnishment and offset of certain federal benefits ( e.g., Social Security benefits ), were suspended on ED-held student loans for XX/XX/XXXX, through XX/XX/XXXX. 
Multiple rules related to the 120 monthly payments required to qualify for PSLF were waived.

A one-time revision was made to the accounts of borrowers with ED-held loans to provide credit toward the IDR plan maximum repayment period for any months in which they were in repayment status and for specified periods of deferment or forbearance.

My Navient student loans were owned by the XXXX XXXX XXXX ( proven by the XXXX XXXX XXXX  TDU approval ). As per court order ( CFPB vs Navient 2019 ) Navient has been banned from servicing student loans based on decades of systemic predatory and deceptive practices, my loans have been moved to another servicing agent. Navient is no longer responding to my verification requests.

Navient is still responsible for removing incorrect and inaccurate reporting information on my credit report, in accordance with federal law and the FDCPA.

As per CARES Act and HEROS Act any and all Navient late payment information from XXXX XX/XX/XXXX through XXXX XXXX is inaccurate and incorrect. Any and All late payment information from that time period needs to be removed immediately.

Issue: Struggling to repay your loan
Sub-issue: Bankruptcy
Consumer complaint narrative: I just found out the class action lawsuit regarding those borrowers who filed bankruptcy may be eligible for relief. I have told this lender on countless occasions this loan has tripled in the amount owed due to the daily compounded interest. The programs to keep my account current are useless as only a small minimum amount is going towards the principal while the majority of the payment goes to interest. This is a vicious cycle where if I don't make the minimum amount as set by the lender then anything less than is fruitless. These subprime tactics has not only caused me severe financial distress but my credit rating has lowered substantially. Agents have only offered the solution that I should generate more income by getting another job or changing professions to generate enough money to pay the various loans. This may be a valid statement but at the time intrusive about my career decisions. So agents have the ability to give out unsolicited advice?

Issue: Threatened to contact someone or share information improperly
Sub-issue: Contacted your employer
Consumer complaint narrative: In XXXX of 2024, I received a letter of Intent to Initiate Administrative Wage Garnishments Proceedings from Pioneer Credit Recovery. I responded to the letter by checking the box that stated that I was ineligible for wage garnishments because I was involuntarily laid off from my previous employer, and I was currently unemployed. I submitted a letter from my previous employer, and a hand-written letter from me stating that I was currently unemployed. I started a new job the last week of XX/XX/year> after submitting my response to pioneer. I received an identical letter of intent to initiate garnishments again in XXXX of 2024. I did not reply to this one since I had already replied to the one back in XXXX. In XXXX of 2024, my new employer received a wage garnishment order. He showed it to me. It was made to look like a court ordered garnishment, but did not look real. It did not have a judge 's signature nor an official seal. He asked me about it, and I told him that I had responded to the letter of intent back in XXXX. He has not been garnishing my wages. Back in XXXX of 2024 he tells me that Pioneer has been harassing him every single month via phone calls and letters demanding payments. Since, then I've been seeking legal advice on how to proceed forward. After several weeks, I finally received advice and I contacted Pioneer on XXXX XXXX, 2024. When I spoke to the initial receptionist, and I explained the problem, she told me that they did receive the letter from my previous employer, but that they did not received my response to the letter of intent. All the correspondence ( letters from me, previous employer and response to letter of intent ) were mailed in the same company provided envelope. She then transferred my call to the wage garnishment division where I spoke to another lady. I again explained my situation to her stating that I had responded to letter of intent back in XXXX of 2024. She claimed that Pioneer never sent me a letter of intent in XXXX of 2024. She claimed that the first letter they sent me was in XXXX of 2024, and that they had no correspondence from me. She offered to resend me the XXXX letter of intent again so that I can resubmit my response to which I agreed. I asked her to stop contacting my employer in the mean time and she said that she couldn't. She said the process was automated and that my employer was not complying with an official order.
Company public response: Company has responded to the consumer and the CFPB and chooses not to provide a public response

Consumer complaint narrative:
Consumer Financial Protection Bureau XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX Subject : Complaint Against Navient for Fraudulent Loan Consolidation Practices Dear CFPB Officer, I am writing to formally file a complaint against Navient regarding fraudulent and deceptive practices associated with the consolidation of my student loans. I believe I am a victim of misconduct and unfair treatment, which has resulted in financial hardship, stress, and confusion. 

Specific Issues with Navients Practices : 1. Fraudulent Consolidation Process : In XXXX, Navient encouraged me to consolidate my loans but failed to disclose all relevant details, including the associated interest rates and the true cost of consolidation. I was not made aware that the consolidation would ultimately increase my interest rate and overall financial burden. This lack of transparency constitutes a serious violation of my rights as a borrower. 
I discovered today, XX/XX/XXXX after speaking with XXXX who was the customer service rep with navient that in XXXX of XXXX a representative documented that I requested a consolidation on my student loans and submitted the paperwork to me even though I didn't request a consolidation. 


2. Unauthorized Signature by Third Party : Navient allowed my ex-partner to sign the consolidation documents on my behalf. As a result, I never had the opportunity to review or approve the final loan documentation. This unauthorized action deprived me of my right to informed consent. 


3. Misleading Discharge Notice : In XXXX, Navient issued a letter indicating that I did not owe payment on the loan because it was supposedly being discharged. At that time, I was under an income-based repayment plan. Unbeknownst to me, Navient converted the loan to forbearance without my approval, which compounded my debt further. It also made me ineligible to have my loan discharged. 


4. Current Payment Demand on a Fraudulent Loan : Despite the fraudulent handling of my consolidation, I have recently been informed that I owe {$1300.00} per month starting in XXXX. This new payment demand is both unjust and unsustainable, given the circumstances surrounding the origin and handling of the loan. 


5. Lack of Proper Disclosure by the University and Navient : I was never fully informed by either my university or Navient about the terms of the loan or consolidation, which was presented under false pretenses. I have also notified Navient of my lack of approval, but no corrective action has been taken.

6. Conflicting Information About Loan Repayment : I have documented proof that Navient representatives previously assured me that this loan would fall off my record by XXXX, and that I would not be required to make payments. I have now been informed that this is not the case, which adds to the confusion and points to a pattern of misinformation and negligence on Navients part.

I am providing this information to formally request that Navient be investigated for their actions and for relief from these fraudulent obligations. I believe that my case qualifies under the Borrower Defense to Repayment rule, given the misrepresentation and lack of disclosure at both the university and servicer level. 

I trust that the CFPB will take prompt action in holding Navient accountable and in ensuring that I receive the necessary relief. Please contact me if additional documentation or information is required. 

Thank you for your attention to this matter. 

Sincerely, XXXX XXXX
