XX/XX/2024 a Joint statement was released by the Department of Education it was a summary of Joint Investigations into the XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX and all of its For Profit Colleges. That Press release gave notice from multiple Government Entities and Investigations about the Misconduct the College engaged in with defrauding the Student Borrowers. I have been requesting information specifically in regards to the Holder Rule in my Loan Agreement since that Press Release was posted.

My dealings with Navient regarding my student loan that was for The XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX continues to give Navient more opportunity to give me false and misleading information about the Terms and Conditions of my Loan. I have sent them the FTC XXXX on the Holder Rule which is not hard to understand. I have been sent notices with information that does fall inline with Federal Law. In response to requests for the Holder Rule to be adhered to as it is mandated to be in the Loan Agreement they replied and I quote " It is important to understand that private student loans are nonfederal loans and the terms and conditions for private loans are set by the lender. '' Going off of the Guidelines Navient has no such authority to alter the terms and conditions in regards to the Holder Rule. By doing so they are violating the Holder Rule Notice Requirements while also breaching the loan contract. Navient keeps trying to gaslight me into believing they have the ability to deny the request by quoting a generic statement about their Loan Misconduct Form which doesn't fall inline with the Loan Agreement I have with them as it too violates the Terms and Conditions of The Holder Rule by injecting criteria that is only known by Navient. So Navient can reference vague criteria while not allowing for any kind of challenge trapping Borrowers in a loop of appeals while effectively being useless and doing nothing to help those Borrowers who are trying to get relief on Loans that were to Predatory For Profit Colleges. 
I notified Navient of Employee misconduct in regards to an employee relaying false information about the Press Release as well on XX/XX/2024 where I asked again about the Holder Rule while being coerced into their School Misconduct Application Scheme. I was not given a response on that misconduct or notified of any information regarding that misconduct nor the intitial Press Release in the form of a fraudalent substitution I am given a corporate phrase which sums up to they believe they have authorities that are not found in my Loan Agreement that such decisions are proprietary. I am getting rather annoyed with this behavior.

Issue: Dealing with your lender or servicer
Sub-issue: Received bad information about your loan
Consumer complaint narrative:
I am writing to formally request the discharge of all student loans held by Navient due to the companys deceptive practices, misrepresentation, and failure to provide proper guidance regarding my loan repayment options. 

Navient misled me by steering me away from income-driven repayment plans, which would have made my payments more affordable and eligible for eventual forgiveness. Instead, I was repeatedly encouraged to enter forbearance or deferment, causing my loan balance to increase substantially due to capitalized interest. As a result, my loan balance has now grown far beyond the original amount borrowed, further compounding the financial strain. 

Additionally, Navient has misreported my payment status to credit agencies, damaging my credit score. Their representatives have provided misleading information, denying my requests for information on public service loan forgiveness programs that I may have been eligible for. This has delayed my ability to pursue more favorable repayment options and contributed to the overwhelming amount of accrued debt. 

These deceptive practices are consistent with the widespread fraudulent behavior for which Navient has faced legal action from multiple states and the Consumer Financial Protection Bureau ( CFPB ). The companys actions have caused me significant financial harm, mental distress, and an unjust long-term burden. 

Given the impact of Navients misconduct, I am requesting a full discharge of all related student loans. As a borrower who relied on Navients guidance in good faith, I believe I am entitled to relief from this unjust financial situation. I ask that my loans be fully forgiven due to the unlawful practices I have endured. 

Thank you for your consideration. 

XXXX XXXX XXXX ( XXXX XXXX

I took out Private student loans for my 2 daughters starting in XXXX. There were 4 loans total, totaling {$59000.00}. The last disbursement was XX/XX/XXXX. I have been paying these 4 loans nearly 20 years now. I have {$24000.00} to go. On these loans, I have or will pay over {$37000.00} in interest alone. 

During these years of dealing with both companies, they have applied payments to the wrong account, received payment and not applied it, and then contacting me of my account being late. Example, last week I had a payment I submitted online 4 days before the due date. I got a call at work, which I did not appreciate. They told me that they had not received my payment, and I am late and need to make it now. I informed them I did make the payment, and did not appreciate them calling me at work. The next day, I called Navient, and they confirmed that they had received it, and had not applied it yet as they can hold onto it for 10 days. 

Even though they have been sued, it appears that they are still performing the methods. 

XXXX XXXX was even worse. To the point of exasperation at times. In the last almost 20 years they put my loans into Capitalized interest payments only 11 times. Yes, this has drawn out the amount of time I have spent paying these off. However, I thought it a good alternative at the time since it would give me a break in my monthly payments even for a short time. 

I have considered if there are any other options, such as, I have paid the original cost of the loan plus interest in full, can I get some sort of reprieve. But according to what I have read, none of that applies to Private Student Loans. 

I am XXXX years old and still working, in part because of these loans.

Issue: Getting a loan
Sub-issue: Loan opened without my consent or knowledge
Consumer complaint narrative:
I was defrauded by XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXXSALLIE Mae/Navient . 
I attended the the school XX/XX/year> for approximately 2 months ( if that ). I withdrew shortly after arriving ( without a loan ). I quickly discovered the school representatives lied to me about retainment, job placement, accreditation, qualifications of staff, degree transfer, amongst many other things. At the time of my withdrawal i did not have a loan pulled, I was promised I would receive a loan by myself with funds going directly to me. I spoke to the financial dept. and the president of the school at the time of my withdrawal stating I did not have a loan and I was revoking any consent given prior as they had defrauded me. 

A loan was taken after I left the school. 

Sallie Mae/Navient refused to do anything when i reported the loan was taken without my consent or that of the cosigner. We were guaranteed no loan would be taken. Instead A loan was processed at a extremely high interest rate. I was not given proper communication, was overcharged and not given options for deferment and repayment. Under The Holder Rule Navient/Sallie Mae are equally responsible for the fraud that occurred.

Issue: Struggling to repay your loan
Sub-issue: Can't get other flexible options for repaying your loan
Consumer complaint narrative:
I have paid Navient Student loans for almost 20 years ( beginning in XXXX of 2009 ) and have paid nearly {$180000.00} for an original {$60000.00} student loan. For the first 10-years all of my payments were interest only but I did not know that. I was advised to get into an income-based repayment from a Navient rep but they did not ever disclose to me that the payments were not going towards my principal. Furthermore- Navient doesn't provide monthly or annual statements showing what you've paid through the years. I have to review my own personal bank statements for the past 25 years to calculate my full payments. No other operating loan company doesn't provide this information. 

Below are the entire list of my complaints against Navient : Misleading borrowers about income-driven repayment plans : Navient failed to adequately notify borrowers who enrolled in income-driven repayment plans about the requirement to annually recertify their enrollment. Borrowers were not properly notified that submitting an incorrect or incomplete application to recertify their enrollment could lead to an increase in their monthly payments and delay loan cancellation. 

Botching payment processing : Many borrowers had multiple student loans with varying interest rates and monthly payments. When borrowers made payments meant to cover multiple loans, Navient misallocated payments. Navient also misapplied payments made to a particular loan. These errors resulted in late fees, interest accrual, and negative credit reporting. 

Harming the credit of XXXX borrowers, including severely injured veterans : Navient tarnished the credit reports of borrowers who had received a discharge on their federal student loans due to a total and permanent XXXX. 

Deceiving borrowers about XXXX requirements for cosigner release : Navient made representations to private loan borrowers that if they paid down their loans in a certain way, they could apply for their cosigners to be released. But Navient did not honor those representations for some borrowers. 

Misleading borrowers about improving credit scores and the consequences of federal student loan rehabilitation : For federal student loan borrowers whose loans went into default, XXXX debt collection arm promised credit reporting relief to borrowers if they completed a rehabilitation program. Navient failed to deliver on all of the promised relief.

Issue: Dealing with your lender or servicer
Sub-issue: Received bad information about your loan
Consumer complaint narrative:
I am writing to formally request the discharge of all student loans held by Navient, due to a pattern of deceptive practices, inaccurate information, misrepresentation, and failure to provide proper guidance regarding my student loan repayment options. 

Throughout my experience with Navient, I have encountered several issues that have led me to question the integrity of the practices employed by your organization. Specifically, I have received contradictory and misleading information regarding my loan terms, which has impeded my ability to manage my repayment effectively. 

Moreover, unexpected fees have been applied to my account without adequate explanation, further complicating my financial obligations. I was also informed that I could not release my co-signer from the loan, which contradicts prior communications I received suggesting that co-signer release options might be available. This misrepresentation has caused significant distress and confusion. 

Given these troubling experiences, I believe that the management of my loans has not adhered to the standards of transparency and ethical practice that borrowers deserve. As such, I am requesting a full discharge of my student loans serviced by Navient. 

I kindly ask for a prompt investigation into my account, a detailed response addressing my concerns, and information regarding the process for discharging my loans. I believe it is crucial that borrowers are treated with fairness and respect, and my current situation compels me to take this formal action. 

Thank you for your attention to this serious matter. I look forward to your timely response.

Issue: Struggling to repay your loan
Sub-issue: Can't get other flexible options for repaying your loan
Consumer complaint narrative:
I am failing a complaint because I am desperately in need of assistance. I attended the XXXX XXXX of XXXX between XXXX. The school closed down XX/XX/XXXX due to school misconduct. The enrollment process was rushed. I mis-informed about the financial aspect, the job opportunities and rate, company connections, and that XXXX be equipped to start my career as an advertiser. One of the biggest issues, is the private student loans. During XXXX, I wasnt informed there will be any federal funding issues covering my school expenses. Once I XXXX  and XXXX XXXX XXXX, everything was fine. After my semester, I was informed I didnt have enough federal loans so I should get a co signer or apply for private loans. I was unable to get a co-signer so they made it seem my only option was private loans. Details pertaining the private loans was not explained to me, wasnt discussed. I was just told I needed to apply to stay enrolled and to sign the documents. That process was also rushed. I was highly confused as to why I needed assistance from the private student loans when XXXX  didnt mention there wasnt enough government funding. Now that I am an adult and viewed my loans, and only XXXX private loans was requested. These private loans were dispersed from XXXX. 

Ive been struggling to make payments ever since. XXXX there was a recession and no one was hiring. Companies turned my portfolio and application down stating I didnt have the credentials or the experience. Some stated The XXXX XXXX XXXX  doesnt prepare you for success. 

XX/XX/XXXX, I lost my job and had a baby. I had no income at all. I called Navient ( private ) and explained my situation. I was informed by the agent, that there was nothing I can apply for. I ran out of forbearance XX/XX/XXXX and had to make payments. I informed her that I didnt have a flow of income and was living off savings trying to take care of my new born and I couldnt go to work due to XXXX. She informed me, that since Ive been paying all this time, that I can find the money from somewhere, that I am lying. If I dont pay, XXXX be sued. I have never been spoken too so rudely, in a dire situation, seeking assistance. I called them to file a complaint on the employee and was just informed they will take care of it but I had to still make the payments. 

Since then Ive made all the payments I could to sustain my credit and not being sued. My credit plummeted and my living situation was terrible. I worked hard to be re-employed and managed to bring up my credit score in hopes of a better life for myself and child. 

XX/XX/XXXX, I was informed I will have to pay over {$760.00} dollars monthly. I informed them, I dont have the funds to pay the high bill that I was already struggling and trying to find a way to get it lowered because my savings have been exhausted. I recently had to move and shelter expenses/childcare expenses are extremely expensive. Food has even quadrupled in price. 

I started searching and found that my school closed due to misconduct. I called and asked for the Misconduct form. I was first told it would be mailed to me. I waited and didnt receive it. I called back a 10 days later to check if its been mailed but it wasnt. I was able to get it after about request but had to log into the online portal, print it out, then mail it to them. I mailed the form in XX/XX/XXXX. I received a denial letter which didnt explain the reason for denial. It just stated I didnt meet the qualifications. I tried calling the number on the letter and couldnt reach no one. I was forwarded immediately to a voicemail message. I left several messages and no one contacted me back. 

The rates due the loans had increased to XXXX % and had me in a loop with no hopes of ever paying it with high demands of monthly payments. 

I called Navient and spoke to an agent who was not part of the misconduct team that handles the application and she stated to me that the misconduct had nothing to do with the private loans that its not suitable for being discharged. That I would have to lose my job but when I lost my job they didnt help me or state I could get my loans discharged. That I need to have proof that they personally did anything leading to predatory lending towards me, personally, dealing with the school. There were no options according to the agent. That was the whole point of putting in the school misconduct form, its one of their options listed on their application. Thats the purpose of it. 

I tried everything possible to pay them. I cant even file for bankruptcy because they are the reason for my hardship. They are refusing to discharge the loans no matter the situation. Even though I was falsely mislead. I dont have any proof because it was long ago and I lost everything after I graduated. I only had a suitcase with clothes. No prior emails work. I no longer have a student account. My XXXX account in which I was receiving school information was hacked into and unrecoverable. The school is closed and I cant get any information. There are no flyers or any information from that time. Just my testimony, as well as, all the other students testimony and lawsuits. I know I am not the only one. Some of them were able to provide evidence. 

The amount they are asking me to pay will leave me homeless once again. I am reaching out desperately seeking assistance. According to the agent, with my income, I am not eligible for hardship. Unfortunately, they do not factor in living expenses or childcare expenses. 

After all these years of making payments since XXXX, I owe {$67000.00} when I started off approximately {$42000.00} of private loans. 
Please help

Consumer complaint narrative:
On XXXX XXXX XXXX, I sent a debt validation document request in writing via certified mail to Navient my federal student loan servicer. I requetsed all the documents in Navient 's possession concering their serving of my federal student loan, including but not limited to all documents executed by me and their valid serving agreement with my original lender. Navient refused to comply with that request. On XXXX XXXX XXXX, Navient errenously responsed by letter in reponse to my validation of debt by documents request stating " I did not give them enough information for a credit reporting investigation ''. My original request was not a credit reporting dispute request. It was a letter in response to a letter I received from them with imprpoer accounting attached to it. 

To date, I have not received any of validation documents, I requested on XXXX XXXX XXXXXX/XX/year>. Navient is now COMPLETELY BANNED FROM SERVIING FEDERAL STUDENT LOANS. However they have not cease collection efforts : The law clearly states If the creditor can not validate the debt, they must cease all collection efforts until proper validation is provided. As of today Navient is not only continuing to claim they have the right to service my federal student loan by reporting this unvalidated debt on my credit report. I am also still receiving harassing letters from Navient and phone calls from the company attempting to collect a debt. They reported on my credit report the day after CFPB settlement was made public. Making it evident Navient 's bad acts against borrowers has NOT been detered by the action recently taken against them. They know they are banned from servicing Federal student loans, yet they uniltaerally are ruining borrowers credit by reporting information to the 3 major credit companies errenously as the servicer with legal right to do so.

Issue: Dealing with your lender or servicer

Consumer complaint narrative:
I am XXXX of thousands of students that were scammed by Navient/Sallie Mae into taking out predatory private loans to attend a now-defunct, for-profit schoolXXXX XXXX XXXX. 

In XXXX the XXXX, the parent company of XXXX XXXX, was investigated and settled in a whistleblower suit for XXXX XXXX dollars to the tune of XXXX XXXX which is less than XXXX % of the original suit. They were found to be guilty of predatory recruitment and illegal recruiting practices across XXXX states and Washington, D.C., and numerous lawsuits alleging fraud. XXXX XXXX XXXX Part of those accusations included XXXX  XXXX XXXX. They were found to be lying about total costs, accreditation, and were also investigated for distorted program costs and job placement rates, and giving admission recruiters bonuses for getting more student to sign up. 

I experienced this in XXXX when signing up. The recruiter showed us costs, and the breakdown of how long it would take us to pay back the loans, with promises of a XXXX-year repayments, and a total tuition rate. I later found out all this was false, as my total after school was almost double the cost for the associates degree. In the late XXXX when trying to transfer to a local community college, I found no credits would transfer. I was stuck at this school. Some semesters I didnt know if Id be able to continue. We would get pink slips on the first day telling us we would be counted absent and asked to leave the campus unless we went down to request more financial aid. Why did I need more aid? Wasnt the amount I was told I needed the amount? They were getting us to sign up for more and more aid. Instead of having XXXX loan with an interest rate, I now have multiple Navient loans with high, variable rates, that Navient, XXXX and the XXXX would profit from. 

After finally leaving the campus, without graduating due to running out of funds and not being able to request more loans, career advisors also sent us XXXX job postings, or applications to XXXX so it would qualify as the print industry. There is a XXXX article outlining personal stories that sum up the average experience for students, and the lies we were told. XXXX of those students I attended XXXX with and we have very similar experiences. 

When leaving school, with no degree, I had {$60000.00} dollars in the original amount borrowed without compound interest. Now, over XXXX  years later of making full, on-time payments ranging from $ XXXX {$1100.00}, I am still sitting with {$65000.00} of loans. I have more than paid back my original loan amount. 

Which brings me to my next complaint. I also am XXXX of the students who were completely disregarded when Navient was sued by the CFPB for. Misallocated payments, steering struggling borrowers toward multiple forbearances instead of income-driven repayment plans, providing unclear information about how to re-enroll in income-driven repayment plans and how to qualify for a co-signer release. When this lawsuit happened, because I began making full, on-time payments and my loans we in good standing. I was left out of this suit. 

I was also lied to about repayment options and forced into multiple forbearances early in repayment by Navient, and was lied to about co-signer release. I have a previous CFPB complaint for this ( XXXX ). They should have record of this conversation where I called in to request the information for cosigner release and was lied to. I called to ask what was needed for me to release my co-signer was told I needed a credit check, proof of income, and I would need to make XXXX years of full, on-time payments to qualify for co-signer release. I then enrolled in auto-payments. AFTER making the XXXX  years of {$1100.00} payments, I was informed by Navient I could not have her released because I did not have a degree. Even though I met the qualifications I was initially told by their customer reps. I got a generic copy and paste response to my initial complaint and it was closed with no resolution. 

They also denied my ability to increase my monthly auto-draft to help re-pay these loans quicker. I was told I could not increase the amount or it would un-enroll me from the interest rate reduction program. I also filed a separate complaint about this, which was closed as a duplicate complaint but it was not ( XXXX ). I also have had issues with Navient refusing to send me paper statements. I have had to call multiple times to request they send them. I have recordings of these conversations. And now, they havent been sending them for XXXX years since the last time I reached out asking them to. I do this to protect myself from wrongly charged amounts and to watch them for illegal practices. 

Because of the numerous claims of fraud and misconduct perpetrated by these online for profit schools, such as XXXX and XXXX XXXX XXXX, I was able to file a XXXX XXXX claim with the Dept. of Education against XXXX XXXXXXXX XXXX, and my Fed. loans of around {$42000.00} were discharged. My XXXX XXXX Claim was also part of the Sweet Vs. Cardona settlement for which I was a full class member. 

I am aware that Navient was sued by XXXX state AGs regarding their predatory loans to attend these online for-profit schools and that Sallie Mae/Navient were a " preferred '' lending company in a " deal '' with these schools during the early XXXX 's. These private loans with a high risk of default were part of a package deal offered to for profit schools. But loans made to students in states outside of the agreement, or those who were not in default for XXXX months or more during a " specific '' time frame, were excluded. I am sure this was a big win for Navient, but what a sham of a settlement deal for the rest of borrowers scammed into taking loans to at least XXXX for profit online schools. 

After the AG settlement, didn't Navient also get out of the Federal student loan business due to scrutiny from lawmakers and borrower advocates? Didn't Navient have to pay restitution to the Federal student loan borrowers for not informing students of XXXX payments students could have enrolled in, but instead steered toward forbearance? Furthermore, hasn't Navient been sued at least a XXXX XXXX  times for other predatory loan practices and illegal collection practices? 

I am also aware of a " pilot '' program by which Navient is sending out " applications '' to select students who may have filed XXXX XXXX claims against their schools and were approved. This application is a sham. Why do we need to prove anything? Navient knows who we are. Under the FTC " Holder Rule '' Navient is liable for giving predatory loans in connection with for-profit schools. Time is running out for Navient to do right by students who were scammed into taking out private loans to attend online for profit colleges who have committed misconduct and misrepresented themselves to the public to entice students to enroll. XXXX XXXX XXXX has sent a letter to Navient 's CEO asking to discharge these loans NOW! It's time Navient do the right thing and discharge all these predatory private loans made to attend online for profit schools NOW!

Consumer complaint narrative:
I have a checking account with XXXX, and have used it to auto-pay bills for my student loan for around 8 years with no problems. Then, all the sudden, I got a notice from XXXX in XXXX that my XXXX payment to Navient was rejected. I had not made any changes to how the bill was being paid, nor had I changed the account number for the payment. 

I called Navient to find out why it was rejected, and the agent told me to wait several weeks while they investigated, and that I should wait to pay my bill until they determined the problem. I asked whether that would be an issue, since it would be a late payment, but the agent told me it would be fine since my account was being investigated. Navient eventually claimed that my bank provided the wrong account number, and that they refunded my payment to my XXXX XXXX account. I do not have, nor have I ever had, a XXXX XXXX account. I called them again and told them I don't have a XXXX XXXX account, my bank used the correct account number, and I asked them to clarify and to provide evidence that XXXX made the mistake. They never sent proof, and only resent the exact same message from before ( my bank used the wrong account number and my payment was refunded to XXXX XXXX ). 

I paid my bill, which, at this point was late. This led to Navient removing my interest rate reduction for good payment history. I have repeatedly tried to get information from XXXX XXXX, XXXX XXXX XXXX, Office of the Customer Advocate at XXXX XXXX XXXX  but all she tells me is garbage like " While we understand why this matter is important to you, we do not have additional details to share at this time. '' She has been dragging her feet, waiting for my loan to get transferred to XXXX ( since Navient has been barred from handling student loans for prior fraud ), so that she doesn't have to deal with it. 

They are incompetent, and fraudulently charging me penalties on my loan because I followed their own directions ( wait to pay the bill until they figured out what happened ). If they're doing it to me, then they are most likely doing it to other borrowers as well.

Consumer complaint narrative:
I have been in repayment of my student loan ( FFELP ) for 35 years. The loan has been serviced by Sallie Mae and by Navient, and was transferred to XXXX, effective XX/XX/XXXX. I have been enrolled in an income-based repayment plan for some time now, after I spent many, many years in either deferment or forbearance programs offered through Navient. I was guided into forbearance and deferment due to financial hardships but was never informed by Sallie Mae or Navient that other income based programs were available to me. I borrowed {$27000.00}, and the loan was consolidated in XXXX at 9 % interest. Over the past 35 years, I have repaid approximately {$82000.00} on the loan, but I still owe upwards of {$140000.00}. 
I am now XXXX XXXX XXXX, work for myself part-time as a social worker and collect social security. I have never been able to own my own home because of the debt I carry from my still-growing student loan debt. I hoped that I might qualify for some forgiveness but having a FFELP loan always complicated my attempts to enter a loan-forgiveness program, even when I applied to enter the loan forgiveness program around XXXX or XXXXXXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX  but denied due to my having a FFELP. I contacted Navient to ask about loan forgiveness. I was sent an application to apply for the Public Service Loan Forgiveness program. I was told that I would have to have my loan refinanced and apply. I am self-employed and do not work for non-profits, the government or agency-setting that meets the criteria for the loan forgiveness program. Moreover, I do not want to re-finance a {$270000.00} that has ballooned to {$140000.00} That sad part, for me, is that I will die before this loan will ever be paid off.

Product: Credit reporting or other personal consumer reports
Issue: Improper use of your report
Sub-issue: Reporting company used your report improperly
Consumer complaint narrative:
NAVIENT IS ILLEGALLY REPORTING THE SAME ACCOUNT 3 TIMES FOR DIFFERENT AMOUNTS. NAVIENT FAILS TO PRODUCE THAT THEIR REPORTING MECHANISMS ARE NOT DEFAULTED OR THERE IS NO DEFAULT IN THEIR REPORTING MECHANISMS. 
NAVIENT XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX, DE XXXX XX/XX/2024 ACCOUNT : XXXX This letter is to formally request that you cease and desist from reporting false late payment information to credit bureaus and other reporting agencies. It has come to my attention that you have inaccurately marked my account as being late on payments, which has had a negative impact on our credit score. 
I demand removal of this late payment. I demand you to furnish evidence that your reporting mechanism is not defaulted or there is no default in your reporting mechanism. It is an unfair act for late payments to be reported. It is a violation of the law, invasion of privacy, Pursuant to 16 CFR 444.4 It is an Unfair act of practice.

Pursuant to FDCPA Late payments must be verified/ validated prior to them being placed on a consumers report. Please furnish evidence and proof not statements on how you verified the late debt. Statements are hearsay in the court of law. 
Who did you speak to? 
License number? 

Systems have outages all of the time. Please do not send any statements. I will question the authenticity of any statements sent. I demand removal for failure to produce the reporting mechanism. It is alleged until it can be proven. With no supporting evidence it must come off the report. 
Please move forward with the above request. Failure to complete request I will sue for each violation not limited to but including reporting information without my consent, invading my privacy, and defamation of character under permissible purpose ( 15 usc 1681 ) We trust that you will rectify this mistake promptly and ensure that our credit report reflects accurate and up-to-date information moving forward. 

Sincerely, XXXX XXXX

Since the end of XX/XX/2024, I have been informed of one problem with my income information after another, and have been asked to provide clarity on my income information. The length of time this has required ( because of how long it takes Navient to process information ) has led to exceeding the expiration date of my previous IBR plan and now threatens to increase my payment by a factor of 8, even though my income has remained the same. This is not fair. I need Navient to stop taking their time with processing my information and update my payment amount to reflect a new IBR plan. I have given them everything they have asked for very promptly, but they seem to be dragging their feet. Since I submitted my application well before the previous IBR plan expired, and the delay is only a paperwork issue, I should not have to wait this long and risk needing to have my loans placed in forebearance ( and accrue unnecessary interest at my expense ) when the delay is Navient 's fault.

Consumer complaint narrative: Navient has consistently been deceptive. Loans should be resolved. Administrative forbearances were placed on private loans for years without my knowledge or consent. Issue: Dealing with your lender or servicer
Sub-issue: Trouble with how payments are being handled
Consumer complaint narrative:
On XX/XX/XXXX, I submitted form XXXX to Navient Corporation for the settlement of account number XXXX for the full balance on the account of {$9700.00}. On XX/XX/XXXX, I received a correspondence from Navient via mail which confirmed that they received my XXXX form which was presented to discharge my outstanding debt. Navient went on further to state they were not accepting my XXXX form because it was not for the full amount when indeed it was. 

According to UCC 3-603, If tender of payment of an amount due on an instrument is made to a person entitled to enforce the instrument, the obligation of the obligor to pay interest after the due date on the amount tendered is discharged. In other words, when my payment was submitted and received for the full amount on XX/XX/XXXX any additional interest charges should not have been applied to my account and the full balance should have been paid to reflect a XXXX balance. 

The debt for this account has already been paid in full upon submission of form XXXX, in which Navient admitted they received in XX/XX/XXXX. Pursuant to UCC 3-603, If tender of payment of an obligation to pay an instrument is made to a person entitled to enforce the instrument and the tender is refused, there is discharge, to the extent of the amount of the tender, of the obligation of an indorser or accommodation party having a right of recourse with respect to the obligation to which the tender relates. Navient is in direct violation of the law with respect to my tender of payment! I demand the tendered payment in the amount of {$9700.00} be applied to account number XXXX to satisfy the outstanding debt to reflect a {$0.00} balance. I will take action on said violations if this is not resolved immediately!

Issue: Getting a loan
Sub-issue: High pressure sales tactics or recruiting
Consumer complaint narrative:
I began as a student at XXXXXXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXXXXXX in XXXX, an XXXX XXXX campus from XXXX. Upon touring the campus I met with a representiative who was moving very quickly in rattling off facts about student success rates, graduation job search advantages through the XXXX alumni network, how qualified the professors were etc. I am the first in my family to go to college and upon showing interest they immediately had me in the financial aid office getting me set up with pell grants and federal loans and then telling me that if awarded it still would not be enough so I would most likely need private loans as well. After learning that I was approved for federal loans and grants I took the information back to them and wanted to know what the balance to cover would be. They moved very fast and got me signed up for private loans to cover the balance and told me not to worry about the interest rates because those flucuate ( XXXX of my loans had a 14 % interest rate ). They signed hovered and insisted that in order to get into the fall semester that was coming up becuase the registration due date was approaching that I should do this now to esnure my placement in the school. For the next XXXX years each semester somehow there were balances between all of my loans and the tuition that would require additional private loans. Also, it should be noted, the professors and education provided was subpar at best. After 2 years of feeling like this campus was ripping me off and hearing that my credits would transfer to any accredited school, and absolutely would transfer to another XXXX campus, I made the decesion to look around for other schools. It was at this time that I realized they had lied as almost no other school with the program I was in would accept even half of my credits, so I was pigeonholed into finding another XXXX  campus to transfer to. 
In XXXX I moved to XXXXXXXX XXXX to help take care of some family members and chose this as there was an XXXX  campus in XXXX, XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX. I met with the school and learned that several of my credits would not transfer and I would have to retake the courses... this of course requiring more money. Again I was brough into a financial aid/ advisors office and was being fed the lines of how successfull the students who graduate this particular campus are, how they are acredited in my field of study, how they have a robust alumni network etc. Then again, the same pressure to begin in the spring semester as " we are running out of space '' was put on me and I found myself signed up again for more federal and private loans. During my time at this campus several professors had left, many students dropped out, and about XXXX before I was set to graduate was told that there was a balance descprepancy and I owed yet another XXXX but instead of applying for a loan I could just go on a payment plan right there at the campus through their office. I was a server at the time so I lived off from tips and shouldve known something was up when they accepted cash for any installment payment I made at the financial aid office. Upon graduating in spring of XXXX I was so burnt out and disheartend with my education through The XXXX XXXX that I chose to not attend and to have them just mail me my diploma ..... WHICH THEY NEVER DID, ONLY MY TRANSCRIPTS. I have been fighting with them ever since to get a copy of my diploma. 
After graduating my loans were serviced by XXXX XXXX, whos representatives worked with me to keep my payments on hold for as long as possible. After this period I had to start making payments and was quickly overwhelmed as now the reality of the interest rates that I was locked into was hitting me. My initial total in princepal loans had doubled in just my time at the school, and at the rates I was locked in at would continually balloon into something that would cause me to be homeless and every paycheck go to just paying interest alone. Once they sold the loans to XXXX, I was met with several representatives who said there was nothing I could do, there was no option to refinance, there was no income based repayment option that I could qualify for so the only option was to put the loans into forbearance .... And this was the cycle they pulled for months. 
After the lawsuite against XXXX established that they used predatory recruiting and lending tactics I knew that I was absolutely a victim of this and wanted retribution. I filed several application with the Borrowers Defense Fund, XXXX in XXXX, XXXX in XXXX, and XXXX again recently in XXXX after the lawsuit information was made public. My federal loans have been discharged and the XXXX campus and I belive all campus ' closed. I contacted XXXX for the application to have my private loans discharged as a result of the schools predatory methods and was told that " our systems are down today, call back later so we can look into this '' and this happened several times with new excuses everytime ; " we have an influx of applications and are only sending them out to people who qaulify '' " Private student loans can not be discharged '' and now they have been sold off to a company by the name of Mohela that is telling me this is not an option no matter the lawuit or predatory methods the XXXX XXXX used while I was attending.

Issue: Dealing with your lender or servicer
Sub-issue: Received bad information about your loan
Consumer complaint narrative:
I am submitting this formal complaint to request the discharge of my student loans held by Navient due to their deceptive practices, misrepresentation, and failure to provide appropriate guidance regarding loan repayment options. 

Over the years, I have experienced significant financial hardship due to capitalized interest, which led to my loan balance ballooning far beyond the original amount borrowed. Navients actions have included payment errors, mishandling of forbearance requests, and incorrect assessment of late fees. Furthermore, Navient has consistently misreported my payment status to credit agencies, which has caused severe damage to my credit score. Their representatives provided misleading information that prevented me from accessing better repayment options, leaving me with a growing and insurmountable debt. 

Additionally, I was unaware that by refinancing my loans with Earnest, I was still ultimately tied to Navient, which I feel was part of their deceptive tactics. These actions align with the widespread fraudulent behavior for which Navient has faced lawsuits from numerous states and investigations by the Consumer Financial Protection Bureau ( CFPB ). 

Navients conduct has inflicted financial harm, mental distress, and a burdensome debt that could have been avoided with transparent and fair treatment. As someone who trusted Navients guidance during an economically vulnerable period, I believe I deserve relief. I am therefore requesting the full forgiveness of my loans. 

Thank you for considering my request. I urge the CFPB to take prompt and decisive action to hold Navient accountable and provide meaningful relief to borrowers like myself.

Consumer complaint narrative:
15 USC 1681 section 604 a section 2 states that " In general Subject to subsection ( c ), any consumer reporting agency may furnish a consumer report under the following circumstances and no other : in accordance with the written instructions of the consumer to whom it relates. '' Navient, the financial institution and the Consumer reporting agencies XXXX, XXXX, and XXXX do not have my consent to furnish this information and they surely do not have my written consent. 

Per the FCRA, as a federally protected consumer, I am now opting out of any and all authorization that I, the consumer, may have given you that was written, unwritten, verbal, or nonverbal per 15 USC 6802. Any and all consent to XXXX, XXXX, XXXX, and Navient whether it be verbal, non-verbal, written, implied or otherwise is revoked. According to 12 CFR 1016.7 states that " A consumer may exercise the right to opt out at any time. '' I am opting out of your reporting services.

Consumer complaint narrative:
Thousands of students were scammed by Navient into taking out predatory private loans to attend for profit online schools such as the one I attended, ( insert your school here ). As a matter of fact, ( school name ) was investigated by ( insert your story here ).

Because of the numerous claims of fraud and misconduct perpetrated by these online for profit schools, such as ( your school ), I was able to file a Borrower Defense claim with the Dept. of Education against ( your school ), and my Fed. loans of ( $ dollar amount ) were discharged and my credit repaired. 
My Borrower Defense Claim was also part of the XXXX XXXX XXXX  settlement for which I was a full class member. 
I am aware that Navient was sued by XXXX state AGs regarding their predatory loans to attend these online for-profit schools and that Sallie Mae/Navient were a " preferred '' lending company in a " deal '' with these schools during the early 2000 's. These private loans with a high risk of default were part of a package deal offered to " for profit online schools ''. But loans made to students in states outside of the agreement, or those who were not in default for 7 months or more during a " specific '' time frame, were excluded. I am sure this was a big win for Navient, but what a sham of a settlement deal for the rest of borrowers scammed into taking loans to at least XXXX for profit online schools. After the AG settlement, didn't Navient also get out of the Federal student loan business due to scrutiny from lawmakers and borrower advocates? Didn't Navient have to pay restitution to the Federal student loan borrowers for not informing students of IDR/IBR payments students could have enrolled in, but instead steered toward forbearance? Furthermore, hasn't Navient been sued at least a half dozen times for other predatory loan practices and illegal collection practices? 
I am also aware of a " pilot '' program by which Navient is sending out " applications '' to select students who may have filed Borrower Defense claims against their schools and were approved. This application is a sham. Why do we need to prove anything? Navient knows who we are. Under the FTC " Holder Rule '' Navient is liable for giving predatory loans in connection with online for-profit schools. Time is running out for Navient to do right by students who were scammed into taking out private loans to attend online for profit colleges who have committed misconduct and misrepresented themselves to the public to entice students to enroll. XXXX XXXX XXXX has sent a letter to Navient 's CEO asking to discharge these loans NOW! It's time Navient do the right thing and discharge all these predatory private loans made to attend online for profit schools NOW!

Consumer complaint narrative:
I was pressured into taking out private loans through Navient to attend XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX  The loans started on XXXX now with a Total Current BalanceXXXX XXXX.
I was informed that if I didn't take out loans I could no longer attend school because that was the only way I would be able to graduate. Given that XXXX  was a private school I could not transfer my credits to another, creditable school to finish out my degree. Seeing as this was the only way to obtain a degree, I had no choice but to sign the loans only to have XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX  close their doors before I was able to graduate. So, as you can see, with the amount of money I owe and how high the payments are, I've only been able to make small payments or Navient would take legal action against me. I've been threatened that if I didn't make payments I could lose everything. I've been told that if I didn't make payments I would be taken to court and sued. I've been hung up on while trying to explain my situation that I can't afford to make payments especially while unemployed. I've been told, oh well, when talking about how it seems unfair to be making payments for loans taken out by a school that no longer exists and is discredited and is facing multiple lawsuits. The amount of pressure put on me by the school made it seem like I had no other options. Navient is unwilling to listen to my concerns and gives me no other options and my payments just keep going up. I am a single dad trying to survive while having twins to support and paying on loans for a school that pressured me into getting that never gave me a degree and no longer exists while having been sued multiple times.

Issue: Dealing with your lender or servicer
Sub-issue: Trouble with how payments are being handled
Consumer complaint narrative:
On XX/XX/XXXX I called and requested that {$100.00} payment received on XX/XX/XXXX be posted towards Principal only for this loan. The agent I spoke with advised me this will be completed with a few days, but as of today it still has not been corrected. 

I would like the {$100.00} payment that is been received monthly to be posted to loan XXXX. I have instructed the sender of the funds to always post these funds to this loan 's Principal balance monthly when my account is current, but this has not been happening and I have been having to make a call to correct this for years. The when this was set up instructions were given to post funds to this loan specifically. 

In addition to this it has been extremely difficult to get a person on the line to assist me. Please assist me with getting the funds posted to the principal balance upon receipt. I had this issue in the past and there seems to be no imitative to help me with my struggles getting this taken care of. Please update my account to have it set up to apply any payments in the amount of {$100.00} to be applied to this loan 's Principal balance. Moving forward I will be documenting how many times I have called and the wait times I have to endure to get a person on the line.

Issue: Issue with income share agreement
Sub-issue: Marketing or disclosure issues
Consumer complaint narrative:
To Whom It May Concern, I am writing to formally express my concerns regarding the treatment I have received from Navient in relation to my student loans. 

Before Navient took over servicing my loans, I was with Sallie Mae, both of which have been found guilty of predatory lending practices, particularly against minority households misled about the student loan process. As a XXXX individual, I believe I have experienced unfair treatment that has worsened my financial situation. 

The income-driven repayment system has not provided the relief it promised ; instead, it has added significant financial and emotional stress. 

Navients recent announcement regarding the transfer of student loan servicing to XXXX, framed as a standard business practice to reduce expenses, feels disingenuous. It disregards the years of profit made at the expense of students, and there has been a lack of acknowledgment or apology for the harm caused. 

Even with the settlement that has been agreed to, there will still be millions of affected people like myself who fear they will not be compensated fairly and accurately. 

I urge your company to review my case and address these concerns promptly. It is essential for companies in this sector to ensure fair treatment of all borrowers, regardless of background. 

Thank you for your attention to this matter. I look forward to your prompt response. 

Sincerely, XXXX

Issue: Struggling to repay your loan
Sub-issue: Problem lowering your monthly payments
Consumer complaint narrative:
To Whom It May Concern, I'm writing to file a formal complaint against Navient for unfair practices related to my private student loan, which stems from a fraudulent for-profit school, XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX that I attended over XXXX years ago. The institution promised an XXXX XXXX program during admissions ( claiming that I will be grandfathered into the XXXX XXXX program once the school became an associate program through the duration of my time enrolled ) but instead engaged in deceptive practices, ultimately convincing me into taking a second private loan to cover the remaining XXXX months of the program I had left, without informing me that I had to renew my eligibility for financial aid to potentially cover the remaining few months of the program that was left. At XXXX, I was unaware that financial aid had to be renewed every year. The program was an XXXX month program. 

At the time, I did not understand the loan terms or the implications of the agreements I was coerced into signing. I was not offered financial aid or the opportunity to reapply for it, which I know now would have been an option. The school 's fraudulent activities have since come to light, resulting in numerous lawsuits, and yet, Navient continues to profit for this predatory loan. 

Upon completion of the program at XXXX XXXX, I became a mother. I reached out to XXXXNavient for assistance with loan repayment, but was offered forbearance, which led to escalating interest rates. This resulted in a debt cycle that has now spanned nearly XXXX decades, making it clear that I would be paying off this loan indefinitely. Only after I exhausted all forbearance and deferment options was, I offered an interest only repayment plan that aligned more with my income. 

Currently, my loan has re-entered repayment following the completion of a program at a local community college. When I sought further assistance from Navient today, XX/XX/year>, I was offered repayment programs with a higher interest rate with a monthly payment that exceeded what is currently showing on monthly statement. This does not make financial sense and is not sustainable circumstances. 

As a mother of XXXX special needs children - one who is non-verbal and another with an intellectual XXXX- I am often required to take leave and change jobs frequently. Despite explaining my situation to Navient, the only options presented are programs that increase my financial burden, making repayment impossible. 

I request an investigation into Navient 's practices regarding my loan, as they are unfair, predatory and unsustainable. Navient 's continued collection efforts on a loan originating from a fraudulent institution, particularly given the settlements and proven predatory practices, are unacceptable. 

Thank you for your attention to this matter, Sincerely, XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX

Consumer complaint narrative:
I am a XXXX a part of the Sweet vs Cardona lawsuit involving XXXX XXXX XXXX. I am part of the automatic relief group, having submitted by Borrowers Defense Application on XXXX XXXX XXXX Relief to my servicer was supposed to occur by XX/XX/XXXX as per the settlement. Thus far all correspondence has been ignored. Thus, 9 years after I started complaining about this school, here I am once again. This time, now the country realizes what I had stated 9 years ago on this website, but now this department is violating the settlement agreement terms. Thus, I am filing a complaint to avoid litigation that costs the taxpayers more money.

Issue: Struggling to repay your loan

Consumer complaint narrative:
XXXX from Navient called me on Friday, XX/XX/year>, regarding forgiving my private student loans. I told XXXX on the recorded line to send me in writing to my email address and I would have an attorney review. On Monday, XX/XX/year>, I received a letter in my email relaying that roughly a {$46000.00} balance would remain of private student loans of the roughly {$310000.00} balance with a full balance payment being due XX/XX/year>. 

XXXX called same day as letter received in my email ( XX/XX/year> ) while I was at work. I relayed to XXXX that I was at work and I would review and would be unavailable for the next few days and would discuss with an attorney. XXXX has consistently called every single day leaving threatening voicemails to escalate his tactics to collect this debt. Since then he has called my daughter, my mother, my father all claiming they are listed as my contacts. I do not have any contacts listed for any of my debts. I have been a XXXX mother and have been solely responsible for all my debt and would never involve anyone else in my personal business. 

I contacted XXXX of Navient today and made it perfectly clear he was to cease and desist contacting me and my family as I was already attempting to handle this debt and calling me while I am an XXXX XXXX at work was unacceptable. XXXX immediately called me back on my cell phone even though he was told I was at work. I had to call and report him to his supervisor XXXX. However, I still have family members texting me while I am at work reporting that XXXX of Navient is leaving voicemails stating that they are listed as a contact of mine for this account and requesting that I call him.

Issue: Struggling to repay your loan

Consumer complaint narrative: I was XXXX XXXX XXXX just trying to go to college when I was forced to sign paperwork and told a bunch a lies at the first school I went look at which was XXXX XXXX. They told me all the nice things that they wanted me to hear and told me that I would only have federal loans, but I didnt end up with just federal loans I had private loans as well and didnt notice until I got older. Looking back, I signed paperwork that I didnt even get a chance to read because they snatch it back so fast. My program at the school was a scam, they took the program away from us and had us go to another program which really wasnt a good fit for me. Next thing I know Im XXXX almost XXXX XXXX XXXX with all this debt that is so hard to pay back when I was used by this school as well as many others. My federal loans has been discharge due to the fraudulent behavior by this school, but my private loans have not. Navient denied my application. Its so hard to find a place to stay or even do things I want to do with all of this hanging over my head. I just want these loans to go away so I dont have to spend the rest of my life struggling and stressed out.

He lives in a XXXX facility and is currently being supported by my siblings. In late XXXX of 2023, my mother passed away. As a matter of fact XXXX  and hundreds of other schools were recently sued in the XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX. 
Because of the numerous claims of fraud and misconduct perpetrated by these online for profit schools, such as XXXX, I was able to file a Borrower Defense claim with the Dept. of Education against XXXX, and my Federal loans of roughly {$80000.00} were discharged, yet I still owe almost {$20000.00} in private loans due to the schools high pressure tactics to take out an extremely high interest private loan to pay for my classes. 
My Borrower Defense Claim was also part of the XXXX  XXXX. XXXX settlement for which I was a full class member. 
I am aware that Navient was sued by 39 state AGs regarding their predatory loans to attend these online for-profit schools and that Sallie Mae/Navient were a " preferred '' lending company in a " deal '' with these schools during the early 2000 's. These private loans with a high risk of default were part of a package deal offered to " for profit online schools ''. But loans made to students in states outside of the agreement, or those who were not in default for 7 months or more during a " specific '' time frame, were excluded. I am sure this was a big win for Navient, but what a sham of a settlement deal for the rest of borrowers scammed into taking loans to at least XXXX for profit online schools. After the AG settlement, didn't Navient also get out of the Federal student loan business due to scrutiny from lawmakers and borrower advocates? Consumer complaint narrative:
I attended XXXX XXXX from XX/XX/XXXX - XX/XX/XXXX. This complaint is for loans associated with that school held by Navient. 

On XX/XX/XXXX I received notification from the Department of Education that all Federal Loans received by me to attend a school owned and operated by XXXX XXXX XXXX were eligible for full loan discharge due to widespread misconduct ( attached ). The Department stated in this letter that I did not need to file an application for borrower defense because of the pervasive and widespread nature of the school 's misconduct during my time of attendance at that school. 

Further, I believe I should have qualified for the Navient settlement with the XXXX in XXXX, as I met all points of qualification and XXXX of their own customer service reps ( XXXX ) told me as much on XX/XX/XXXX via phone. Then on XX/XX/XXXX I spoke with another customer service rep ( XXXX ) who told me XXXX made a mistake and I did not qualify. At that time, I asked for a full accounting of my account with Navient and XXXX XXXX and a print out of every associated document, to include original contracts, a print out of all payments made, all late payment notices, all forbearance agreements, etc. I was told that I could expect to receive those documents in under 30 days. However, several days later I received a letter from Navient stating they were not sending me any documentation from my account unless I justified the reason for my request. 

In XXXX, when I called Navient 's customer service department because they had raised my payment, yet again, to an unaffordable level, I spoke with a representative there who was incredibly unsympathetic and suggested I consider suicide as a way out of paying this loan. Then reminded me that " but don't worry, even if you die, we'll just go after your co-signer. We'll get our money XXXX way or another ''. This company is morally bankrupt in every single way. There is no redemption for this company. They are absolutely repulsive. 

Furthermore, Navient has this very large private loan labeled as though it was for the XXXX XXXX XXXXXXXX, when in fact it was for XXXX XXXX XXXX. I have kept records and am fully aware of every dime and how/when it was dispersed. Mislabeling the loan to make it appear as though it was for XXXX school does not make it so. I was attending XXXX XXXX XXXXXXXX when I consolidated several XXXX and a private loan into XXXX large private loan with Sallie Mae/Navient XXXX but all of those loans were for XXXX XXXX XXXX None of them were for the XXXX XXXX XXXX 

Thousands of students were scammed by Navient into taking out predatory private student loans to attend for-profit schools such as XXXX XXXX. Because of the numerous claims of fraud and misconduct perpetrated by these for-profit schools, my XXXX loans were discharged, as described above. Navient was sued by XXXX AGs regarding their predatory loans to attend these for-profit schools and Sallie Mae/Navient were XXXX " preferred '' lending company in a deal with these schools during the early XXXX. But loans made to students in states outside of the agreement, or those who were not in default for XXXX months or more during a " specific '' time frame, were excluded - what a surprise that those of us who have been making payments on these predatory loans were left out of this settlement but are no less victims of both these schools and Navient. I am sure this was a big win for Navient, but what a sham of a settlement deal for the rest of borrowers scammed into taking loans to at least XXXX for-profit schools. After the XXXX settlement, didn't Navient also get out of the Federal student loan business due to scrutiny from lawmakers and borrower advocates? Didn't Navient have to pay restitution to the Federal student loan borrowers for not informing students of XXXX XXXX XXXX could have enrolled in, but instead steered toward forbearance? Furthermore, hasn't Navient been sued at least a half dozen times for other predatory loan practices and illegal collection practices? 

I am also aware of a " pilot '' program by which Navient is sending out " applications '' to select students who may have filed XXXX XXXX claims against their schools and were approved. This application is a sham. Why do we need to prove anything? Navient knows who we are. 

Under the FTC Holder Rule : The credit agreement was entered into as part of my attendance at XXXX XXXX The seller ( XXXX XXXX ) regularly referred customers to Navient ( this has already been established ) I have a valid reason to stop paying on my loan and request a refund of payments made *and* I have evidence to show why I should not have to repay the loan and should receive a reimbursement of all funds given to Navient, XXXX the very small portion of the loan that can be attributed to the University of XXXX XXXX 

Per the XXXX XXXX, Navient is liable for giving predatory loans in connection with for-profit schools. Navient needs to do the right thing by students who were scammed into taking out private loans to attend for profit colleges who have committed misconduct and misrepresented themselves to the public to entice students to enroll. It's time Navient let us have our lives back.

Consumer complaint narrative:
Subject : Complaint Against Navient for Steering into Forbearance and Regulatory Violations Description : I am writing to file a complaint against Navient regarding their handling of my student loans. I believe I fall under the circumstances outlined in the recent CFPB order against the company. 

1. Steering into Forbearance : On several occasions, I was advised by Navient representatives to place my loans into forbearance instead of being informed about more affordable repayment options, such as income-driven repayment plans. This guidance has resulted in my loans accruing interest during periods when I could have been making manageable payments, leading to increased overall debt.

2. Regulatory Violations : I am aware of Navients history of violations of various financial laws, which have resulted in significant penalties from regulatory bodies. Their past actions, including steering borrowers away from beneficial repayment options, have not only harmed my financial situation but also seem to violate consumer protection laws. 

Given these circumstances, I respectfully request that my complaint be investigated, and I seek any available remedies or redress as outlined in the CFPBs order against Navient. 

Thank you for your attention to this matter.

Consumer complaint narrative:
I am writing to formally request a complete and total discharge of all of my student loans held by Navient because of their misleading and misguided practices as well as their misrepresentation and their failure to provide correct and proper information and guidance pertaining to my student loan repayment options. 

Navient misguided me into choosing forbearance and deferment options, year after year after year, instead of guiding me toward income driven repayment plans that would have allowed me to obtain more affordable payments that would have eventually led me to student loan forgiveness. With the steering away from the income driven repayment options, my loan amounts continuously increased to amounts that surpassed the original amount of the loan. These incidents caused my credit score to repeatedly plummet and cause a financial strain which has made it difficult for me to obtain my expected financial obligations. 

Also, Navient has a sorted history of misreporting my payment status to the necessary credit agencies which overwhelmingly damaged my credit score. The inaccurate information provided by their representatives has interfered with my ability to obtain a more fair and equitable repayment options which has contributed to an astounding amount of accrued debt. These unfair and unscrupulous practices are consistent with the company 's boundless fraudulent actions for which Navient has been sued by many states and the Consumer Financial Protection Bureau ( CFPB ). 

Navient 's practices have caused me a great deal of financial harm, undue stress, anxiety and a lasting financial burden which could have been avoided with fair guidance concerning my student loan repayment options. I trusted the agents that I spoke with on numerous occasions to help guide me in the best decisions regarding my student loan repayments. This unfair practice has created an unnecessary and unjust financial burden and I would ask to have all of my student loans fully forgiven. 

Thank you for reviewing my request. I am hoping that CFPB will take the steps and actions to hold Navient accountable for their unfair practices and provided complete student loan forgiveness.
