Consumer complaint narrative:
I really could use some assistance with having Navient correct the 2 major ongoing issues I am having with my 3 private student loans serviced by them, dating back to the time when Navient and SallieMae were one company. I have brought this to their attention numerous times with no resolution, starting with the first call I had with their supervisor, XXXX, on XX/XX/XXXX. She sent my case to the customer advocate team. On XX/XX/XXXX, I received a letter from Navient dated XX/XX/XXXX. This contained a Declining Balance letter and account history for all private student loans. This history contains the following statement on the bottom of every page : This financial history removes offsetting transaction on your account that do not impact your loan balance. This is to avoid confusion with administrative adjustments processed on your account. I have compared this data to the information available to me when logged into my account on XXXX. I printed the account history for all 3 of my private student loans, along with downloading the CSV file. I have attached scans of these printouts, including my mark-ups, for your reference. When comparing the printout to the declining balance history letter received on XX/XX/XXXX with the account histories printed on XX/XX/XXXX, you will be able to see 3 key differences across all 3 loans. The first is that the Declining Balance letter shows a starting principal balance that matches the amount disbursed on the day it was disbursed. On the scanned printouts, the unpaid principal balance shows an amount considerably higher than what was disbursed. The second is that the XXXX Resale transaction on the account history printout has been omitted in the declining balance history across all 3 loans. The amount of the Resale transaction is the exact difference between the amount disbursed and the unpaid principal balance amount on the day of disbursement. Because interest on a loan is calculated using the unpaid principal balance, and the unpaid principal balance was higher than owed since the date of disbursement, the total amount of interest calculated and either paid or capitalized for the life of the loan is considerably higher than was supposed to be calculated. I also believe that Navient is fully aware of this error and is trying to hide it due to the Resale transactions being omitted. They have since then removed this transaction from my XXXX account history and changed the starting principal balance to match the actual amount disbursed. This is all outlined in detail below. The third key difference is the fact that the Late Fee Reversal transaction was omitted in the Declining Balance History Letter. As you can see by the scanned printouts, on XX/XX/XXXX all late fees currently owed were reversed, rendering them no longer owed. Over the past 10 years, Navient has allocated portions of my payments to pay for late fees that are not owed. 

Since receiving this on XX/XX/XXXX, I have spoken to numerous customer service representatives and supervisors. They have created numerous tickets for the customer advocate department. Each time, informing me that Navient has done nothing wrong, then harassing me with multiple daily phone calls from different phone numbers. On XX/XX/XXXX, I sent an email to XXXX XXXX. According to an email I received from her on XX/XX/XXXX, she works in the customer advocate department. She had emailed me an updated copy of the Declining Balance letter, along with copies of my loan applications and other terms of the loans. In response, I attached documented evidence printed from my portal on XXXX clearly showing the errors on my account. On XX/XX/XXXX, I received an email acknowledging receipt of it. Since then, there has been no resolution to these issues. On the XXXX of each month I am faced with a choice to pay a minimum amount to keep negative credit reporting from being reported to the 3 credit bureaus, or cause damage to my credit rating. It is not fair or ethical for a company to continue to put their customer in that position and ignore the evidence that has been presented to them. 

Details for Issue 1 : The first issue dates back to the date of disbursement for each of the Private Student Loans I have serviced with them. From day 1, they had the incorrect unpaid principal balance in place, directly impacting the amount of interest that was calculated and then either paid or capitalized and added to the principal balance. This issue went on throughout the life of all 3 of my private student loans. On XXXX XXXX XXXX, Navient acquired my loans from SallieMae. On this date, the difference between the actual amount disbursed and the incorrect principal balance on date of disbursement was credited to the current outstanding principal balance. This is notated with the description Resale on each of them. What they had failed to do was credit the amount of extra interest calculated for the time period between disbursement and XX/XX/XXXX. Please see below detailing all this out : Per Declining Balance Letter Received XXXX and XXXX printout dated XX/XX/XXXX : The first loan ( XXXX ) was disbursed on XX/XX/XXXX for the amount of {$4600.00}, The second loan ( XXXX ) was disbursed on XX/XX/XXXX for the amount of {$4800.00} The third loan ( XXXX ) was disbursed on XXXX XXXX XXXX for the amount of {$1800.00} Total Actual Amount of Private Student Loans disbursed : {$11000.00} Per XXXX printout dated XX/XX/XXXX : On the date of Disbursement, SallieMae ( Navient ) notated that the unpaid principal balance owed was the following : XX/XX/XXXX ( XXXX ) Unpaid Principal Balance Per Navient/SallieMae : {$9300.00} XXXX XXXX XXXX ( XXXX ) Unpaid Principal Balance Per Navient/SallieMae : {$7700.00} XX/XX/XXXX ( XXXX ) Unpaid Principal Balance Per Navient/SallieMae : {$4000.00} Total Unpaid Principal Balance of Private Student Loans per Navient/SallieMae : {$21000.00} The total actual amount owed after school refunds, prior to interest being capitalized on XX/XX/XXXX : {$6400.00} Total Principal Balance per Navient.com printout dated XX/XX/XXXX after School Refunds, prior to interest being capitalized on XX/XX/XXXX : {$16000.00} The difference between the actual amount owed and unpaid principal balance documented per Navient.com printout dated XX/XX/XXXX is {$9800.00}. This amount is 46.7 % higher than the actual amount owed at the time of disbursement and 60.5 % higher than the actual amount owed after School Refunds were credited to the principal balance. 

On XX/XX/XXXX, interest during the time period between disbursement and that date, was capitalized. The issue is that SallieMae ( Navient ) calculated the interest on the wrong principal balances. This information can be referenced using the XXXX loan history Printouts Dated XX/XX/XXXX and Interest Rate Calculated Using Incorrect Unpaid Principal Balance Comparison PDF files created from the downloaded CSV files from XXXX. Please see below detailing this out : Loan XXXX : Because the Principal Balance per XXXX and downloaded CSV file from XXXX was {$9300.00} on day of disbursement, {$8700.00} on XX/XX/XXXX, {$7700.00} on XX/XX/XXXX, and {$7600.00} on XX/XX/XXXX, the interest that was capitalized on XX/XX/XXXX was {$1200.00}. Based on those facts provided by Navient.com that would make the average interest rate that I was paying during that timeframe 5.888 %, calculated on a daily basis. 
Using the 5.888 % interest rate calculated daily, using the correct Principal Balance, the total interest, that should have been capitalized would have been {$530.00}. This is a difference of {$750.00} in extra interest being capitalized and added to principal. 

Loan XXXX : Because the Principal Balance per Navient.com and downloaded CSV file from Navient.com was {$7700.00} on the day of disbursement, {$6600.00} on XXXX XXXX XXXX, {$5400.00} on XX/XX/XXXX, and {$4500.00} on XX/XX/XXXX, the interest that was capitalized on XX/XX/XXXX was {$710.00}. Based on those facts provided by XXXX, that would make the average interest rate that I was paying 6.455 %, calculated on a daily basis. 
Using the 6.455 % interest rate, calculated daily using the correct Principal Balance, the total interest that should have been capitalized would have been {$330.00}. This is a difference of {$370.00} in extra interest being capitalized and added to principal. 

Loan XXXX : Because the Principal Balance per XXXX and downloaded CSV file from XXXX was {$4000.00} on the day of disbursement, the interest that was capitalized on XX/XX/XXXX was {$170.00}. Based on those facts provided by XXXX, that would make the average interest rate that I was paying 6.810 %, calculated on a daily basis. 
Using the 6.810 % interest rate, calculated daily using the correct Principal Balance, the total interest that should have been capitalized would have been {$80.00}. This is a difference of {$97.00} in extra interest being capitalized and added to principal. 

Based on the above facts and calculations, the total amount of extra interest calculated and capitalized across all 3 private student loans on XX/XX/XXXX was {$1200.00}. This means that on XX/XX/XXXX the total principal balance that SallieMae ( Navient ) had calculated interest on was {$18000.00}. The breakdown for each loan from Navient.com is below. This can be viewed on the Navient.com scanned printout dated XXXX XXXX XXXX 

XXXX : {$8900.00} XXXX : {$5200.00} XXXX : {$4200.00} Based on that, on XX/XX/XXXX the principal balance that interest was calculated on was off by {$11000.00}. This is outlined below : XXXX : {$5400.00} ( {$4700.00} Error in principal on disbursement date, plus {$750.00} in extra interest ) XXXX : {$3200.00} ( {$2900.00} Error in principal on disbursement date, plus {$370.00} in extra interest ) XXXX : {$2300.00} ( {$2200.00} Error in principal on disbursement date, plus {$97.00} in extra interest ) This practice of SallieMae ( Navient ) calculating interest on the wrong principal balance owed went on throughout the entire life of all 3 private student loans. This was partly corrected on XX/XX/XXXX. This was the date that Navient took over the loans from SallieMae. On that date, the difference between the actual disbursement and the principal balance keyed in on the date of disbursement was credited back to the principal balance. This is shown on the XXXX printout of my loan history dated XX/XX/XXXX and the Interest Rate Calculated Using Incorrect Unpaid Principal Balance Comparison PDF Files created from the CSV downloads from XXXX. However, they failed to credit back the extra interest calculated and either paid or capitalized using the wrong principal balance. This includes payments that should have been applied to principal when there should have been no interest balance due. All the details and calculations are inside of the attachments provided for each private student loan. 

By the time Navient took over the loan on XXXX XXXX XXXX the total principal balance across all 3 Private Student Loans was off by {$3800.00}. This can be referenced using the Interest Rate Calculated Using Incorrect Unpaid Principal Balance Comparison PDF files created from the downloaded CSV files from Navient.com. The breakdown of this is below. 

XXXX : {$2100.00} XXXX : {$1000.00} XXXX : {$650.00} Details for Issue 2 : The second issue starts at the point where Navient had taken over the loans from SallieMae. On XX/XX/XXXX, any and all late fees that were owed at that time were then reversed and no longer owed. This is shown as Late Fee Reversal on all 3 of my private student loans. This is on the scanned printout from XXXX dated XXXX along with the CSV download from XXXX. After this date, Navient applied payments on all 3 loans towards late fees that had been reversed. This directly impacted the principal balance owed because the payment made, was not applied to the principal balance, but to late fees that were at a zero balance. Interest was then calculated on a higher balance caused, not only by calculating interest on a wrong principal balance since the date of disbursement, but also by applying payments towards late fees, when they should have been going to principal. This can all be referenced in the Unowed Late Fees Paid and Extra Interest Paid Due to Misallocation of Payments PDF Files and the Scanned printout from Navient.com dated XXXX 

In addition to the noted above files, I have also attached a word document containing video links of me accessing my XXXX portal. Each time I would access the portal to download, print, or just view history on my private student loans, I would take a video of it to keep a timeline of what I was experiencing.

Consumer complaint narrative:
XX/XX/XXXX Subject : Complaint and Urgent Request for Compliance Dear Navient, I hope this communication finds you in good health. I am writing to you regarding some substantial concerns I have uncovered during my thorough examination of the operations of Navient. As a conscientious consumer and advocate for ethical business practices, I believe it is crucial to bring these matters to your attention for immediate investigation and resolution. 
1. Opting Out Violation ( 15 USC 6802-6805 ) : Upon reviewing the legal framework provided by 15 USC 6802-6805 , which empowers consumers to opt out of financial information sharing with institutions, I have observed potential instances where Navient might not be fully adhering to these statutory provisions. This has raised concerns about the protection of consumer privacy rights. It is my earnest request that your team conducts a comprehensive review and takes necessary steps to rectify any non-compliance issues promptly. 
2. Credit Report Accuracy Infringement ( 15 USC 1681 ) : In the course of scrutinizing my credit report obtained from XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX I have uncover discrepancies that may be in violation of 15 USC 1681. This crucial federal law mandates the accuracy and fairness of credit reporting, placing a responsibility on entities like Navient to conduct thorough investigations and promptly rectify any inaccuracies. Ensuring compliance with this law is vital for maintaining consumer trust and confidence. 
3. CFPB Complaints Negligence : My investigation has brought to light a potential neglect in addressing and resolving complaints submitted to the Consumer Financial Protection Bureau ( CFPB ). Failure to actively engage with and resolve these complaints is a direct violation of CFPB regulations. I urge Navient to conduct an in-depth internal review, recognizing and rectifying any shortcomings in addressing outstanding complaints. This proactive approach is not only essential for regulatory compliance but also crucial for upholding the reputation of your organization. 
4. Privacy Act of 1974 Non-Compliance ( 5 U.S.C. 552a ) : Preliminary findings suggest a potential non-compliance with the Privacy Act of 1974 ( 5 U.S.C. 552a ). This federal legislation mandates precise management of personal information by government entities. Any deviation from its stipulations requires immediate attention. I strongly recommend that Navient initiates an immediate internal audit to ensure strict adherence to the Privacy Act. Proactive steps in this regard will not only align the organization with legal mandates but also enhance overall data protection measures. 
5. General Redress and Compensation ( 15 U.S.C. 1681n ) : The collective impact of these infringements has resulted in both quantifiable and intangible harm. In accordance with 15 U.S.C. 1681n, I formally demand Navient to provide due compensation for the distress and material losses borne as a direct consequence of these transgressions. This includes but is not limited to the time and effort expended in rectifying inaccuracies, emotional distress, and any financial repercussions suffered. 
To facilitate a fair and swift resolution, I kindly request a comprehensive response addressing each of the highlighted concerns within [ 30 days ]. I believe that your immediate attention to these matters will not only lead to a swift resolution but also uphold the integrity of legal mandates and safeguard the rights and interests of consumers. 
Thank you for your prompt consideration. I look forward to your timely response. Yours sincerely, XXXX XXXX XXXX

Consumer complaint narrative:
I took private student loans from Navient from XXXX. I was not working and did not have good credit at the time so my mother co-signed the loans for me. Once I graduated, I put forth best efforts to repay the loan. However, I had severe financial struggles and needed multiple forbearances. I lost my mother in XXXX and was told that I was no longer eligible for forbearances because I maxed out. When I explained to them that my mother died and I was experiencing health issues, they told me that I had to make a payment or I'd default, I started paying them with credit cards to prevent default. In XXXX, I applied for and was granted XXXX  XXXX bankruptcy but my attorney refused to argue for student loan forgiveness in the separate hearing. I could not afford another attorney to handle the special hearing for student loans. Navient did not acknowledge my mother 's death until XXXX when I received a letter from them saying they recently learned of her death although I'd been telling them for years. My struggles with Navient lasted from XXXX  through XXXX when I could no longer afford my payments and refused to pay interest only. My total loan balances ballooned from the initial {$14000.00} to over {$41000.00}. I spoke to multiple representatives during this time about their predatory lending practices and offered to pay the amount I borrowed if they would remove all of the years of interest they had tacked on. I argued that even when I made payments, my balances continued to increase. They offered to settle for 60 % of the balance, to be paid in three installments. The amount was unfair and I explained that I did not have that type of money to pay them. I stopped taking their calls and Navient then started calling people associated with my and disclosing the matter to them, violating my privacy. They left a detailed voicemail on my sister 's phone. They called my husband and disclosed the matter to him, and I was not married when these loans were taken. He was not aware of the matter. The also left messages on my son 's phone. They started reaching out to past employers as well. During this time, they threatened me with legal action. Finally, when trying to embarrass me did not work, and threatening legal action did not work, they sold me loan to a debt collector. I feel I have made enough payments over the years that my loan should have been considered settled or even written off. Not sent to a collection agency to further harm my credit, after multiple offers from myself to try to resolve the matter. Their practices are illegal and unjust. 

Disbursements - {$14000.00} XX/XX/XXXXXXXX  - {$2000.00} XX/XX/XXXXXXXX  - {$5500.00} - withdrew XX/XX/XXXX - {$2000.00}- withdrew XX/XX/XXXX - {$2000.00} XX/XX/XXXX - $ XXXX not enrolled

Issue: Improper use of your report
Sub-issue: Reporting company used your report improperly
Consumer complaint narrative:
Navient has violated my consumer rights and privacy since before 2018! 
Simply put, FARPA 20 U.S.C. s. 1232g and 34 C.F.R. part 99 protect my Rights and Privacy limiting the ability to share my information. FERPA defines personally identifiable information to include, without limitation, the names of the student and his or her parents or other family members ; the address of the student or student 's family ; the student 's social security number, student number, biometric record, or other personal identifier ; indirect identifiers, such as the student 's date of birth, place of birth, and mother 's maiden name ; and other information that could reasonably identify a student. 34 C.F.R. s. 99.3 ( definition of personally identifiable information ). 

Not to mention, on these reports, there are multiple instances of these debts being charged off. A charge of is considered a certificate of indebtness which means it is income and MUST be removed. 

It is ILLEGAL to report transaction history.- 15 USC 6801 Please see attached for more violations of my rights by Navient, Opt Out Letter and Credit Reporting on said account.

Issue: Dealing with your lender or servicer
Sub-issue: Received bad information about your loan
Consumer complaint narrative: I attended XXXX  XXXX XXXX of XXXX ( XXXX ) from XXXX, and left before finishing my XXXX. I was encouraged to, and did, take out as much loan money as possible : I had XXXX XXXX  children to provide for while I was attending XXXX XXXX XXXX made me sound like I was a superstar XXXX brain when they saw my LSAT score, and offered me a half-scholarship, which covered about $ XXXX of the annual tuition. The financial aid department was very eager to get me fixed up with as much loan money as was available. They knew my husband was a XXXX XXXX, and encouraged me to keep taking out the maximum each semester. It felt like XXXX money, because I was convinced I would have a great lawyer job when I graduated. Not only did I not graduate ( I had to move to Texas for a job ), but I left with more than {$200000.00} in student loans. That was far more than the five semensters I attended would have cost. At that time, I believe Navient was still Sallie Mae, and they were handing out money so easily, with promises of low interest rate paybacks. I am also in the XXXXXXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX, and XXXX is on the list, with the XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX. ALL of my federal loans have been XXXX because of XXXXXXXX XXXX ( and the parent company, Infinilaw ) documented misconduct in its promises of XXXX XXXX success, and great jobs after graduation, and heavy marketing toward people who are at higher risk financially, and less likely to see the success promised, or to pay back the massive loans. Sallie Mae/Navient wanted to be a top tier lender with the for-profit schools owned by XXXX, so they made it very, very easy for XXXX students to get big financial aid -- much more than was necessary. There have been multiple suits by several states ' attorneys general alleging that Navient violated consumer protection laws by engaging in unfair and deceptive servicing and collection practices and, as Sallie Mae, originating predatory subprime private student loans. The fact that Navient, when I asked for an application -- just the application for discharge of the loans -- flat refused for vague reasons, indicates the company continues to be slippery and in denial about its responsibility for bad faith practices.

Issue: Problem with a company's investigation into an existing problem
Sub-issue: Their investigation did not fix an error on your report
Consumer complaint narrative: NAVIENT student loan servicer has been claiming since XXXX  that i was 120 days late for two months, on two different loan. This is false. I was never late. I was on an income based payment plan before having my loans forgiven for being aXXXX % XXXX XXXX veteran. When my loans were paid they were even backdated prior to these alleged late payments but still they remain. I have disputed this every month for 2 years now and have received the exact same form letter answer from NAVIENT And the credit bureaus despite evidence to the contrary would not remove these errors. I have called customer service, emailed the XXXX XXXX and even went so far to email every single high ranking person I could find on their website - and still just stunning silence. I have asked to be furnished with evidence and explanations of their investigation and got nothing. These erroneously reported four late payments of over 120 late days has had a devastating effect. My credit score at XXXX point was XXXX. I could rent anywhere, I couldnt get a job, I had trouble even getting a bank account. I was finally lucky enough to get 2 banks to open an accounts but suddenly these accounts were closed, my money frozen and I couldnt even by food for my XXXX XXXX XXXX. I even remember one representative said to me during a distraught conversation about what to do- they said, you can always go to a food bank and hung up. NAVIENT abused their power and stole years of my life and time with my son. And the credit bureaus are complicit. I also asked them for evidence in every dispute and every call, email, chat and phone call and their response every single time was - NAVIENT CONFIRMS THIS REPORT AS ACCURATE AND NO CHANGES WOLL BE MADE. After 15 years in the XXXX, a devastating injury, forced retirement and all the XXXX I often wonder what my life would look like right now if those 4 lines of code on a stupid credit report had been accurate. Would I be healthy? Would my son have avoided trauma? Would my marriage have not fallen apart? NAVIENT should be held to account for a great deal more than they are and XXXX, XXXX XXXX need to be held accountable as well.

Consumer complaint narrative:
I hope this letter finds you well. It took me years to gather up the courage to write this letter to bring to your attention a grievous matter concerning my experience with Navient, my former student loan servicer. I am reaching out to you as a last resort after enduring prolonged emotional distress and substantial financial damage caused by the company 's actions. 

After financing my education at a XXXX XXXX XXXX in Oregon through federal student loan programs, I found myself facing significant challenges with Navient. The ordeal began shortly after my Grace Period ended in XX/XX/XXXX. Despite my best efforts to submit income verification documents to Navient 's website, technical glitches persistently thwarted my attempts. What followed were interactions with their customer service representatives that only deepened my frustration and despair. 

For over a year, XX/XX/XXXXXXXX  XX/XX/XXXX, I found myself caught in a frustrating loop, repeatedly uploading required documents to a portal, receiving non-compliance notifications, and starting the process anew. During this time, Navient capitalized interest on my loans, resulting in an alarming six-figure interest capitalization that inflated my total student loan debt to an overwhelming $ XXXX. 

The breaking point came when Navient finally acknowledged that the portal they directed me to was defunct and unmonitored. The toll on my mental health was devastating. Enduring tearful phone calls and falling into a XXXX  XXXX and associated weight gain which my family and close friends can attest to. 

Now, as I navigate the process of consolidating my student loans to access Income-Driven Repayment benefits, I find myself facing the haunting repercussions of Navient 's actions. I'm compelled to shed light on my experience and seek justice for the mistreatment I endured.

Consumer complaint narrative: While with my ex-wife, I co-signed three student loans ( Navient is the provider ) to allow her to finish her education. We have been divorced now since XXXX, and during the divorce proceedings it was made clear and approved by the judge that my ex-wife would be solely responsible for any loans that I was co-signer on. Recently, in XXXX of XXXX, she unknowingly fell behind 60-days with her payments, and because of my continued association with those accounts, my credit has plummeted in response. I submitted a dispute request with XXXX on XX/XX/XXXX and asked them to remove the account and/or the negative information. I provided a justification and the document from our divorce proceedings, and they declined to do anything regarding the situation ( simply came back in less than a week 's time with nothing but a verification that it is my account ). I submitted a similar dispute to XXXX about five years ago, regarding these same accounts, and they cooperated by removing those accounts from my report. My credit scores are wildly different because of these accounts, and it has caused my XXXX score to plummet XXXX pts since this issue. I have a similar dispute currently filed with XXXX as well, for the same accounts and reason.

Issue: Dealing with your lender or servicer
Sub-issue: Trouble with how payments are being handled
Consumer complaint narrative:
XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX, Illinois XXXX To Whom It XXXX Concern, I am writing regarding my Navient Student Loan, which was assumed from XXXX XXXX XXXX in XXXX, when the student loan unit was sold. In XXXX, a XXXX XXXX Representative talked me into consolidating XXXX loans ( 1 XXXX, 12 XXXX loans, and 8 XXXX loans ) into one loan under the pretense that my loan payment would be lower. 

However, the interest rate of the consolidated loan was over 9 % and has remained between 8 % -9 % for over 22 years. 

Additionally, I received a {$20000.00} Student Loan repayment bonus from the U.S. Army that was applied to the loan. Over the years, despite how many payments I have made, the consolidated loan total has not changed because of the absorbent interest rate that kept me in the same place. 

I contacted Navient many times requesting to be added to the income-driven repayment but was selected for a forbearance instead. Also, I believe my payments were mismanaged, especially since the Army paid {$20000.00} towards my loan and my balance is still over {$16000.00}. 

I would like to request that my loan be considered for discharge. I am a U.S. Army XXXX ( Service Connected ) Veteran and I believe some of my paperwork was lost in the process of the consolidation. I believe XXXX also mismanaged my loan ; however I submitted a CFBP Borrower Defense Claim ( # XXXX ) in XX/XX/XXXX, and it was denied. 

Most of the loans that I consolidated were federal direct subsidized or unsubsidized loans that are now consolidated into a variable rate private loan. 

Additionally, XXXX is one of the schools accused by the Federal Trade Commission of misrepresenting its job and salary outcomes through ads. The university also settled with the XXXX Department and borrowers. 

Thank you, XXXX XXXX XXXX, Illinois

Sub-issue: Trouble with how payments are being handled
Consumer complaint narrative:
In XXXX Navient reached a settlement with many states Attorney Generals to cancel over a XXXX dollars in private student loans. However, my private student loans with Navient weren't included on the list of those that were being forgiven. Instead, my student loans were charged off in XX/XX/XXXX without my knowledge. I wasn't sent a letter of warning or final action etc. I thought that my loans were in Forbearance like other federal and private loans. I contacted Navient in XXXX to start a repayment program. I was misled into believing that if I make XXXX payments the rest of my balance would be forgiven. This so-called agreement was not in writing, just over the phone. I took a chance that the representative was telling the truth. I made a payment in XXXX after asking for and being denied over the phone, for a forbearance, deferment, or XXXX related forgiveness. I currently have many ongoing XXXX issues and was contemplating on retiring early under a XXXX retirement. I asked for applications to each program, I couldn't find any applications online, and was told that they would be mailed to me. They never were. I contacted Navient in late XXXX, early XXXX, to learn more about the program only to find out that the program was not a forgiveness program. I informed that I never receive any applications in the mail and that I would need more information before any more payment would be made. I became sicker and was focusing more on my health than Navient 's lack of communication. I ended up in the hospital for over a week then back in the hospital a week later. I didn't know that Navient closed my student loans until I applied for a line of credit. I was just informed this month that I had been charged off 6 months ago. 

Navient failed to send me any notification for years about my student loans. They did not send any statements to me although I would update my address online. I set up auto bill payments and established first contact with the service. I even set up my email to receive statements or communication from the service. On XX/XX/XXXX, after the charge off, I received an email stating that they were updated my address after I contacted them to again ask for a deferment. I was not informed while talking to the representative that my loans were charged off. 

Navient failed me notify me of any action they took. Navient did everything they could to make sure I would fail at paying off my student loans.

Product: Credit reporting or other personal consumer reports
Issue: Improper use of your report
Sub-issue: Reporting company used your report improperly
Consumer complaint narrative: According to the Fair Credit Reporting Act 15 USC 1681 section 602 a states " There is a need to insure that consumer reporting agencies exercise their grave responsibilities with fairness, impartiality, and a respect for the consumers right to privacy. '' XXXX and XXXX are consumer reporting agencies and I am the Consumer. I have the right to make sure my private information isn't shared which is backed by 15 USC 6801 which states '' It is the policy of the Congress that each financial institution has an affirmative and continuing obligation to respect the privacy of its customers and to protect the security and confidentiality of those customers nonpublic personal information. '' ( Furnisher of information to credit agencies ) is a financial institution by definition under that title. 15 USC 1681 section 604 a section 2 states that " In general Subject to subsection ( c ), any consumer reporting agency may furnish a consumer report under the following circumstances and no other : in accordance with the written instructions of the consumer to whom it relates. '' ( Furnisher of information to credit agencies ) the financial institution and the Consumer reporting agencies XXXX and XXXX do not have my consent to furnish this information and they surely do not have my written consent. Any and all consent to XXXX, XXXX, ( Furnisher of information to credit agencies ) whether it be verbal, non-verbal, written, implied or otherwise is revoked. 15 USC 6802 ( b ) ( c ) states that " A financial institution may not disclose nonpublic personal information to a nonaffiliated third party unless the consumer is given an explanation of how the consumer can exercise that nondisclosure option. '' ( Furnisher of information to credit agencies ) Never informed me of my right to exercise my nondisclosure option. Not only that 15 USC 1681C ( a ) ( 5 ) states '' Except as authorized under subsection ( b ), no consumer reporting agency may make any consumer report containing any of the following items of information Any other adverse item of information, other than records of convictions of crimes which antedates the report by more than seven years. '' This account is an adverse item they are reporting again without my permission which is against the law. 15 U.S. Code 1681s2 ( A ) ( 1 ) A states " A person shall not furnish any information relating to a consumer to any consumer reporting agency if the person knows or has reasonable cause to believe that the information is inaccurate. 15 U.S. Code 1681e states '' Every consumer reporting agency shall maintain reasonable procedures designed to avoid violations of section 1681c of this title and to limit the furnishing of consumer reports to the purposes listed under section 1681b of this title. XXXX and XXXX are not maintaining reasonable procedures. Also 12 CFR 1016.7 states that " A consumer may exercise the right to opt out at any time. '' I am opting out of your reporting Services.

These loans should also be discharged due to school misconduct, violations on with-holding information to underage students, not informing about new percentage rates, new fees added to the account, and the misconduct of not allowing the applicant to take their co-signer off their loan after so many years of proper payment. They have pigeon held my future and my credit rating, and now my cosigners for nothing. They have received more than my initial loan and it is not fair for the applicants who decided to stop paying to get forgiveness but the ones still trying to do what's right are being harassed by phones calls about paying your bill even when your on time, and the run around with misguided information about why you can't release a cosigner or even try for forgiveness of a school that has closed because of FRAUD. They will not even entertain a phone call to give you the right information.

Consumer complaint narrative:
Last year around this time I was contacted by Navient Student Loan servicing who offered me a settlement for my private student loan. I would have to make a lump sum payment of XXXX to keep my loan with Navient and not have it go into collections. I made a lump sum payment but the balance on my loan was never updated to the settlement balance, I was told this was because the settlement wasn't complete. In XXXX of this year Navient offered dissmimal of private loans for pre-datory schools and my school was listed. I had my settlement put on pause as I applied for this relief. The application for my dissimal was submitted on XX/XX/XXXX. In XXXX I checked on the status of my application and was told it was still under review. I had a similar call in XXXX and was told that I wouldn't have an answer until end of XXXX. In XXXX I was told my application was denied and that a letter was sent, I never received a letter. I had confirmed my address with Navient in XXXX and it was correct on their end. The agent in XXXX told me application was denied on XX/XX/XXXX which I agrued could not be true as I had spoken to agents in both XXXX and XXXX. I have yet to receive information on my application was denied. While speaking to the agent today I asked how my lump sum payment was being applied and explained my balance was never reflected to the settlement balance or see it applied to my original balance. She explained that she couldn't help with this and said that I would receive a call in 7-10 business days. I explained that I would be disputing this with my bank as it feels fraudulent.

I am asking for some answers on my application and how my lump sum payment is currently being applied.

Issue: Struggling to repay your loan
Sub-issue: Can't get other flexible options for repaying your loan
Consumer complaint narrative:
XX/XX/year> To Whom It May Concern : I, XXXX XXXX, am submitting a formal complaint against Navient, a student loan servicer, for their failure to provide adequate service and for engaging in practices that have caused significant financial harm to me as a borrower. Below are the specific details of my complaint : 1. Misleading and Confusing Information Regarding Repayment Options Navient has consistently provided me with incorrect, incomplete, or misleading information regarding my repayment options. When I initially sought guidance on available repayment plans, particularly income-driven repayment ( IDR ) plans, I was not informed of all available options. Navient representatives provided incomplete details, failing to explain key aspects of these plans, including eligibility criteria, payment calculations, and how to apply for forgiveness programs under these plans. 

In addition, when I requested information on consolidating my loans and entering a new repayment plan, the guidance I received was both inconsistent and contradictory, causing further confusion. As a result, I was unable to make informed decisions, leading to missed opportunities to lower my monthly payments and ultimately increasing my total loan burden.

2. Failure to Properly Apply Payments Over the course of several months, I have experienced numerous instances where Navient failed to properly apply payments to my account. Despite submitting timely payments, these payments were either applied to the wrong loan or not credited to my account at all, causing my account to reflect inaccurate balances. I was subsequently charged late fees and accrued additional interest due to Navient 's misapplication of my payments. 

Despite multiple calls to their customer service department to resolve these issues, the problem persists, and I have not been given a clear explanation for why payments are not being applied correctly. This has caused severe financial distress, as I am now facing a higher loan balance and additional fees that should not have been assessed.

3. Failure to Provide Accurate Information on Loan Forgiveness Programs I am also extremely dissatisfied with Navient 's handling of loan forgiveness programs. I have contacted Navient on numerous occasions to inquire about my eligibility for Public Service Loan Forgiveness ( PSLF ) and other forgiveness options, as I have been working in a qualifying public service position for several years. However, Navient failed to provide accurate information regarding the specific requirements of the PSLF program and did not properly track my qualifying payments toward forgiveness.

As a result of this failure, I am not receiving credit for all the payments I have made while employed in a public service position. This has caused significant delays in my progress toward loan forgiveness, unfairly extending the time I must continue making payments on my loans.

4. Steering Into Forbearance Instead of Income-Driven Repayment Plans When I reached out to Navient to discuss options for lowering my payments during periods of financial hardship, I was steered into forbearance instead of being properly informed about income-driven repayment plans, which would have been a better solution for my financial situation. As a result, my loan balance increased due to the accumulation of interest during the periods of forbearance, which was not clearly explained to me at the time. This has further increased my financial burden and delayed my progress toward eventual loan forgiveness.

5. Poor Customer Service and Lack of Accountability The level of customer service provided by Navient has been consistently poor. Representatives frequently provide conflicting information, fail to follow up on issues, and seem ill-equipped to handle even basic inquiries about loan repayment and servicing. I have been forced to spend hours on the phone trying to resolve issues that should have been addressed promptly, and my requests for escalation to higher levels of management have often been ignored or dismissed.

In addition to these systemic issues, Navient has shown a lack of accountability when addressing the errors they have caused in my account. I have not received satisfactory explanations or resolutions for the misapplied payments, inaccurate balance calculations, and improper guidance regarding repayment options and loan forgiveness.

Conclusion and Desired Resolution Navient 's actionsor lack thereofhave caused significant financial harm and emotional distress. As a student loan borrower, I relied on Navient to provide accurate and timely information about my loans and repayment options, yet they have consistently failed to do so. I am seeking the following resolutions : 1. A thorough review of my loan account to ensure that all payments are properly applied and credited, with any incorrect charges, late fees, or accrued interest removed from my account.

2. An accurate reassessment of my eligibility and progress toward Public Service Loan Forgiveness ( PSLF ) and other loan forgiveness programs, with appropriate credit given for all qualifying payments made to date.

3. Reimbursement for any fees and interest accrued as a result of Navient 's failure to provide accurate information about income-driven repayment plans and their improper steering into forbearance.

4. A formal explanation from Navient acknowledging their errors and detailing corrective actions taken to prevent these issues from recurring.

5. Compensation for the financial harm and emotional distress caused by Navient 's failure to provide competent and reliable service.

I trust that the CFPB will take my complaint seriously and investigate Navient 's practices thoroughly. Navient 's behavior has not only impacted my financial well-being but has also caused widespread harm to countless other borrowers who rely on them for accurate loan servicing.

Thank you for your time and attention to this matter. I look forward to a resolution that addresses the issues outlined above and prevents further harm to other borrowers. 

Sincerely, XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX

Issue: Dealing with your lender or servicer
Sub-issue: Received bad information about your loan
Consumer complaint narrative:
I am disputing the 90 days late Navient reported on all XXXX of my loans to the credit bureaus. This is an error due to the 'auto pay on Their website not working properly, the lack of information on their website regarding 'auto pay ' and the misinformation / lack of information on their website regarding 'the student loan payment pause '. And I am requesting that they reverse/ remove the negative report to the credit bureau that my XXXX loans with Navient were 90 days late. 
AUTO PAY NOT WORKING PROPERLY- each time I tried to sign up for auto pay, the message would tell me my payment will start being deducted from my bank account the next month but when the next month came, my payment did not get deducted so I paid manually and then I tried the auto pay again. The same thing happened the next month, so I manually paid again thinking that maybe there was just a glitch and that it would be working properly the following month. 
PAYMENT PAUSE - Because I thought I was on the student loan payment pause I thought I was just making extra payments to try to stay ahead so after the XXXX attempt at auto pay I thought everything was working correctly now ( XX/XX/XXXX ). 
After a few months ( XX/XX/XXXX ), I received an alert on my credit report that I was 90 days late with all XXXX of the loans that Navient service. I immediately called the Navient representative to see how this could happen when I'm on auto pay along with being on the student loan payment pause, so how can I be 90 days late on my loans. I was shockingly informed that " only certain loans qualified for 'the student loan payment pause ' and that mine did not ''. Nowhere on their website states that the loans Navient service don't qualify for the student loan payment pause. I was then informed from the Navient representative that " since my loan payment is due on the XXXX of each month, I would have to sign up for auto pay after my payment is due but no later than XXXX  days before the next due date '', it does not tell you how to properly set up auto pay on Their website so that's why it wasn't accepting my auto pay but I didn't find this out until the damage was already done. The representative then told me that I could file a dispute with Navient and if they found that their was any error on their part they would reverse/ remove the XXXX  days late on all XXXX of the loans from my credit report. so I filled a dispute with Navient and they said that their was no error on their part and they would not remove or reverse the XXXX  days late on all XXXX of the loans off my credit report. I couldn't believe it for the simple fact that when you sign up for autopay it doesn't tell you to sign up after your due date but no longer than XXXX  days before the next due date, that right there is an ERROR on there part. not to mention no where on their website states that the loans they service do not qualify for the student loan payment pause. 
There's no way possible that I would have let my loans go unpaid for XXXX  days, not even XXXX  day. I've always pay my bills on time. From the lack of information / misinformation on their website my XXXX XXXX dropped around XXXX points Causing me major hardships in my life. it's hard enough out here without XXXX dollar companies misleading and praying on every day working class people just trying to make a living and provide for their families. 
PS I'm sure they're making lots of money in late fees from the lack of information on their website regarding how to properly sign up for autopay and the loans they service not being eligible for the student loan payment pause. 
Navient needs to remove the XXXX  days late on my credit report. and they need to have proper instructions on enrolling in auto pay and they failed to inform borrowers on their website that their loans weren't eligible for the student loan payment pause.

Issue: Struggling to repay your loan
Sub-issue: Problem lowering your monthly payments
Consumer complaint narrative: I am, and have been for many years, struggling to deal with my student loan servicer, Navient. I have never defaulted on a loan, it is my highest priority to ensure that my loans are paid each month since I graduated in 2008. They have offered no flexibility at all. They have put me through interest only payments and forbearance in the past, which has significantly increased my overall amount on already inflated loans. They allowed for me, as a young person, to take loans with no cosigner, not understanding the impact, yet I have been taking responsibility for my commitment. I have been enrolled in a 6 month rate reduction program several times, and currently am. But I am going back and seeing documentation where they actually put a bulk of my loans in forbearance, which I DID NOT agree to. Also, when I called six months ago to reenroll in rate reduction, they told me what my " reduced '' payment would be, which was more than my original payment anyway. When I ask for documentation or notification of why they just say things like the government controls the rates. I NEVER receive paper mail for then regarding ANYTHING on my account. The ONLY communication I get is an email stating when my monthly auto pay is coming out, they love to only communicate when it is about the money you are giving them. For years and years I have just taken it and given them my money, at the mercy of whenever they want to change the rules. They never provide the documentation requested. I just scheduled an auto pay TODAY and they wouldn't even provide documentation show the change of date for my account. They rarely provide documents, even when asked, and the agents are trained customer service reps, they are not qualified or versed in explaining details, it just doesn't happen. I don't know what else to do or where to go for help. I ALWAYS ensure this bill is paid, yet they WONT work with me and have signed me up for things like a forbearance without my permission and stating I was being placed in rate reduction. It is all so confusing to begin with, but they keep doing things on the account that are making my financial wellness worse off. Now I am being told my loans are going to another servicer and I have no choice in the matter. The SAME issues presented in the lawsuit again them servicing federal loans is also happening to me, and MANY others, with their private loans. Someone please help. Is there anything to protect us that were forced into privately borrowing.

Issue: Dealing with your lender or servicer
Sub-issue: Keep getting calls about your loan
Consumer complaint narrative:
Have been unemployed since XXXX ; Navient has been bombarding me with automated spam calls, demanding payments on my private student loans ; at least once a day, up to 6-8 times. Speaking to representatives I have been told that there are no options to stop these calls and the best they can do is " push them back '' for " a couple of days ''. I do not answer my phone anymore ; seldom do they leave a voicemail message or identify themselves in any way. 

When they do leave a message it's a demand that I contact them by phone - they will not communicate Private Loans forbearances or repayment plans via email ; which can only be sent to them via the Navient website ; no records of emails I have sent to them are made available to me- I have to keep a record of them myself if I want to see more than a fragment of it in the correspondence posted. 

When I stopped responding to phone calls, they began calling and sending letters to my cosigners. In XX/XX/XXXX my mother paid the past-due balance after a letter threatening " Review for Litigation '' arrived the XXXX- with only four days before the stated deadline of XX/XX/XXXX despite being dated XX/XX/XXXX. Seeing the postmark on the envelope indicates it was shipped on the XXXX, I have reason to believe this letter was purposely dated/postmarked in such a way to arrive " late '' as an intimidation tactic. 

Navient has also refused to discharge the loans under the Attorneys General settlement where they were found to be using abusive and deceptive practices including pushing forbearances on cases of financial hardship rather than more viable options, so as to extend the loans further ; my case was refused on the grounds that my loans had " never been in default, '' and so weren't eligible - ignoring that the school I attended with those loans was also found to be engaging in deceptive/abusive practices, and that my loans never defaulted because I had taken forbearances on Navient 's advice. My attempts to communicate this with them were refused and ignored. 

I have repeatedly stated that I have no stable income and am unable to make payments in the amounts demanded, making this harassment - they have ignored this and continued spamming my phone with calls and sending threats of litigation, knowing full well that I'm struggling with XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX and that my financial situation has not changed ; I have been informed I am no longer eligible for no-payment hardship forbearance on this loan and I have repeatedly asked for my payments to be lowered and late fees waived - which have all been refused. Navient refuses to negotiate payment in any way or allow any sort of relief without some manner of payment ; Speaking to " XXXX XXXX '' over the phone tonight I was told they weren't even going to bother offering any repayment/relief options as I had stated before that I was unable to make any kind of payment at this time. 

Another letter threatening " Review for Litigation '' arrived XX/XX/XXXX, dated the XXXX and demanding a " satisfactory agreement to resolve your account by XX/XX/XXXXXXXX XXXX XXXX'. The envelope is not postmarked in any way I can discern. Both it and the previous letter were sent from a return address belonging to " XXXX XXXX XXXX' in XXXX XXXX PA - No mention of this company has been made in any of my communications with Navient, nor by anyone who called me about the debt. 

XXXX XXXX informed me I would have to " look up my state 's litigation practices '' to find out who would be doing said litigating when I once again stated I was unable to make any kind of payment with no stable income.

Issue: Dealing with your lender or servicer
Sub-issue: Problem with customer service
Consumer complaint narrative:
I am writing to file a formal complaint against Navient due to a series of unfair, deceptive, and abusive acts and practices that have significantly impacted my financial stability and personal life. As a XXXX XXXX, these practices have also jeopardized my ability to maintain my security clearance, directly affecting my career And duty. 

1. Harassment and Coercive Practices : Navient has persistently made harassing phone calls demanding payment, despite my clear financial constraints. Their representatives have advised me to reduce my basic living expenses and even suggested that I borrow money from relatives to meet loan payments, showcasing a lack of consideration and ethical lending practices. 
2. Unreasonable Settlement Offers : On multiple occasions, Navient has pressured me to accept settlement offers that were not financially feasible. They presented these offers as once-in-a-lifetime opportunities, using high-pressure tactics to coerce acceptance. 
3. Invasion of Privacy : Navient has overstepped boundaries by contacting my family members without my consent, seeking personal information and payment towards my student loans. This not only breaches privacy norms but also places undue stress on my family relationships. 
4. Educational Institution Misconduct : I attended the XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX from XXXX to XXXX, a school that has since been closed due to predatory and illegal practices. The loans for this institution, initially serviced by Sallie Mae and later by Navient, have been a source of continual struggle due to the deceptive circumstances under which they were promoted and agreed upon. 
5. Discharge Under BDTR : My federal loans have been discharged under the Borrower Defense to Repayment ( BDTR ) due to the recognized misconduct of my educational institution. However, the ongoing issues with Navient, including their handling of my remaining loans and their aggressive collection practices, continue to cause significant personal distress and financial instability. 

These actions by Navient represent a blatant disregard for borrower rights and protections that are expected from a federal loan servicer. Managing these loans under such aggressive and unethical tactics has not only financial implications but also potential long-term effects on my career in the military. 

I urge the CFPB to investigate these practices and to hold Navient accountable for their actions that are contrary to the principles of fair and ethical lending. 

Thank you for your attention to this matter. I look forward to your prompt response and resolution.

Since Navient Private Loans has refused to lower my monthly payment, I am appealing to you for help. My inability to pay what they're asking -- through no fault of my own -- will certainly ruin my credit score as well.

Issue: Improper use of your report
Sub-issue: Reporting company used your report improperly
Consumer complaint narrative:
It's recently come to my attention that the various credit reporting agencies XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX, Navient are in violation of the Fair Credit Reporting Act and the Privacy Act of 1974. Navient is also in violation of Family Educational Rights and Privacy Act. 

Please carefully examine this complaint as my rights are being violated. 
I'm unable to acquire loans or credit that I desperately need right now to take care of my family. 
This information is damaging me. 
I'm unable to get a vehicle. 
I'm unable to purchase things that I need for my family, even though that I have a right to credit. 
I'm being denied it. 

15 U.S.C. 1681, Congressional Findings and Statement of Purpose, Say the Accuracy and Fairness of Credit Reporting.Congress makes the following findings : There is a need to ensure that consumer reporting agencies exercise their grave responsibilities with fairness, impartiality, and a respect for the consumer 's right to privacy. 


There is no respect for the consumer 's right to privacy. 
But there is a need to protect my right to privacy. 
Reporting my transaction history is illegal. 
Any and all consent to XXXX, XXXX, ( Furnisher of information to credit agencies ) whether it be verbal, non-verbal, written, implied or otherwise is revoked. 

15 U.S.C. Subsection 1681B says the permissible purposes of Consumer Reports, any consumer agency, consumer reporting agency may furnish a consumer report under the following circumstances and no other, in accordance with written instructions of the consumer according to whom it relates, which means they need my written consent to add anything to my consumer report and I did not give this authorization, which is a violation of the FCRA.

Furthermore, 15 U.S.C. 1681c says requirements relating to information contained in the Consumer Reports, except it's authorized under subsection b, no consumer reporting agency may make any consumer report containing any of the following items of information, any other adverse item of information other than convictions of crimes which annotates the report by more than seven years.

Well, I have no convictions of crime and therefore I should have no discrepancies or derogatory marks on my consumer report. 
This is yet another violation. My account is an adverse item they are reporting. 

15 U.S.C. 1681E, Compliance Procedures, states, Identity and Purposes of Credit Users. Every consumer reporting agency shall maintain reasonable procedures designed to avoid violations of Section 1681C of this title and to limit the furnishing of consumer reports to the purposes listed under Section 1681B. These procedures shall require that prospective users of information identify themselves, certify the purposes for which the information is sought, and certify that the information will be used for no other purpose.

Every consumer reporting agency shall make a reasonable effort to verify the identity of a new prospective user and the uses certified by such prospective use prior to furnishing such user consumer report.

No consumer reporting agency may furnish a consumer report to any person if has reasonable grounds for believing that the Consumer Report will not be used for a purpose listed in Section 1681B of the Title.

b. The Accuracy of the report whenever a Consumer Reporting Agency prepares a Consumer Report, it shall follow reasonable procedures to assure maximum possible accuracy of the information concerning the individual about whom the report relates, But the information on my report is inaccurate.

and information contained in Consumer Reports, they, XXXX, XXXX, and XXXX XXXX are violating compliance procedures under this Title.

15 U.S.C. Subsection 1681N, Civil Liability for Willful Noncompliance, states that a. In general, any person who willfully fails to comply with any requirement imposed under this subchapter with respect to any consumer is liable to that consumer in an amount equal to the sum of at least {$1000.00}. 
Furthermore, if they can prove they willfully violated Section 1681N, they are liable to You're entitled to at least {$1000.00} per violation and any other damages sustained as a result for failure to follow the law.

And as I stated, I have damages because I've been unable to get a loan, I've been unable to get a vehicle, I've been unable to get credit.

I can only get a secure credit card right now because of all this damaging information on my credit report.

These various reporting agencies have a full understanding of the violations that I have stated to them after I complained the first time.

Each of these companies said in their agreements with consumers that they would follow the law and agreed to do so, but they are well aware that they are breaking the law.

15 U.S.C. 1681-O, Civil Liability for Negligent Noncompliance .

In general, any person who is negligent in failing to comply with any requirement imposed under this subchapter with respect to any consumer, is liable to be fined {$1000.00}, Is liable to that consumer in an amount equal to the sum of any actual damages sustained by the consumer as a result of the failure. Negligent non-compliance means the law was violated not on purpose but due to a lack of knowledge on the required reporting procedures.

15 U.S.C. 1681 S-2 states responsibilities of furnishers of information to consumer reporting agencies.

Number one, prohibition states that reporting information with actual knowledge of errors, a person shall not furnish any information relating to the consumer to any consumer reporting agency if the person knows or has reasonable cause to believe that the information is inaccurate. 

The information on this report is highly inaccurate. 

These agencies have been notified that there's inaccurate information and they have not stopped reporting that information and they have not been able to prove that it is in fact valid. 
These violations of the F.C.R.A. are one of the reasons that I filed this complaint today and because I need your help.

The violations of the Privacy Act of 1974.

The term record means any item collection or grouping of information about an individual that is maintained by an agency including but not limited to his education, financial transactions and that contains his name or the identifying number, symbol or other identifying particular assigned to the individual.

This includes consumer reports.

Section B, Conditions of Disclosure states that no agency shall disclose any record which is contained in a system of records by any means of communication to any person or to another agency except pursuant to a written request by or with the prior written consent of the individual whom the record pertains.

I never gave any written consent nor did they send any request for my permission to disclose any of this information. Had they sent it, as theyre required by law to do, I would have denied consent.

Section 3711E of Title 31 states, When trying to collect a claim of the government under a law, the head of an executive, judicial, or legislative agency shall disclose to a consumer reporting agency information from a system of records that a person is responsible for a claim if the head of the agency has established procedures to get satisfactory assurances from each consumer reporting agency that the agency is complying with all laws of the United States related to providing consumer credit information.

As you can see, they violated the FCRA and the Privacy Act of 1974.

I have tried to opt out using the Opt Out Laws, Part 1016, Privacy of Consumer Financial Information in Regulation P.

12 C.F.R. Subsection 1016.1 Purpose and Scope. Purpose, this part, governs the treatment of non-public personal information about consumers by the financial institutions listed in paragraph B of this section. This part, one, requires a financial institution to provide notice to consumers about its privacy policies and practices.

I have been notified of no such privacy policy or practice.

Two, describes the conditions under which a financial institution may disclose non-public personal information about consumers to non-affiliated third parties, and three, provides a method for consumers to prevent a financial institution from disclosing that information to most non-affiliated third parties by opting out of that disclosure.

Every company owes me a privacy notice before they furnish any of my information on my consumer report and I have been given no such notice.

12 CFR 1016.4 Initial Privacy Notice to Consumers Required. It must be stated ... Providing clear and conspicuous notice that accurately reflects my privacy policies and practices to a customer, an individual who becomes your customer, except as provided of this subsection, and consumer, a consumer before you disclose any non-public personal information about the consumer to any non-affiliated third party.

12 CFR subsection 1016.7, the form of opt-out notice to consumers, opt-out methods, section A. The form of opt-out notice must provide a clear and conspicuous notice to each of the consumers that accurately explains the right to opt-out under that section.

The notice must state that you disclose or reserve the right to disclose non-public personal information about your consumer to a non-affiliated third party, and that the consumer has the right to opt-out of that disclosure and a reasonable means by which the consumer may exercise the opt-out right.

Two. Examples. Reasonable opt-out means you provide a reasonable means to exercise an opt-out right if you designate check-off boxes in a prominent position on the relevant forms with an opt-out notice, include a reply form together with the opt-out notice.

In the case of financial institutions described in section 1016.3, section 1, section 3 of this part includes the address to which the form should be mailed.

Unreasonable opt-out means that you do not provide a reasonable means of opting out if the only means of opting out is for the consumer to write his or her own letter to exercise that opt-out right, or the only means of opting out as described in any notice subsequent to the initial notice is the use of a check-off box that you provided with the initial notice but did not include with the subsequent notice.

Section G, time to comply with the opt-out.

They must comply with my consumer 's opt-out direction as soon as reasonably practicable after they received it, but they have not done so.

Section H, the continuing right to opt out. In general, a financial institution may not disclose non-public personal information to a non-affiliated third party unless the consumer is given the opportunity before the time that such information is initially disclosed to direct that such information not be disclosed to such third party and c. the consumer is given an explanation of how the consumer can exercise that non-disclosure option.

They were supposed to give me an opt-out notice for anything that was added to this report No such notice was ever given to me.

15 USC subsection 6805 states that the enforcement of all the infractions listed above must be directed to the Consumer Financial Protection Bureau.

That is why I have contacted you to exercise my right to opt out of anything damaging on this report at any time, and these companies have not complied as soon as reasonably practicable after I sent them a notice.

They've only given me the unreasonable means to opt out, I had to write them my own letters directing them to stop reporting in accordance with the laws listed above, and they still have not stopped reporting. 
Please help me get access to my credit. 
Help me remove these damaging reports from my credit reports so that I can get credit, so that I can get a vehicle, loans, and general access to my credit so that I can take care of my family and our needs. 
Thank you very much.

Consumer complaint narrative:
Thousands of students were scammed by Navient into taking out predatory private loans to attend for profit online schools such as the one I attended, XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX. As a matter of fact, XXXX was investigated by XXXX XXXX XXXXXXXX? XXXX -- XXXX Because of the numerous claims of fraud and misconduct perpetrated by these online for profit schools, such as XXXX, I was able to file a Borrower Defense claim with the Dept. of Education against XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX, and my Fed. loans of over {$200000.00} were discharged and my credit repaired. 
My XXXX XXXX Claim was also part of the XXXX XXXX XXXXXXXX settlement for which I was a full class member. 
I am aware that Navient was sued by XXXX state AGs regarding their predatory loans to attend these online for-profit schools and that Sallie Mae/Navient were XXXX " preferred '' lending company in a " deal '' with these schools during the early XXXX XXXX. These private loans with a high risk of default were part of a package deal offered to " for profit online schools ''. But loans made to students in states outside of the agreement, or those who were not in default for 7 months or more during a " specific '' time frame, were excluded. I am sure this was a big win for Navient, but what a sham of a settlement deal for the rest of borrowers scammed into taking loans to at least XXXX for profit online schools. After the XXXX settlement, didn't Navient also get out of the Federal student loan business due to scrutiny from lawmakers and borrower advocates? Didn't Navient have to pay restitution to the Federal student loan borrowers for not informing students of XXXX payments XXXX could have enrolled in, but instead steered toward forbearance? Furthermore, hasn't Navient been sued at least a half dozen times for other predatory loan practices and illegal collection practices? 
I am also aware of a " pilot '' program by which Navient is sending out " applications '' to select students who may have filed XXXX XXXX claims against their schools and were approved. This application is a sham. Why do we need to prove anything? Navient knows who we are. Under the FTC " Holder Rule '' Navient is liable for giving predatory loans in connection with online for-profit schools. Time is running out for Navient to do right by students who were scammed into taking out private loans to attend online for profit colleges who have committed misconduct and misrepresented themselves to the public to entice students to enroll. XXXX XXXX XXXX has sent a letter to Navient 's CEO asking to discharge these loans NOW! It's time Navient do the right thing and discharge all these predatory private loans made to attend online for profit schools NOW!

Consumer complaint narrative:
XX/XX/XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX, MA XXXX XXXX Navient Corporation Customer Service Department XXXX XXXX  XXXX XXXX XXXX PA XXXX XXXX : Demand for Refund Dear Sir/Madam, I hope this letter finds you well. I am writing to formally demand a refund pertaining to in my name with Navient. I have carefully reviewed the loan agreement and believe that I am entitled to a refund based on the following grounds : 1098-E : According to my records which I have reviewed all my tax documents which have been completed by a licensed accountant per IRS standards with over 30 years of experience. I obtained copies of tax returns submitted to the IRS along my originals to ensure any discrepancies that may have been submitted on my end which no discrepancies found. However multiple discrepancies that were found on Navient 's part. I requested copies of all 1098-E forms from Navient which I received XX/XX/XXXX. I was not provided copies of the 1098-Es. The amounts on the document from Navient pertaining to the loan in question are inaccurate which is of concern and validates my payments were processed to a loan that is not mine. 

I spoke with XXXX XXXX XXXX who works in your consumer advocate department in reference to all the aboveXXXX XXXX also provided me an EIN that does not reflect the 1098-Es that I have and are not listed on the documents I obtained from the IRS. The EIN numbers on the 1098-Es all pertain to Federal Student loans. This is very concerning which validates that Navient listed this private loan under my federal loan account number and attached another account number to represent a private loan which would be beneficial for Navient upon tax filing.

Misrepresentation : I requested copies of all loan documents. I was provided documents that are concerning. I was provided two disclosures with different dates which I have questioned multiple times and not been provided an answer as to why the dates are different, a loan application that has a signature that is not mine along with no date. I was provided loan information that validates Navient consolidated a private and federal loan under the account number XXXX although uses XXXX and continued to accept payment. Interchanging loan numbers/account numbers/grouping has been an issue for many with Navient as mentioned in XXXX of the lawsuits. I expect Navient to rectify this by refunding the full loan amount, payments and interest. 
Transaction history varies from paper work I was provided in XX/XX/XXXX from the Navient website. Upon reviewing the Navient transaction list on the website a payment of {$1.00} is noted. A payment made that month was allocated to XXXX XXXX for {$100.00}. Navient transferred loans to XXXX that also do not reflect correct amount. 

Navient has had multiple lawsuits pertaining to unfair, deceptive practice and violating consumer protection laws. 
XXXX of the lawsuits was filed by The Massachusetts Attorney General along with other state XXXX XXXX. The lawsuits filed was pertaining to Navient violated consumer protection laws by engaging in unfair and deceptive servicing and collection practices and, as XXXX XXXX, originating predatory subprime private student loans. 
Another lawsuit filed by the CFPB because Navient XXXX XXXX at Every Stage of Repayment. Navient, Formerly Part of XXXX XXXX, Illegally Cheated Borrowers Out of Repayment Rights Through Shortcuts and Deception The settlement included conduct reforms, including prohibitions on unfair and deceptive conduct and terms designed to ensure that Navient improves its servicing and debt collection operations which Navient has not done. 


I have attached copies of relevant documents, including payment records and correspondence with Navient, to support my claim. I have also made attempts to resolve this matter through your customer service department, but have not received a satisfactory response. 

I demand that Navient rectify this situation within 30 days. Rectification is to include a full refund with in the 30 days from the date on this letter in the form of a check and remove this trade line from my credit report. Navient is to inform XXXX, XXXX, XXXX and XXXX along XXXX any other CRA that Navient reports XXXX. 

Failure to address this matter satisfactorily I will take further legal. I trust that Navient will handle this matter with the utmost urgency and professionalism. 

Thank you for your immediate attention to this matter. I look forward to a prompt resolution. 

Sincerely, XXXX XXXX

Sub-issue: Trouble with how payments are being handled
Consumer complaint narrative:
I am writing to file a complaint against Navient Student Loans regarding the mishandling of a settlement payment that I was supposed to receive in XX/XX/XXXX. 

In XX/XX/XXXX, I received a notice from the IRS stating that I had received income in the amount of {$5000.00} from a settlement with Navient. This settlement resulted from a lawsuit in which Navient was sued for charging military members and others improper fees. However, I never received this {$5000.00} check. I was not aware that I was part of a class action lawsuit, and I had never received any check or notification about this settlement. 

Upon receiving the IRS notice, I immediately contacted Navient to inquire about the supposed {$5000.00}. Navient informed me that the check had been sent out, but since I did not cash the check within the 90-day period before it was voided, the funds were then kept by Navient and distributed across my student loans in a way that did not benefit me. 

Furthermore, Navient provided me with the contact information for the company they used to distribute the checks. When I contacted this company, they could not provide me with any check number or confirmation that a {$5000.00} check had been mailed to my known address. 

Instead of benefiting me, Navient split the {$5000.00} between two small loans I had, one for {$2000.00} and another for {$3000.00}. This action did not benefit me as a consumer. If Navient had applied the {$5000.00} to pay off one of the loans, it would have been more advantageous for me. However, they chose to distribute the funds in a manner that did not consider my best interests. 

I submitted a complaint to the Consumer Financial Protection Bureau back inXX/XX/XXXX regarding this issue. However, I do not believe I received a response or resolution to my complaint filed at that time. 

I feel that I have been wronged by Navients handling of this settlement payment. Not only did I not receive the check, but I was also denied the opportunity to use the funds in a way that would have benefited me the most.
