Consumer complaint narrative: I sent dispute notices to all credit bureaus as well as Navient to launch an investigation. I am not the only consumer having issues with Navient. They are not trying to resolve any issues. I was recently discharged from XXXX XXXX bankruptcy and my overall student debt was at {$45000.00}. Since I am a XXXX XXXX I applied for student loan forgiveness and my loans were consolidated. Navient was the servicer. Not one time did I receive notice in XX/XX/XXXX that I had a balance with Navient and that {$7000.00} was a private educational loan. They didn't attempt to call or anything. Before initially filing for bankruptcy when I was making payments with Navient, not one time was there a break down on statements indicating a public and private loan. Nevertheless they were provided with updated mailing addresses and telephone numbers as I went through a divorce. The only reason why I learned of the private loan was because I applied for a credit card to rebuild my credit and was denied because Navient reported to all credit bureaus delinquency dating back to XX/XX/XXXX. I immediately contacted Navient and got the run around. Finally XX/XX/XXXX I spoke with a Navient representative, filed a dispute with them to investigate the matter and at that time I spoke with a supervisor who told me it was my responsibility to update demographic information and I stated my information was updated back in XXXX before filing bankruptcy. I was then afforded an opportunity to enter a payment plan to where they can debit my account to take out monthly payments. They also told me that if I make 3 consecutive monthly payments, they will remove the late payments they reported to the credit bureaus and I have done just that. My first payment came out XX/XX/XXXX and I have been current since the agreement. Navient has not followed through with the agreement. They took the late payment off from XXXX, XXXX, XXXX, XXXX, XXXX, but put the late payments at the back end of the year for XXXX ( 30 days late ) and XXXX ( 60 days late ), but XX/XX/XXXX currently paid. So they didn't remove it just moved it back to the year end of XXXX. How can that be possible if my first agreed upon payment wasn't scheduled until XX/XX/XXXX. This has really ruined my credit. I am in the process of trying to get pre-approved for a mortgage and I can not move forward until they remove the late payments as agreed. I have written them letters and have called and they are unfairly treating consumers. Can someone please help me get this issue resolved with the late payments being removed as agreed because at this point Navient is practicing XXXX  techniques.

Consumer complaint narrative:
My private loan balance is now {$87000.00} with the lender Navient. My student loans consist of two Signature loans- one of {$51.00}, XXXX ( original principal was {$18000.00} ) and the other of {$35000.00} ( original principal was {$13000.00} ) both with a 15 % interest rate. 

I can not make the original monthly payment to Navient as I have been in a financial hardship for years and I can not keep up with the payments as the interest has buried me in these loans and I owe way more that I have borrowed. 

My loan was for the XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX in XXXX XXXX in XXXX  and was told in admissions at the school that the degree from that XXXX XXXX XXXX was highly sought after in the worldwide XXXX  XXXX  industry, and especially in XXXX XXXX, I would have no trouble landing a great, high paying XXXX XXXX  job if I completed the course. I learned that this is not true as the degree is laughed at the kitchens I worked. 

A few years ago, it was finally revealed that the for-profit college XXXX XXXX XXXX had nothing to do with the school of the same name in XXXX and that the XXXX XXXX  XXXX purchased the name and began sprouting campuses where they got in trouble and finally went under for misleading promises to students and shady business practices. XXXX XXXX XXXX is now defunct where my XXXX, along with everyone else 's who attended, has no value. 

I have tried to work with Navient with an income-based repayment plans throughout the years and have had trouble fulfilling even that. I asked if I could please place my loans in forbearance, but they say I can not do that. Issue: False statements or representation
Sub-issue: Attempted to collect wrong amount
Consumer complaint narrative:
I was contacted by Pioneer Credit Recovery by mail in a letter dated XX/XX/XXXX. In the letter, it was stated that I owe money to the Department of Defense for XXXX overpayment to XXXX XXXX for prescriptions dispensed to me between XXXX. The overpayment amount was {$3300.00}. That debt is legitimate and I own it and am glad to pay it. However, the total amount that Pioneer is trying to recover from me is over {$6100.00} due to administrative costs, penalties, and interest. 
I was shocked, as this was the first time I was hearing about any monies owed to XXXX, from nearly 7 years ago, no less. Apparently, XXXX XXXX  was sending correspondence regarding the overpayment to an address I was no longer living at, despite having my mail forwarded from the previous address to the new one via USPS. I have my ledger from my previous apartment that we were renting at the time showing when we made our last payment and the real estate contract showing when we purchased and moved into our new home. This happened nearly 11 months before they started sending letters about the overpayments. I can only assume that if the new residents received these letters meant for me, they tossed them rather than returning them to the sender. XXXX XXXX  states they never had any returned correspondence, therefore assuming I got the letters and was ignoring them. 
This information is beside the point, but my credit score has been over XXXX points for years. I have integrity and pay debts I owe ( obviously when it is a debt known to me ). I am in no way trying to avoid paying XXXX XXXX. The excessive fees and costs added on to the original debt, however, are unfair. I reached out to XXXX XXXX, who states they no longer own the debt and couldnt help. I then contacted XXXX XXXX to inquire about the debt and they couldnt find any record of it anywhere. I have spoken to XXXX from Pioneer Credit Recovery several times trying to explain the situation and have not gotten any alternative recommendations on how to appeal the tacked-on fees. She simply added that I can either take out a personal loan to pay the balance or my wages could begin being garnished or a lien could be placed on my home, which were all scary thoughts and made me very anxious. I sent a dispute letter on XX/XX/XXXX, which was forwarded to the XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX. They responded on XX/XX/XXXX by mail stating that the original debt owed to the Department of Defense was valid and to proceed with collection efforts. Again, I am happy to pay a debt I owe as long as I know I owe it.

I was unable to find any direct phone number to the XXXX XXXX Dispute Resolution division at the Treasury Bureau of the Fiscal Service. They only have a fax number and email address listed to the public for use if the consumer has any questions regarding the dispute. I sent an email to them on XX/XX/XXXX to further discuss everything previously laid out in this letter, and got an automated reply that I could expect a response to my inquiry within the next 60 days, which is not very helpful in reaching a prompt resolution while this debt continues to accrue interest. I also sent a letter by mail on XX/XX/XXXX to XXXX XXXX XXXXXXXX XXXX with an address provided by a XXXX representative during one of the handful of phone calls I made to them trying to get answers. As of today, Ive yet to get a response by telephone, ground mail or email from them. 
With fees and penalties accruing for 5 years before I was ever notified and made aware of the debt, I dont know who to appeal to at this point to discuss forgiveness of these extra charges. I would love to pay off the original amount I owe, make the situation right, and close the book on this, but Im feeling indignant as a responsible consumer. Every avenue I have gone down to try to amend this situation on my own has lead me to a dead end and Im running out of ideas on where to turn next. This is simply unjust practice by Pioneer Credit Recovery and I am hoping they can see that each individual has a different story, that some of us are responsible and honest and simply looking for resolution, and that wrongs can be righted in a situation such as this. 

I have enclosed all documentation and correspondence between Pioneer and myself since XX/XX/XXXX, along with my documentation proving I was no longer at the address on file with XXXX XXXX when they began sending me notices about the debt back in XXXX, and my letter to the XXXX. Hopefully you are able to help me make some headway with Pioneer Credit Recovery or XXXX XXXX XXXXXXXX XXXX to settle this debt fairly.
Company public response: Company has responded to the consumer and the CFPB and chooses not to provide a public response

Issue: Struggling to repay your loan
Sub-issue: Problem with your payment plan
Consumer complaint narrative:
I'm uncertain if I should or should not consolidate my ( XXXX ) loans? I have been paying consistently for over 14 years, after probably 6 years of deferment and forbearance ( that I was mislead into doing because I was steered that way, given my circumstances then, but... never advised of the effect it would have on my balance, or ballooning it as it has or ever advised of OTHER options ). I was told just last Monday XX/XX/XXXX by Navient that I should " strongly consider consolidation '' as it would " increase my chances of receiving debt forgiveness '' as opposed to not doing it and only having the lessor amount forgiven ( if at all ) and still be stuck with the higher loan to pay off then ... Is this an accurate statement, do you know? I HAVE NO IDEA WHAT TO BELIEVE OR WHO TO TRUST ANYMORE because of all the bad information I've received since XXXX with XXXX XXXX, my servicer then. And, by the way, I made a one-time, lump sum payment around XXXX to XXXX XXXX for XXXX initial balance then, in the amount of {$5000.00} and THEY FAILED TO RECORD IT and THERE IS NO RECORD of it, and IT NEVER CARRIED OVER TO Navient when they obtained my loan, probably around XXXX? 

That is the only reason I would even consider consolidation, because my current rate is 3.5 % and it will go up if I consolidate, but it seems REGARDLESS, that my debt fails to decrease because Navient has FAILED TO INFORM ME OF Charges that I've incurred, which I just found out again XX/XX/XXXX, and explains why my record of my current balance fail to match their " current balance '' and we're off by more than {$15000.00}! And, by the way, on SEVERAL occasions I've been promised records, but they NEVER ARRIVE in the mail, even after I've verified my address, and I've also been told sometime they XXXX not provided such records ... really makes no sense, but I digress. I finally obtained XXXX sets and have cross-checked them and compared them to my records and again, the math never added up, but once I was advised just last week of " hidden charges that were never disclosed '' that was the missing link and all of a sudden, now I know why- this information was disclosed to me by the last Rep I spoke with, but it still fails to resolve the difference in the supposed outstanding balance. 

I'm currently on an income-based repayment plan ( as of XX/XX/XXXX ), because I'm no longer able to pay the amount I was paying on my graduated repayment plan ( which was a complete rip off by the way, but was the ONLY OPTION I WAS OFFERED in XXXX when I was making payments then but was trying to work with them to actually make progress.. all the while just being financially enslaved to them for NO RESOLVE to my balance ), that I've been paying all these past XXXX or so years. 

The other " kicker '' that really gets my goat is that my loan was originally XXXX upon my graduation in XXXX, then after all the deferment/forbearance I was steered into ( and given NO OTHER OPTIONS ), it was all of a sudden XXXX. I've been paying monthly, non-stop, every month, even during XXXX, I haven't missed XXXX payment since this plan started and even before when I was paying religiously each month, for over XXXX, XXXX even be 19 years, according to my records. According to my calculations, I should only owe about XXXX or XXXX at XXXX Navient 's XXXX they say I still owe is OVER XXXX ...! As of today. Complete JOKE. No way to run a repayment plan for anyone or any reason. 

And every time I call, I get a new person and its a never-ending joke and I have to start all over and go with what THAT PERSON THINKS is " best '' and what they actually feel like telling me and offering me, regardless of what might be best for the situation. 

Not too mention ever since repaying my loans, I've been charges countless fee 's and interest, seemingly for NOTHING and to " bring my account current '' yet it never seems to make a difference with the balance, probably been charged multiple fee 's for the same missed or deferred payment, have been denied access to obtain records of my transaction/payment history, been unsuccessful to have them research and conclude about the missing and never accounted for one-time lump sum $ XXXX payment I made early on ( and I no longer bank with XXXX XXXX, so have XXXX access or records of my own, unfortunately ), have continuously received confusing and conflicting and vague information about options, repayment programs, forgiveness, qualifications, and other forms and options for repayment and/or relief, have been steered into interest accruing options such as forbearance and deferment without proper and clearly explained consequences and effects all while never been offered any other options that would've avoided ballooning my balance ( if in fact it is correct ), and it has just gone unresolved ever since I have been repaying, causing undue stress, anguish, frustration and costed me thousands apparently, never making much progress in actually paying down the balance, according to their records. All with no real explanation or information to justify, backup and explain their conclusion and calculations. It is literally just a nightmare and caused me to essentially conclude I will pay until I'm dead and screwed and will actually never pay this off, which is absurd, ridiculous and downright gross negligence and unethical. Pathetic.

Issue: Dealing with your lender or servicer
Sub-issue: Problem with customer service
Consumer complaint narrative:
Thousands of students were scammed by Navient into taking out predatory private loans to attend for profit online schools such as the one I attended, XXXX XXXX. 

As a matter of fact, XXXX XXXX  was investigated by the FTC and charged with making misleading claims about high graduation rates and high rates of job placement within XXXX months of graduation. Furthermore, XXXX was involved in a class action lawsuit XXXX, et al vs. XXXX XXXX XXXX, in which I was a full class member resulting in a settlement I received. 

Because of the numerous claims of fraud and misconduct perpetrated by these online for profit schools, such as XXXX, I was able to file a Borrower Defense claim with the Dept. of Education against XXXX, and my Fed. loans of {$90.00} were discharged and my credit repaired. My Borrower Defense Claim was also part of the XXXX XXXX XXXX settlement for which I was a full class member. 

I am aware that Navient was sued by XXXX state AGs regarding their predatory loans to attend these online for profit schools and that Sallie Mae/Navient were a " preferred '' lending company in a " deal '' with these schools during the early XXXX XXXX. These private loans with a high risk of default were part of a package deal offered to " for profit online schools ''.

But, loans made to students in states outside of the agreement, or those who were not in default fo
r XXXX months or more during a " specific '' time frame, were excluded. I am sure this was a big win for Navient, but, what a sham of a settlement deal for the rest of borrowers scammed into taking loans to at least XXXX for profit online schools. 

After the AG settlement, didn't Navient also get out of the Federal student loan business due to scrutiny from lawmakers and borrower advocates? Didn't Navient have to pay restitution to the Federal student loan borrowers for not informing students of IDR/IBR payments students could have enrolled in, but instead steered toward forbearance? Furthermore, hasn't Navient been sued at least a half dozen times for other predatory loan practices and illegal collection practices? 

Furthermore, I am also aware of a " pilot '' program by which Navient is sending out " applications '' to select students who may have filed Borrower Defense claims against their schools and were approved. This application is a sham. Why do we need to prove anything? Navient knows who we are.

Under the FTC " Holder Rule '' Navient is liable for giving predatory loans in connection with online for profit schools. Time is running out for Navient to do right by students who were scammed into taking out private loans to attend online for profit colleges who have misrepresented themselves to the public in order to entice students to enroll. XXXX XXXX XXXX has sent a letter to Navient 's CEO asking to discharge these loans NOW! It's time Navient do the right thing and discharge all these private loans made to attend online for profit schools NOW!

Thank you, XXXX XXXX XXXX Navient account # XXXX Borrowers defense # XXXX XXXX

Consumer complaint narrative:
I had FFEL loans at Navient that I made about $ XXXX in payments towards. I was approved for BDTR under SVC. I did not qualify for a refund of those payments because they were FFEL " commercial '' loans.

I was never warned that I would lose all rights to a refund in any circumstance, including BDTR. Lenders lobbied to make all of the same terms and conditions as Federal loans so that the government could not offer better rates and take profit away from them. 

No borrower received any better rate or service by staying with Navient, the interest rates are the same. There was no benefit for borrowers, in fact many of the benefits that Federal loans have, were taken away. And Navient has a long history of manipulating and neglecting borrowers.

With those things in mind, why are they still getting away with no refunds? 
They are Federally insured and backed, would they not get paid back anyway? 
Why were nearly all of the benefits of federal loans taken away, while offering nothing in return to compensate, like better rates etc.? 
Why would the Holder 's rule not apply here? 
XXXX XXXX and Navient never explained that a commecial FFELP was actually the worst option for borrowers. In fact I was given little information at all about it. 

It is beyond criminal that Navient has been getting away with so much for so long and profiting from it. Why does the DOE and CFPB not do anything about it? 

Navient needs to honor all approved Borrowers Defense approved loans by discharging AND REFUNDING all payments to everyone that has been duped and manipulated into these financially crushing loans.

We appreciate CFPB 's efforts in righting these types of wrongs. We hope to receive some reimbursement from the settlement.

Issue: Getting a loan
Sub-issue: Confusing or misleading advertising
Consumer complaint narrative:
Many students, including myself, were misled by Navient ( formerly Sallie Mae ) into securing predatory private loans to fund education at for-profit online institutions, such as The XXXX XXXX XXXXXXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX owned by XXXX XXXX XXXX As stated in this XXXX  Press Release : Art Institutes Students Secure Big Borrower Defense Win with {$6.00} XXXX Group Discharge https : XXXX XXXX also partnered with Sallie Mae ( now known as Navient ), to convince XXXX borrowers to take out private student loans to augment their federal student loans. These private loans enabled XXXX to maintain access to federal student aid dollars, and Navient benefited by being a preferred lender of federally-guaranteed student loans for AI students. Both XXXX and Navient knew students would not be able to repay these subprime loans and had a side agreement that protected Navient against losses. 
I was enrolled at The XXXX XXXX XXXX California, XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX ) between XXXX to XXXX. They used deceptive tactics to help augment private loans with their preferred lender, Navient. 
Some of the deceptive practices involved using high pressure tactics. An example of this was : Every school year I would meet with the Financial Aid Officer, and they would encourage me to fill out my FAFSA application / Federal Loans application, and Private Loan applications right before my next class would start.

This was a rushed process, and I was uninformed and not encouraged to look at all the applications they were getting me to fill out. There was almost no explanation, the focus was just to get me to fill out all the necessary applications they needed so they could quickly process everything to enroll me into the next school year.

There was a sense of urgency that they had impressed upon me to quickly fill out all these applications on-line without reading all the fine print.

I was pressured and misled into taking out high interest private loans at variable interest rates starting around 12 %. These loans included 3 Signature Student loans : XXXX Student Signature Loan Disbursement Date : XX/XX/XXXX Original Principal : {$13000.00} XXXX Student Signature Loan Disbursement Date : XXXXXX/XX/XXXX Original Principal : {$1100.00} XXXX Student Signature Loan Disbursement Date : XX/XX/XXXXXXXX  Original Principal : {$12000.00} Since the interest rates are so high on these loans, I have never been able to make meaningful progress towards paying off the original principal. Most of the payments were just going to the inflated interest rates. 
In addition to the School 's brochure/advertisement for XXXX  graduates stating that Web Design & Interactive Media Degree holders received an average salary of {$46000.00} a year within 6 months of graduation, Administrative Representative XXXX XXXX XXXX and XXXX XXXX XXXX mislead many students and I about the prospects of quality future employment by telling my graduating class of XXXX  and I that we would make at least {$50000.00} a year right out of school. Even though I graduated with Honors, due to the outdated instructional methods and curriculum, I realized I was ill-prepared for entry level positions in Web Development. 
After I graduated, I was only able to get a part-time position, paying {$17.00} per hour ( roughly {$21000.00} a year ). 
Within a year I was able to get a full-time position paying a salary that was significantly less than the expectation of {$50000.00} a year touted in oral statements by the faculty and significantly less than {$46000.00} a year as stated in the written brochure for the graduating class of XXXX. 
The combination of ads and brochures on inflated job placement and inflated salary figures, predatory and aggressive recruiting maneuvers, and high pressure tactics has been detrimental to my financial and mental health since XXXX. As a result of all of this Ive had to live with my parents for an extended period of time after graduation ; Ive also had to put off buying a house, buying a car, providing for a family, saving for retirement, mental health treatment, and delaying urgent dental procedures. 
I was in the first group eligible for discharge in the Borrower Defense Program under the settlement in Sweet Vs. Cardona. This case was related to fraudulent and deceptive practices of the XXXX XXXX and other for-profit schools. This led to the discharge of my federal loans totaling ( {$77000.00} ), a refund on the amount I paid ( {$18000.00} ) and the restoration of my credit. 
The XXXX XXXX and their parent company, XXXX, were subject to investigations by various state attorneys general and found to have engaged in deceptive practices. In response to widespread allegations of fraud and misconduct by The XXXX XXXX, the XXXX administration recently announced a comprehensive loan discharge for students enrolled at these institutions from XX/XX/XXXX, to XX/XX/XXXX. 
Navient, which was sued by the attorneys general of 39 states for its role in facilitating these predatory loans, had a specific arrangement with for-profit schools during the early XXXX, making it a " preferred '' lender. Despite this, the settlement terms provided by Navient were considerably inadequate, excluding many borrowers who took loans for attendance at approximately 150 for-profit online schools, unless they resided in certain states or had not defaulted for at least seven months during a specified period. I was one of many who were excluded. 
There was a class action lawsuit against Navient. ( XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX  in the U.S. Bankruptcy Court for the XXXX XXXX XXXX New York XXXX Navient agreed to a {$16.00} XXXX settlement to resolve a class action lawsuit claiming that student loan debt owned by the company should have been dischargeable during bankruptcy. I was also one of many who were not eligible for this relief. 
Moreover, Navient exited the federal student loan servicing business amidst legislative and advocacy scrutiny, following allegations of steering borrowers away from income-driven repayment plans towards forbearance, an action for which they had to provide restitution. 
Navient has also faced multiple lawsuits for other predatory lending and illegal collection practices. Currently, Navient is distributing " applications '' to select students who may qualify for Borrower Defense claims against their schools. However, this process feels unnecessary and opaque, as Navient is already aware of the affected students. 
Under the FTC 's " Holder Rule, '' Navient is accountable for these predatory loans issued in association with for-profit online schools. As time is critical, Senator XXXX XXXX has urged Navients CEO to immediately discharge these loans. It is crucial for Navient to take responsible action now by discharging all such predatory private loans associated with for-profit online education.

Consumer complaint narrative: I took out private loans with XXXX XXXX to attend XXXX. XXXX lied to me about many aspects of the education, including, but not limited to, quality and cost. I have filed a federal Borrower Defense to Repayment application for my federal loans. I also filed a School Misconduct Discharge application with Navient for my private loans. Navient denied that application just days after I submitted it, simply because my loans had been consolidated. But XXXX XXXX was the one that advised me to consolidate my loans, just a year after graduation. XXXX XXXX has held my loans this whole time- they disbursed them, collected on them, consolidated them into one XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX , and continue to collect on them. Yet they denied my School Misconduct Discharge application just because they consolidated the loans that they held. This is unfair and deceptive- XXXX XXXX had ample information about all of the wrongdoing XXXX committed when extending the loans, collecting on them, advising me to consolidate, and now, when I applied for a discharge. It makes no sense that they can now deny my School Misconduct application just because they consolidated loans that they held. I am working on filing an appeal of this denial with Navient.

Issue: Struggling to repay your loan

Consumer complaint narrative:
XX/XX/XXXX Consumer Financial Protection Bureau XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX DC XXXX To Whom It May Concern : Thousands of students were scammed by Navient into taking out predatory private loans to attend for-profit online and in-person schools such as the one I attended, XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXXXXXX XXXX  XXXX XXXX XXXX As a matter of fact, XXXX ( owned by the XXXX XXXX XXXX ), was investigated by the U.S. Department of Education and found to have engaged in substantial misrepresentations related to employment rates, salaries, and career services. 
Because of the numerous claims of fraud and misconduct perpetrated by these online and in-person for profit schools, such as XXXX, I was able to file a XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX the Dept. of Education against XXXX and my Fed. loans of over {$300000.00} were discharged and my credit repaired. 
My Borrower Defense Claim was also part of the XXXX XXXX XXXXXXXX settlement for which I was a full class member. 
I am aware that Navient was sued by 39 state AGs regarding their predatory loans to attend these online for-profit and in-person schools and that Sallie Mae/Navient were a `` preferred '' lending company in a " deal '' with these schools during the early XXXX 's. These private loans with a high risk of default were part of a package deal offered to " for profit schools ''. But loans made to students in states outside of the agreement, or those who were not in default for 7 months or more during a " specific '' time frame, were excluded. I am sure this was a big win for Navient, but what a sham of a settlement deal for the rest of borrowers scammed into taking loans to at least XXXX for profit schools. After the AG settlement, didn't Navient also get out of the Federal student loan business due to scrutiny from lawmakers and borrower advocates? Didn't Navient have to pay restitution to the Federal student loan borrowers for not informing students of IDR/IBR payments students could have enrolled in, but instead steered toward forbearance? Furthermore, hasn't Navient been sued at least a half dozen times for other predatory loan practices and illegal collection practices? 
I am also aware of a " pilot '' program by which Navient is sending out " applications '' to select students who may have filed Borrower Defense claims against their schools and were approved. This application is a sham. Why do we need to prove anything? Navient knows who we are. Under the FTC " XXXX XXXX '' Navient is liable for giving predatory loans in connection with for-profit schools. Time is running out for Navient to do right by students who were scammed into taking out private loans to attend online and in-person for profit colleges who have committed misconduct and misrepresented themselves to the public to entice students to enroll. XXXX XXXX XXXX has sent a letter to Navient 's CEO asking to discharge these loans NOW! It's time Navient do the right thing and discharge all these predatory private loans made to attend online and in-person for profit schools. 

Best regards

Consumer complaint narrative:
XX/XX/XXXX Consumer Financial Protection Bureau XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX, IA XXXX Subject : Complaint Against Navient Corporation for High Interest Rates , Poor Account Management , and Misleading Practices Dear Sir/Madam, I am writing to file a formal complaint against Navient Corporation regarding the mismanagement of my private student loans and their deceptive practices. The loans, which were originally intended to help me finance my education at XXXX XXXX XXXX  have ballooned into an overwhelming financial burden due to high, variable interest rates and misleading servicing practices. I believe that Navients actions have been predatory and harmful, trapping me in debt that feels impossible to escape. Below is a summary of the loans, as well as the critical issues I have faced. 

Loan Summary : I currently hold five private student loans, totaling {$61000.00}, with interest rates ranging from XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX. These loans were disbursed between XXXX and XXXX and have been in repayment since XXXX. Despite making consistent payments, the high interest rates have caused the loan balances to balloon over time, and the principal has barely reduced. Here is a brief overview of each loan : Loan 1 ( Account No : XXXX ) Originally {$4000.00}, now has a balance of {$5700.00} with a XXXX XXXX interest rate. 
Loan 2 ( Account No : XXXX ) Originally {$5000.00}, now has a balance of {$6600.00} with an XXXX XXXX interest rate. 
Loan 3 ( Account No : XXXX ) Originally {$3800.00}, now has a balance of {$5100.00} with an XXXX XXXX interest rate. 
Loan 4 ( Account No : XXXX ) Originally {$15000.00}, now has a balance of {$36000.00} with a XXXX XXXX interest rate. 
Loan 5 ( Account No : XXXX ) Originally {$5000.00}, now has a balance of {$7500.00} with a XXXX XXXX interest rate. 

Key Issues : 1. Unreasonably High and Ballooning Interest Rates : The interest rates on my loans, which range from XXXX XXXX to a staggering XXXX XXXX, are outrageously high and have caused my debt to balloon over time. Loan 4, for example, has accumulated {$38000.00} in interestmore than double its original principal of {$15000.00}. This practice of allowing interest to compound to such an extent feels predatory, and I believe it should be considered illegal, as it keeps borrowers trapped in a cycle of debt without a clear path to repayment. 

2. Poor Account Management : Navients handling of my account has been nothing short of frustrating. Despite my regular payments, the principal on many of these loans remains largely unchanged. Representatives I have spoken with often provide confusing and inconsistent information, leaving me uncertain about how my payments are being applied. I have little confidence in their ability to manage my account properly. 

3. Misleading Co-Signer Release Practices : Navient repeatedly assured me that after a certain number of on-time payments, my co-signer could be released from their obligation. However, despite meeting the payment requirements, I have encountered ever-changing eligibility criteria and have yet to secure the release of my co-signer. This has caused significant stress for both myself and my co-signer, who was misled into believing they would be freed from responsibility. 

4. Deceptive Rate Reduction Program : Navients Rate Reduction Program initially appeared to offer temporary relief by lowering my interest rate for six months, but the rates quickly returned to their original levels, erasing any short-term benefit. Instead of providing meaningful financial assistance, this program only delayed the inevitable burden of high-interest payments and prolonged my repayment period. The program seems designed to create the illusion of assistance while further entangling borrowers in debt. 

5. Lack of Education and Transparency : Throughout my interactions with Navient, I have sought clear guidance and information about my repayment options, interest accrual, and the status of my loans. Unfortunately, the agents I have spoken with lack the knowledge or training necessary to provide this information, leaving me confused about my financial standing and options for paying off my loans.

Personal Impact : When I took out these loans, I was young and uneducated about financial literacya luxury not afforded in the low-income environment where I grew up. I believed that taking out student loans was the only way to access a better future. Now, at XXXX XXXX XXXX, I see clearly the lies I was told. Like so many others, I was assured that education was the key to achieving the XXXX XXXX. Instead, I find myself trapped by overwhelming debt and mismanagement. This debt has impacted every aspect of my lifemy ability to buy a home, start a family, and live the life I worked so hard to achieve. What was supposed to be an investment in my future has instead become a never-ending financial burden. 

My Request : I am asking the Consumer Financial Protection Bureau to investigate Navients handling of my loans, with particular attention to the following : The application of my payments and why there has been minimal reduction in my principal. 

The legal and ethical implications of allowing interest to accrue to such an excessive degree. 

A full review of my eligibility for co-signer release and transparency regarding the requirements. 

The impact of Navients Rate Reduction Program on the life of my loan and overall balance.

I believe that Navients practices have been predatory and detrimental to my financial future. If these issues are not addressed, I am prepared to seek legal representation to explore all available options for relief. I hope that by filing this complaint, I can receive the support needed to bring resolution to this situation. 

Thank you for your time and consideration. I look forward to your response and hope that this complaint will lead to meaningful action. 

Sincerely, The XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXXXXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX

Issue: Struggling to repay your loan
Sub-issue: Can't get other flexible options for repaying your loan
Consumer complaint narrative:
Navient calls me every day three time a day even after I have spoken to a representative and let them know I can not afford what they want to offer me right now. 

They call my co signer all day every day and have left him messages. We are divorced and he has a limited income as well, he can not afford payments. They do not leave me any messages and call me from different numbers. I had been working with an advocate by the name of XXXX XXXX XXXX and have asked her repeatedly to call me but she does not respond. I have asked representatives to connect me to her and some say the can not, some say she is not available and some have disconnected me. I can not afford to pay {$1300.00} a month and I am asking for some restructuring. I do not have the credit to refinance. My co signer does not have the money to make payments either. I am going to have to default on this debt in order for the interest to stop and so I can finally pay down this debt with am monthly amount that I can actually afford. 

I recently joined a XXXX XXXX for support with Student Loans and Navient. There are some folks on there who are being very rude to customers who are venting and asking for private loan advice. One person who I believe works for Navient is named XXXX XXXX. It is not okay for Navient workers to be be demeaning and abusive to customers who are just seeking support and advice. I have sent screen shots of these conversations to XXXX XXXX XXXX my advocate. The XXXX XXXX is called Navient XXXX XXXX XXXX. It is a public group with XXXX members. You will see some very rude comments from XXXX XXXX or also XXXX XXXX. This should not be allowed. 

In addition, I received in the mail a few pink padded bubble envelopes with the return address listed only as " XXXX XXXX on the return label ( not Navient ) and a return address of XXXX XXXX XXXX, XXXX XXXX XXXX but nothing indicating it was from Navient. I opened it up out of curiosity and there was a letter from Navient indicating " XXXX XXXX XXXX. '' I would have thrown that away normally not knowing that would have come from Navient. Would that not be classified as Deceptive? What is a XXXX XXXX partner? who is it? and won't I be working with collections. This letter is basically a threat to sue. Is that legal? when I am trying to seek help? I can not afford to make any payments until XX/XX/2024. Stop harassing me. 

I have also been told different stories about different programs from many different representatives. No one can assist me at this point. There needs to be programs for folks who are on their own or whose circumstances have changed in life for them to be able to afford their loan payments. I do not want to default but I have no choice for now. 

I am asking for them to cease and desist all the phone calls from different numbers four to five times a day, Leave a voicemail for me and to not contact any of my family members looking for me. They have my valid phone number and I have been speaking with and emailing representative regarding my account.

Issue: Dealing with your lender or servicer
Sub-issue: Received bad information about your loan
Consumer complaint narrative:
When I went to check my student loan payment due for XX/XX/year> via Navient online portal, it said I didn't have any payment due. This is all within, I'd say, XXXX to early XX/XX/year>. I kept checking back, and it continued to say I had no payment due. I thought this was accurate after checking multiple times, because my husband 's student loans are on pause though the government and he has no payments due through his servicer. So, I assumed this information from Navient was correct. 

At some point in mid-late XXXX XX/XX/year>, Navient said that they would no longer be holding my loans ( told me via the online portal when I signed in ), and that they had moved my loans to XXXX. I tried to create an account and log in with XXXX to make payment, but it wouldn't let me -- it said something like " we don't recognize '' me/my account/my loans/etc.. I don't quite remember exactly what it said, but, basically, it was saying they didn't have my loans. 

At this point, I have zero access to any of my private student loans. Zero access to see them or pay them, or do anything at all, through either Navient or XXXX ( I logged back into Navient and they were still not there ). They just disappeared from the the portal entirely at Navient, and XXXX has zero record of me. 

So, here we are on XX/XX/year>, and, now, magically, my loans are still with Navient and not XXXX. I can now see all information. Now it says I have an " overdue payment '' and fees associated with the late payment, plus an upcoming payment. Keep in mind : I had *zero * access to my loans, and literally no way to make payment because the loans weren't even listed on Navient -- it's as if I never had a loan at all -- there was zero information at all. Now they are trying to push forbearance/deferment on me, all while harassing the co-signer, but they haven't even called me once to the best of my knowledge.

Now I'm in a financial situation where I can't pay until the next paycheck, because who can afford student loan payments and rent on just one paycheck? That means I'll get more late fees,
they will keep harassing my co-signer until it's paid, " late payment '' goes on my credit report, and now I have to somehow manage two payments for Navient *alone* on one paycheck. These aren't my only loans, these are only a small fraction. 

None of this would've happened if the accurate information was listed. None of this would've happened if I had *access* to pay my loans when they were actually due. How are these practices legal? 

No, I didn't take screenshots. I should have. But the XXXX  of figuring everything out, and spending literally hours to *find* where my loans are to make payment -- it doesn't even matter. At what point is any of this THEIR responsibility? These student loan servicers get away with everything, and we always are the ones to pay for it -- financially, emotionally, with our time, in late fees, etc. I don't want to play these games anymore. It's exhausting.

Issue: Issue with income share agreement
Sub-issue: Marketing or disclosure issues
Consumer complaint narrative:
In XXXX I applied to a school of XXXX XXXX. This school of XXXX XXXX guided me through the process of obtaining financial abilities to be able to fund the education that they would provide. Without this offer, I would not have been able to afford to go to school, and I was told I would not have any problems finding job placement. Federal loans were offered and would not cover all expenses, to which I was told that Sallie Mae would extend an offer to me to cover remaining expenses. The school not only marketed the school to offer students job placement afterwards, told the students that we would have no problem finding jobs that would more than well be able to pay off our loans, but also withheld the fact that they were a non-accredited school and that in order for us to practice in any other state besides New York or Ohio that we would have to take another exam called the XXXX, which is a foreign equivalency exam to be able to practice in the United States. I would have to take this test regardless of where I was born, even though I was born in the United States. This test had a XXXX wait period and cost an additional {$6000.00}. This was not disclosed to us until XXXX years into our education of our XXXX XXXX year long curriculum. Additionally, this university had over a 50 % failure ratemaking it even harder for borrowers to repay if they did not graduate. In XXXX Navient was found guilty of such predatory behavior. Until I was able to take this test, I was forced to live in a different state than my family and pay New York State income tax of nearly 30 % or my low income. There were additional monies that needed to be made available for rent food general living expenses, and we were not allowed to work while being in school and then guided towards taking out additional private loans because federal loans were max out. The dean and counselors stated that we would be more than eligible for entrance into the clinical year at stateside schools when in fact, there were only handful of schools that would admit us as non-accredited students coming from a foreign school and space was limited to XXXX or XXXX students over just a handful of schools. The university advertised that we would be in school year-round and be able to get us out into the workforce sooner, have excellent hands-on surgical skills, meanwhile, the school was not a accredited during my time at school. Sallie mae and now Navient, has used this to their advantage in predatory acts against students in financial need and distress. Upon graduation, it was very clear that employers did not want to hire graduate from a non-accredited school, which was direct opposite of what we were told. Navient offered forbearance after forbearance to help me out ; unknowingly that the interest would rack up and then they would charge interest on this interest. My initial loan was in XXXX for {$130000.00}. My current outstanding balance is {$100000.00}. Total interest paid to date is over 50 % of the original disbursement. Total interest paid to date is {$68000.00}. I have requested my transaction history from XXXX until today and the money that I submit for payment is partially being applied to interest first, then fees and lastly the principal balance. Over the last 15 years, all amounts are varied..even with the same amount paid monthly. The amount that Navient applies to interest payments are 95 % of the time much higher than what is applied to the principaleven 15 years later ie XX/XX/XXXX payment of {$1100.00} : {$190.00} went to principal {$900.00} went to interest : XX/XX/XXXX payment of {$1100.00} : {$280.00} went to principal {$810.00} went to interest. When I call to speak to someone at Navient they tell me that they are not sure and have placed me on hold and then come back to tell me the payment i make is put toward principle, interest and fees. I had to ask several times to clarify in WHAT order ; she then stated fees first, then interest and lastly principal. She told me that interest daily is {$27.00} ( $ XXXX ) which should be decreasing as the principal is also deceasing. 

Navient issued me a subprime private loan knowing I would have great difficulty in paying the money back graduating from a school with over 50 % failure rate and being unaccredited, and by driving to mislead me into forbearances, which stopped me from paying down the principal on my loan and led me to accumulate more debt and never-ending interest payments.

I am writing to formally request the discharge of my remaining loan balance of {$22000.00} based on the total payments I have made toward this loan, amounting to {$18000.00}. I am seeking this adjustment due to several factors, including Navients settlement with the Consumer Financial Protection Bureau ( CFPB ) over allegations of harmful servicing practices. 

According to the proposed settlement, Navient has been barred from servicing federal student loans and is required to pay {$120.00} XXXX in fines and compensation to borrowers who were adversely impacted by the company 's actions. The payments I have made to date demonstrate a significant commitment to repaying this loan. Thank you for your attention to this matter. I look forward to receiving your response and resolution of my request.

Issue: Getting a loan
Sub-issue: High pressure sales tactics or recruiting
Consumer complaint narrative:
The enrollment officer used a high pressure sales pitch that put emphasis on the fact that classes were filling up quickly, and that if I didnt act right away, I wouldnt be able to enroll or access financial aid. This occurred on XX/XX/year>. 

I was invited to what I thought was an information session. Instead, I was given a quick pre-enrollment exam, made to sit in their office for an hour for the results, and then pressured to enroll and seek financial aid. It was a very isolating and windowless environment. 
This all took place on the afternoon of XX/XX/year>. 

I have went to the admissions office for what I thought would be information session. Instead, they repeatedly advised me that if I wanted to be in the next semester class, it would be in my best interest to take the placement test. 

I took the test and while waiting for the results, they were still selling me on enrolling into the school and applying for financial aid and loans to cover the cost. It happened within a two hour period that covered the initial information session, the placement test, the enrollment application, and financial aid and loan application. 

During this time, I did not have any contact or communication with anyone besides the enrollment officer. I did not have a chance to discuss any enrollment decisions with any family or anyone else during this time period. It was almost like I was trapped in the admissions office. This all occurred in the XXXX XXXX XXXX in XXXX.

I spent two months on this application looking up evidence of the misconduct from attending The XXXX XXXX XXXX Minnesota from XXXX. I have already paid XXXX and still owe XXXX for ONE year of school!!!! I was in shock and disbelief that my application got denied!! When I called and asked for a reason they did not give me one instead saying it was stated on my denial letter which said ( copied and pasted ) Misconduct Discharge has been denied.

Navient carefully considers a variety of factors in determining whether a private loan should be discharged based on school misconduct and you do not meet the requirements for discharge based on misconduct by your school. 
What kind of answer is this!? I gave my everything and all the evidence they needed for it to be approved. I am at an all time low and disgusted with the denial of my application which should obviously should have been approved. They instead sent me another application. I told them I can not afford these payments any longer nor can my father who co-signed not knowing what he was getting into or understanding that this would be a financial nightmare from a predatory school and loan company. I am a victim and am looking for clarity, justice and a chance to breathe again. These private student loans through Navient NEED TO BE DISCHARGED. There have been several lawsuits for Navient federal student loans, what about the PRIVATE STUDENT LOANS WHERE WE WERE PRESSURED INTO GETTING WITHOUT KNOWING WHAT THAT MEANT!? I want to know EXACTLY why my School Misconduct Discharge Application was denied for attending an OBVIOUS for profit, predatory school and I dont want a vague statement or explanation. I want to know specifics. I also want these loans to be discharged. I proved it enough that the Art Institution I attended was a school of misconducttheyre all almost closed down and the one I attended is closed down. I want answers.

Due to the settlement and exposure of the fraudulent practices by Navient, I am disputing the entire loan. Please remove from credit reports. I am no longer responsible. 

XX/XX/XXXXXXXX  Consumer Financial Protection Bureau XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX Washington, D.C. XXXX Subject : **Complaint Regarding Private Student Loans Navient Corporation** To Whom It May Concern, I am writing to formally submit a complaint against **Navient Corporation** regarding their handling of my private student loan, which I believe involved deceptive and unfair practices that have caused significant financial hardship. 

I obtained a private student loan from Navient in XXXX, and have since experienced a variety of issues, including but not limited to : - **Steering into costly forbearance options** instead of receiving assistance with more appropriate repayment plans. 
- A lack of transparency regarding the terms and conditions of my loan, including changes to the interest rate and payment schedules. 
- **Failure to provide proper disclosures** at the time of loan origination, resulting in financial harm. 
- Deceptive practices, including **misleading communication regarding repayment options** and my eligibility for alternative solutions, which led to a worsening of my financial situation. 

These practices are consistent with the issues raised in the recent settlement between Navient and several states ' Attorneys General. I believe my case falls under similar circumstances, particularly concerning **unfair loan servicing practices** that were detailed in the settlement. 

I kindly request that the CFPB investigate my case and take appropriate action to address these concerns. I have included copies of my loan documents, correspondence with Navient, and any other relevant materials as evidence. 

Please let me know if any additional documentation or information is needed to facilitate your investigation. 

Thank you for your attention to this matter. I look forward to your response and assistance in resolving this issue. 

Sincerely,

Consumer complaint narrative:
Dear Consumer Financial Protection Bureau, I am writing to follow up on my ongoing case with Navient regarding my school misconduct student loan discharge application. While I appreciate the assistance provided by the CFPB that led to my application being acknowledged and marked as pending in my Navient account, I have yet to receive an official response from Navient regarding the approval of my discharge application. 

Moreover, XXXX of my private loans is currently marked as " suspended, '' and I recently received correspondence indicating that my loans will be serviced by XXXX starting in XXXX. Despite these developments, my primary concern remains the need for a full refund of all payments made on these predatory loans. 

My loans amounts have been updated to XXXX balance which is a step in the right direction however these loans were based on aggressive and deceptive practices and warrant a full refund. 

Background : I was enrolled at XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX, which was forced to close due to numerous violations, including aggressive and deceptive recruitment practices. The financial aid representative, XXXX XXXX, used predatory lending tactics to coerce me and my father, XXXX XXXX XXXX, into taking out these loans. These tactics included pressuring immediate enrollment decisions, misleading information about the educational services and employability of graduates, and obtaining our contact information through deceptive means. 

Given the aggressive and deceptive nature of the recruitment and lending practices employed, these loans are predatory and fall under the purview of the Department of Education 's regulations against such practices. 

XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX : I have already successfully received a borrower defense loan discharge for my federal loans, including processed refunds. This outcome further validates the predatory and unlawful nature of the practices employed by The XXXX XXXX, and underscores the need for similar action regarding my private loans serviced by Navient. 

Request for Refund : In addition to the discharge of the outstanding loan balances, I am requesting a full refund of all payments made to Navient on these predatory private loans. The XXXX XXXX and the documented predatory lending practices used by XXXX XXXX XXXX justify this request. It is imperative that Navient acknowledges the harm caused by these predatory practices and refunds the payments to rectify the situation fully. 

I urge the CFPB to assist in ensuring that Navient not only processes my loan discharge application promptly but also issues a full refund for all payments made on these predatory loans. I have provided substantial evidence to support my case, and I am confident that the predatory nature of these loans warrants this action. 

Thank you for your continued support in addressing this matter. 

Sincerely, XXXX XXXX XXXX

Issue: Getting a loan
Sub-issue: High pressure sales tactics or recruiting
Consumer complaint narrative:
XX/XX/year> I am writing to formally express my concern regarding the misinformation I received from XXXX XXXX about the nature of the financial aid package provided to me. Specifically, I was led to believe that the financial assistance offered to me primarily consisted of grants and federal Pell Grants. However, I have recently discovered that a significant portion of my financial aid package includes private loans, which were not clearly communicated to me at the time of my enrollment. 

When I initially inquired about financial aid, I was assured that most of my educational expenses would be covered through grants and federal assistance. At no point was I adequately informed about the inclusion of private loans, nor was I made aware of the implications of accepting such loans. This lack of transparency has placed me in an unexpected and difficult financial position. 

As a student, I trusted the guidance and information provided by the school 's financial aid office. The omission of critical details regarding the private loans has had a significant impact on my financial planning and overall educational experience. Had I been fully informed about the nature of my financial aid package, I would have explored other options or made different decisions regarding my education funding. 

I kindly request the following actions be taken to rectify this situation : 1. A thorough review and clarification of my financial aid package, including a detailed breakdown of the sources of funding. 
2.Improved transparency and communication practices for future students to ensure that they receive complete and accurate information about their financial aid packages. 


I believe that addressing this issue promptly and effectively will help restore my confidence in the school 's commitment to supporting its students. I appreciate your attention to this matter and look forward to a timely resolution. 

Thank you for your understanding and cooperation. 

Sincerely, XXXX XXXX

Issue: Struggling to repay your loan
Sub-issue: Problem with forgiveness, cancellation, or discharge
Consumer complaint narrative:
Reason for this complaint : I feel Navient participated in deceptive practice by not informing me of the XXXX  status that was automatically dropped on my loan account when I re-entered school for my XXXX XXXX. Furthemore, I did not know at the time that an XXXX  status disqualified any repayment from going towards forgiveness. Furthermore, I was not informed that there was a form that I could have filled out to nullify that disqualification and have my payments count. To me, my financial assistance in pursuing my XXXX was separate from my assistance for my XXXX. I did not inquire any financial government assistance for my XXXX and was paying for that as I attended right out. So, I was working while continuing to pay on my XXXX loan while attending school part-time ( paying for that separately ). During the XXXX  period, I paid {$12000.00} towards my XXXX loan. That totaled XXXX payments that I later found out would not count towards PSLF. Below explain the headache I went through trying to get a straight answer of why my {$12000.00} plus was omitted. Below also explains how I had to find out the way an XXXX  status hurts the borrower and how it is placed on their record through a XXXX search, not Navient. 

Background : My student loan was for me to receive my XXXX XXXX from XXXX University. I attended a local satellite location but later attended it strictly online. Upon graduating, I made my first repayment to Sallie Mae on XX/XX/XXXX. I continued to make my payments when my loan was switched to Navient. Due to financially hard times, my last payment was recorded on XX/XX/XXXX. According to the limited PSLF waiver, whether my payments were partial, full or on time, I made XXXX payments towards my student loan. I was employed full-time at an approved not-for-profit organization for XXXX  years during my repayment period. Every required stipulation I needed in order to be qualified for forgiveness under the limited PSLF was completed. I checked every box in order to have the remaining balance forgiven. My application was completed and faxed on XX/XX/XXXX. XXXX sent a follow-up letter that my application was successfully received. On XX/XX/XXXX, I received a statement from aidVantage that my total loan was eligible for consolidation. On XX/XX/XXXX, prior to the deadline, I received a letter from Navient that my total loan was paid in full as a result of my recent loan consolidation. On XX/XX/XXXX, I received a letter that the U.S. Dept. of Education reassigned my new federal consolidated student loan to XXXX for servicing. On XX/XX/XXXX, I received a XXXX letter that I had eligible loans and my employment qualified for PSLF. When I finally received my letter, what I expected to be my forgiveness letter from XXXX, it was actually a letter stating that I was basically short of the needed XXXX payments in order to be forgiven the remaining balance. I was puzzled and submitted a claim to get answers. I submitted so many cases and always got the run around for a simple question of why XXXX of my payments were not being counted. I submitted so many cases because I always got some copy/paste rebuttal and my case would be close. At first, it appeared there was a question about my employment and my payment periods. Below details the information from the letter. I reiterated the information in many of my cases. This is very lengthy due to me wanting to be very thorough, clear and for them to capture my understanding of why I thought the omission of my payment periods was unfair. I contacted XXXX via both electronic cases and actual phone calls. I focused mainly online to have records of my correspondences. 

In XX/XX/XXXX, I submitted a case to XXXX. 

I was looking over my progress and noticed that XXXX qualifying repayment periods were omitted or looked over. 

I started my repayment in XX/XX/XXXX. The system totally skipped over my employment months/years XX/XX/XXXX - XX/XX/XXXX and XX/XX/XXXX - XX/XX/XXXX ( below shows how the system skipped this period ). It went from XX/XX/XXXX to XX/XX/XXXX. The qualifying periods that are missing equals XXXX. 

I was employed full-time to the same employer during all those XXXX skipped periods as I was during the periods that were counted ( XXXX ). The " Need Employment Certification '' count keeps increasing because the system is calculating the periods XX/XX/XXXX to present. Furthermore, the system also states that all those payment periods that " need employment certification '' are eligible but require approved employment in order to qualify. 

My missed XXXX employment periods were eligible and should have been counted as qualified. The skipped XXXX periods in which I submitted proof that I was making payments should have been counted as qualified as well. The payments were there and so was my employment. The XXXX already qualified plus the skipped XXXX that should also be qualified equals XXXX. It says forgiveness is at ( XXXX ) and that I have XXXX of XXXX to go. If the system had counted my XXXX payment periods ( months ), and my XXXX missed payments, I would actually be over by XXXX periods and XXXX payments respectively with nothing left to pay.

FSA response : Dear *****, Thank you for contacting the U.S. Department of Education 's office of Federal Student Aid ( FSA ). FSA is currently in the process of automatically applying Payment Count Adjustment credit across certain borrower accounts. Borrowers will automatically receive payment credit on their loans for the following periods : any months in a repayment status, regardless of the payments made, loan type, or repayment plan ; XXXX or more months of consecutive forbearance and/or XXXX or more months of cumulative forbearance ; any months spent in economic hardship or military deferments in XXXX or later ; any months spent in any deferment ( with the exception of in-school deferment ) prior to XXXX ; and any time in repayment ( or deferment or forbearance, if applicable ) on earlier loans before consolidation of those loans into a consolidation loan. After the automatic adjustments are completed in XXXX, the FSA Ombudsman Office will begin the process of reviewing requests for manual adjustments. Please note that manual account reviews can not be conducted before the automatic account adjustments are completed. However, we will keep your complaint open until we can complete the manual review. I took out my first loan on XX/XX/XXXX in the amount of {$10000.00} and the second loan on XX/XX/XXXX in the amount of {$16000.00} my school 's student financial advisor told me that I needed to borrow {$10000.00} to stay enrolled in school and a couple weeks later she told me that I in fact needed to borrow another {$16000.00} because the tuition costs were {$26000.00} and not {$10000.00}. I was young still a XXXX who and I trusted the student financial advisor to correct the issue while also protecting me. She pressured me to borrow a student smart option loan that you pay {$25.00} but because I had 2 loans I had to pay {$50.00} a month while in school. I was told that my monthly payment to the loan went towards the interest while in school. I was told that the interest paid while enrolled would have an impact on my loan after I graduate and that my monthly payments for the loan was be affordable. I tried to consolidate my loans in XXXX I was told that the stipulations of the type of loan I had I was not allow to consolidate them. I tried to refinance my loans in XXXX but my credit wasn't good enough. Then I tried to refinance my private loans in XXXX they still said my credit wasn't good enough. Then I tried to refinance again in XXXX and this time because my credit was at XXXX score I thought my chances would be definite and I was told I could not because my school was close and there was no corresponding school they could link my loan to. Each of my private student loans are at 15.875 % interest. Navient will not work with me on a payment option I could afford despite being discharged from my federal loans because my school was found guilty for School Misconduct. My private loans have been an extreme burden for me and my family and the future of my family. Its held me back financially and I have run out of option. The day I received the School Misconduct Discharge application form Navient 2 hours later I received an email that Navient would be transferring my loan to a XXXX giving me a limited chance to submit my appliation and get an appropriate response before they transfer my loan. I have done my best to communicate with Navient and I have attempted numerously to make my situation better based on the circumstances I faced. I'm hoping that my complaint will have a better impact on how Navient handles my plee to me discharged from my Private loans or to help stop Navient with their aggressive collecting practices and provide me with option with a lower payment that I can afford.

Sub-issue: Problem with personal statement of dispute
Consumer complaint narrative:
In XX/XX/XXXX, I received a message that I was part of the automatic full relief group in the XXXXXXXX XXXX XXXXXXXX case, and that I would be reimbursed by XX/XX/XXXX, along with these loans removed from my credit report. 

I had the loans originally with Salle Mae, which then went to Navient as part of their restructuring ; and ultimately a couple of years ago I refinanced them with XXXX due to the interest rate accrual with Navient seeming wrong. As far as Navient or Student Aid looked at it, these were paid off, as they were now sitting with XXXX via a loan. As such, I have been expecting a refund from the portion paid to Sallie Mae / Navient which was mentioned would be reimbursed under the conditions of the case. I also expected these to have been removed from my credit report. 

To date, these have not been removed, and I have yet to receive any refund, or an update to my case. I sent a few messages to StudentAid.gov, who mentioned that the situation sat with Navient and to follow up with them. I reached out to them, who originally told me I needed to go back to StudentAid.gov to handle my case. So, it just went around in circles. I then received an update from Navient, indicating that my loans did not qualify for reimbursement. I inquired a few times why this was the case. The loans were Federally backed loans originally with Salle Mae ; I had no choice that it was converted to Navient. Further, even with Navient ; all but one of my loans indicated they were federally backed, including the interest that indicated " The interest rate on your federal student loans is set by federal law '' further showing that these were federally backed loans. They all had the same interest rate, a much lower rate then my higher private loan with Navient. 

I still have not been able to get any updates, or refund. I would appreciate any help which you may be able to provide, to ensure this reimbursement and update on credit report is expedited.

I'm not disputing the original debt at all, I owe the initial $ XXXX. And I can pay that with cash from my retirement account. 

The only payment plan they're willing to work with me on results in a {$1500.00} per month payment. I only bring home about {$4000.00} per month, while living in a high XXXX XXXX I can not afford that payment. And I certainly can't afford the {$950.00} per month, the amount they want to garnish my wages. The next step after wage garnishment is a law suite , according to them.

Issue: Dealing with your lender or servicer
Sub-issue: Don't agree with the fees charged
Consumer complaint narrative:
I was given the submission form for the School Misconduct Discharge Application after my first CFPB complaint and speaking with a NAVIENT service representative on the phone. I was never sent the hard copy in the mail that I was told to expect, but instead was sent it via the portal on their site, which I did not see until weeks later. It informed me that my loans may qualify for discharge and to fill out the application in order to start the process. 

I then took months to submit 200 pgs of information about the school 's misconduct and how it had caused harm to my life, exactly as the form instructed. It was difficult and painful at times to write, but I finally sent them the binder a week ago. Five days later I received word that my application had been denied because my loans did not qualify because they were consolidations. Only one is a consolidation, but I do not understand why they both would not qualify. I have paid far more than the principal for each at this point and continuing to collect on a fraud-based debt at 12.5 % is predatory as well as cruel. We have already paid for something that we should never have had to pay for in the first place- and yet they still want to collect on it? 

I was extremely upset by their denial of all of my application for those two loans that I have with them, totalling around XXXX, when I had been instructed that my loans might qualify. All of my Federal debt from XXXX XXXX XXXX has been wiped out as a result of the XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX and I feel that it is cruel and grossly unfair that NAVIENT continues to collect on debts from the same school experience. They say that my loans do not qualify because they are consolidations, but I have known many others who possess the exact loans and had them discharged as a result of filling out the same exact application.

I was shown false job statistics prior to enrollment. There was no mention of the holder rule that I could find on the promissory note, which I know is a federal violation of the holder rule. These are loans that originated in a well-documented case of higher education fraud and they should all be dismissed instead of continuing to be collected upon.

Product: Credit reporting or other personal consumer reports
Issue: Improper use of your report
Sub-issue: Reporting company used your report improperly
Consumer complaint narrative:
I sent a letter requesting the following and as of to date have not received a response. I also understand that Navient Solutions is not licensed in the state of Oklahoma to practice collections. 

I requested an investigation because I felt the item is not being reported legally, and on XX/XX/2024 I received a letter stating that your investigation was complete. Please explain to me how you conducted your investigation! 
XXXX. Please explain to me what your representatives uncovered to lead them to believe that you are reporting this item as it legally should be reported. 
XXXX. What certified documents were reviewed to conclude your investigation? 
XXXX. Please provide me a complete copy of all of the information that was transmitted to the data furnisher as part of the investigation. 
XXXX. What did it cost your company to obtain the documents needed to complete your investigation? 
XXXX. Please provide proof of your timely procurement of certified documents. 
XXXX. Did you speak directly to any agent of the company that was reporting the information to confirm the accuracy of what you are reporting? 
XXXX. If you reply yes to the above then : Who did you speak with? What was the date? How long was the conversation? What was their position? What number did you call? What is the name of your employee that spoke directly to the above party? What is the position of your employee that spoke to the above party? How long has that individual been employed by your company? What type of training was provided to this employee in order to investigate items of this kind? Were there any e-mails or written communications between employees of your company and the above party? 
XXXX. If so, please provide copies of all correspondence and copies of any and all conclusive documentation to prove that you have in fact conducted a reasonable investigation of the account ( s ) in question. 
XXXX. Please provide the date of the commencement of delinquency. 
XXXX. Please provide the SPECIFIC date reporting of this item will cease. Enclosed with your response to the above questions, I respectfully request a notarized affidavit confirming the information that is provided is true and correct as per my civil rights granted under several federal laws. This information should not come as a form letter response. My initial dispute was detailed and directly related to the account ( s ) in question. A template response will not be an acceptable response. If you can not supply ALL of the above information in a timely manner as detailed in several laws, including but not limited to the Fair Credit Reporting Act, I must immediately demand the permanent removal of this item from my credit report. Consumer complaint narrative:
I attended the Art Institutes XXXX Minnesota from XXXX - XXXX and earned a XXXX XXXX XXXX in Advertising. I was pressured by recruiters from the XXXX XXXX at the time to take out private loans as my only option to fund my education, and was ensured by them that I would have no problem finding a job after this in order to pay for my education. I soon learned this was far from the truth. 

Like many others who went to this sham school, I had great difficulty in finding employment after graduation and as a result, had a very difficult time making the high student loan payments to pay for my education. I defaulted on XXXX of my loans shortly after I graduated due to lack of gainful employment. I had to survive financially off of credit cards and personal loans in order to get by, and I am still trying to dig myself out of this financial hole to this day- along with trying to pay down the balance of my Navient private loans. I owe MORE now than I did when I took the loans out, almost XXXX  years later. 

At XXXX XXXX XXXX, I have not been able to save for retirement or contribute to a college fund for my XXXX young boys. I hate to think that they are paying the repercussions that came from me falling for the XXXX XXXX scam when I was a young adult, but it is hard not to see it that way. 

I have applied once for the XXXX XXXX XXXX in XXXX of XXXX and was denied- with only a vague response from Navient, stating that " Navient carefully considers a variety of factors in determining whether a private loan should be XXXX based on school misconduct and you do not meet the requirements for discharge based on misconduct by your school. '' How did I not meet requirements? I documented the great financial harm I have suffered from this, I went to a school that has been proven to have engaged in deceptive recruitment and predatory lending practices and has since been shut down, and I have been included in the XXXX XXXX 's blanket discharge of loans related to this school ( although this did not help me because my loans are private ). I meticulously put together a binder of evidence, including screenshots of the inflated job placement statistics and " average '' salaries for those graduating from AIM, screenshots of countless rejection letters from jobs I applied to and emails I sent in the years after graduation seeking assistance in finding a job, and emails that were left unresponded to by career counselors that PROMISED to help me find a position after graduation. 

I was lied to about the merits of this education, was pressured into taking out {$80000.00} in private loans at the time that I signed up for the program ( which, by the way, I was told I had to sign the same day that I met with recruiters ), and over XXXX  years later am still deep in debt from this experience. I do not have family to help me out financially, as my wife and I are both from low-income backgrounds- something I have now learned was part of the recruitment tactic of AIM, to target those from similar backgrounds with promises of a great, high-paying career. 

These loans should be forgiven due to the misconduct that XXXX took in recruiting myself and others, as well as the pressure they placed on myself to take out private loans for this sham degree. I am attaching a letter that XXXX XXXX XXXX wrote last month, echoing much of what I have said above. 

I have re-applied for forgiveness and sent in my evidence again via email, and this time included a personal statement outlining more specifically the financial harm that this all has caused me.
