In XXXX when I enrolled in XXXX XXXX XXXX  at XXXX, the school encouraged me to reach out to Navient ( formerly Sallie Mae ) for student loans when I did not have the financial ability to cover the tuition. The determination to continue enrollment was based solely on the ability to obtain the student loans from Navient. Without the loans, I did not have the financial capacity to pay the full tuition. Navient encouraged me to apply for a private student loan called a XXXX XXXX. These were predatory loans that Navient and XXXX XXXX XXXX  worked together to encourage me to take. XXXX XXXX XXXX never mentioned there were other options for loans, they directly encouraged me to contact Navient. They also told me they were the easiest to get approved at. The school told me that I would graduate with a degree that would provide me the opportunity to make good money and pay the loans back. They promised that I would graduate, be able to get a higher paying job. This is not the case. I had to leave Hawaii to find a position that paid a low salary but enough to cover living expenses. I was barely able to make any payments to my student loans. Navient never encouraged me to continue to take federal loans with lower rates, they just encouraged me to borrow more and more private loans. 
Once I had secured the loans, the school began requiring me to take additional courses, repeat courses they had originally accepted, claiming they didnt meet their standards, repeat courses that were identical to classes I had already taken, yet they deemed not equivalent. The classes were identical. This delayed my graduation and ensured that I would pay more to the school for classes I had already completed at the school I transferred from.

Sallie Mae knew I was not credit worthy. I did not have a co-signer or a job that paid more than {$20000.00} a year and they still lent me {$36000.00} dollars worth of loans that would compound annually at a rate that was unachievable for a low income person. Navient approved me without much effort. At that time XXXX XXXX XXXX, working at a job that paid minimum wage, I had no credit. Navient quickly approved me for an 11.5 % student loan, sent me a check for {$7500.00} to start the other {$7500.00} would come at another time. Navient never explained that I would be limited to this interest rate even if I was to graduate, obtain a good paying job, and increase my credit score. This was misleading to me. I thought as I was able to obtain higher credit score, my rate could be reduced. This was not the case, nor was this disclosed to me. Navient continued to issue more credit to me despite my inability to make payments, or any foreseeable future employment that would allow me to cover these loans. In XXXX they distributed {$15000.00}, in XXXX they distributed {$8400.00}, in XXXX they distributed {$12000.00} for a total of {$36000.00}. 
They also charged me capitalized interest in XXXX of {$7000.00}, in XXXX capitalized interest of {$2500.00}, in XXXX capitalized interest of {$140.00}, in XXXX Capitalized interest of {$4500.00}, in XXXX capitalized interest of {$480.00}, in XXXX capitalized interst of {$1300.00} for a total of {$16000.00}. 
Upon graduation, when I was able to start repaying the loans, Navient would not reduce the payment amount to something affordable. I struggled for years to pay this. The only option that Navient would offer me was to defer/forebearance with a fee, while the interst still compounded. Navient never introduced me to any payment plans, anything income related, they just encouraged me to file for forebearance. The entire time in repayment, I wasnt really aware of the overall affects of all of these decisions until I needed a security clearance and the security officer encouraged me to consolidate with another company. It was then that Navient offered to transfer me to NaviRefi, their internal refinance company. Navient was then having me pay interest only payments, which ballooned my balance. This was years after struggling to make payment. In XXXX Navient transferred my loan balance of {$42000.00} to XXXX XXXX. This meant that even after years of making payments, I still owed more than I initially took. Navient also made me agree to pay additional time on my student loans, which increased the maximum amount I would have to pay. This was my only option to reduce the interst rate despite having an XXXX credit score for years. Navient also continued to process all payments to my lower interest lower balance loans and left my XXXX Signature Student with a high balance high interest rate. This ensured they would secure the highest interest rate compounded. I have paid over $ XXXX in payments and I still owe $ XXXX. Navient never applied the payments I made to the loans with highest interest rates. This kept my loan balances high on those which had the highest interest rates. 
Navient forced me into the refinance of my private loans after YEARS of charging high interest rates and multiple requests for a lower rate based on current credit score. Navient reused. When I went to find another servicer, Navient conveniently pushed me towards their refinance program. When I asked for the application for forgiveness, Navient then tells me that those loans are not eligible. This is a blatant attempt to keep me from holding them accuntable for their deceptive loan servicing, and their continued mistreatment of borrowers. 
In XXXX this year, NaviRefi transferred my loan without telling me to XXXX XXXX XXXX. 
Navient has, for decades, aggressively collected payments on loans that it knows are eligible for cancellationXXXX40 These predatory loans were given to students at subprime rates, while Navient XXXX with colleges that lied to borrowers about course credits, career prospects, and programs. Under the XXXX XXXX and due to Navient and Sallie Maes misconduct, Navient is liable for these predatory loans and should discharge them immediately. 
Due to all of Navients predatory deceptive measures, I put off major life things such as having children, buying at house, etc. Im now XXXX and in a position to have a child, and being forced to undergo XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX Its going to cost me {$40000.00} which It wouldnt have if I had been financially able to when I was younger. These are decisions I had to make because Navient refused to work with me or provide me with lower payments, lower interest rates, or any assistance other than forbearance that added time and financial obligations. 
I am submitting several attachments that include other examples of Navients predatory lending lawsuits that show that Navient has a history of defrauding students/borrowers.

Issue: Getting a loan
Sub-issue: Confusing or misleading advertising
Consumer complaint narrative:
NaviRefi employs a bait and switch tactic that puts a hard inquiry on students looking for loan refinancing. The bait is that in the first window, you see MULTIPLE " Check Your Rate '' buttons on their homepage without any indication that this check will be a hard inquiry -- not a soft check. Then, when you click on the button, you get to this page : XXXX XXXX XXXXnavirefiXXXX XXXX  At the bottom of the page, you STILL see a notice that says " Continuing this step won't affect your credit. '' This is all part of the bait.

The SWITCH happens by the time you get to a third screen and they allege that the message changes suddenly to, " ah, but this will affect your credit, after all. '' They hide or delay a completely polar opposite message -- after LURING you into the screen for several steps, rather than clearly labeling that completion of the process is, in fact, a hard inquiry. 

NO reasonable person would think that several steps and windows stating that a soft check is needed, would suddenly change to a hard inquiry. 

The fact of the matter is, I input my information on XX/XX/year> -- from the XXXX XXXX at the time, and this location has been verified by Navient themselves. It was almost XXXX or XXXX XXXX. or so for me, not to mention insomnia/jet lag had weighed heavily on me, so I was very easily trusting their process. I didn't even notice that the checkbox had changed -- as they assert -- to a different message. 

The whole time, my assumption was that the same consistent message of a soft check would continue the whole way. 

I did not expect a bait and switch. 

They need to be admonished and they need to remove this hard inquiry I never asked for. It is a predatory move. 

They need to state that everywhere, and from beginning to end, that the COMPLETE process requires a hard inquiry. Don't first state that entering information that does not at all complete the process is a soft inquiry or a " no check. '' Obviously anybody entering anything anywhere will not receive a hard inquiry. Contrarily, everybody entering complete information on NaviRefi WILL receive a hard inquiry -- and that message needs to be communicated from START to FINISH, not at the very end after switching up the message.

Issue: Dealing with your lender or servicer
Sub-issue: Received bad information about your loan
Consumer complaint narrative:
SUMMARY : Navient has failed to produce my original loan agreement/promissory note with my signature and consent, because it is likely that they do not have it. I have found an agreement noting several issues and contradictions, and I am trying to compare my findings with the agreement that Navient has on file for me. However, I now believe that Navient does not actually have this agreement on file. They have sent everything BUT the promissory note. They do not have the original loan agreement, or they do, but are hiding their copy because they may have noticed something on it that I myself, given my legal training, have noticed. 

A second issue is that I am filing this complaint to report discriminatory treatment by a Navient customer service representative during a call asking for the promissory note/loan agreement. 

On XX/XX/scrub>XXXX XXXX XXXX at XXXX XXXX, I contacted Navient to inquire about the status of my promissory note, a critical document necessary for reviewing the terms of my student loan. During the call, the representative rudely and unprofessionally sighed upon hearing my last name, and failed to say it or provide a reason for why she was not able not say it, which I perceived as discriminatory. When I addressed this behavior, the representative dismissed my concerns, stating, " You can take it how you want to take it, '' before abruptly hanging up on me. This interaction was both unprofessional and discriminatory. 

I immediately called back and spoke with a supervisor, XXXX XXXX, at approximately XXXXXXXX XXXX. Despite my request for legal department contact information, I was only provided with a general mailing address. 

Additionally, despite multiple requests, Navient has failed to provide me with a copy of my promissory note. This document is essential for verifying the terms of my loan and protecting my legal and financial rights. 

Basis for Complaint : XXXX ) Discriminatory Treatment : The representative 's behavior during our conversation suggests a potential bias or discrimination based on my identity. This is unacceptable and violates the principles of fair and respectful customer service. 

XXXX ) Failure to Provide Promissory Note : I have requested a copy of my promissory note on multiple occasions, yet Navient has failed to provide it -- because they likely do not have it. This document is crucial for verifying the terms of my loan and protecting my legal and financial rights. Navient needs to produce their copy, with my signature, NOW. They either do not have a copy, or they do but do not want to release it, because they have noticed something on it, like I have, that could land them in hot water. They failed to write the agreement properly when it came from XXXX XXXX to them and now that they are in the middle of transferring to XXXX, they will not be able to get away with it. They need to IMMEDIATELY send this note. I have requested it TWICE and each time they have lied and said they sent it. The documents they sent were not a copy of the promissory note. I will take instant legal action if they continue to fail to comply. 


I will be seeking further legal action on this matter, if not resolved satisfactorily. Although I will mail their legal contact, please note that a judge has ruled that Navient can not compel the borrower to arbitration. Although Navient argued that one of their borrowers was bound by an arbitration clause from the original loan agreement, the judge found that only certain entities explicitly listed in the agreement, such as the original lender ( XXXX ) and its successors, had the authority to compel arbitration. Navient, as a loan servicer, was not included in that list and, therefore, could not enforce the arbitration clause. The judge concluded that without clear evidence that Navient was a successor or had the right to invoke arbitration under the agreement, the borrower was not required to resolve the dispute through arbitration. Furthermore, given the date/time and language of my original loan agreement, I am not compelled to follow arbitration procedures. 



Request for CFPB Action : I request that the CFPB investigate this matter and ensure that Navient addresses these issues promptly. I also ask that the CFPB monitor Navient to prevent future instances of discriminatory treatment and failure to provide essential loan documentation.

***PLEASE NOTE THERE ARE 2 LOANS. I HAVE PROVIDED THE LOAN NUMBER FOR JUST ONE.

'' I have serious doubts that my application was genuinely reviewed and considered for the following reasons : Countless students on XXXX and XXXX have received the exact same denial response, suggesting a lack of individualized assessment. 
The application form was pre-filled with the specific loan in question, indicating that Navient was already aware of the potential issue and targeting this loan for private discharge applications. 
During the review process, I was notified that my loans were being transferred to another provider, XXXX, further implying that my application wasn't being taken seriously. 
These factors lead me to believe that Navient may not be genuinely evaluating these applications and that the denial decisions might be predetermined or based on factors other than the merits of each individual case.

Issue: Struggling to repay your loan
Sub-issue: Problem lowering your monthly payments
Consumer complaint narrative:
In the year XXXX, I enrolled into XXXX  XXXX XXXXXXXX XXXX XXXX  in XXXX, Virginia. To pursue my education, I was encouraged by the recruiter, with assistance from the financial aid office staff, to take out federal and private student loans. In XXXX, I graduated from XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX with a XXXX XXXX XXXX in the course of XXXX XXXX  without employment opportunities from the schools strong relationships with big corporations. 

Post-graduation, I was able to recognize how predatory the student loans actually were and how misleading the overall cost of the program would be. The school failed to make me aware of the actual amount that I would actually have to pay by the time the loan is fully payed off. The total tuition cost was approximately {$110000.00}. I have been paying these loans consistently and on time for about 12 years and I still owe around {$100000.00}. Over the past 12 years I have paid between $ XXXX {$16000.00} per year on these loans collectively. Clearly these loans werent meant to help fund education but meant make graduation students passive income for predatory lenders. I was put under the impression that as long as I pay the requested amount I should be able to pay off loan amount in initial expected loan terms. I feel like I was encouraged to participate in unfair and unmanageable loan terms. At the moment, even if I continue to pay the requested monthly amount, which is upwards of {$1100.00} per month, I will not be able to pay the loans off before I die as the interest will never allow me to. I feel like the plan was to make ambitious scholars like myself lifetime passive income for the lenders that are in association with the XXXX XXXX. During the pandemic, the lenders of those loans Navient Solutions , LLC and XXXX XXXX, XXXX decided to double their interest rates and ultimately boost my monthly payments to almost double of what they were pre-pandemic. Also, Ive been paying these loans by myself and they refuse to grant my request for a Cosigner Release as I have been denied multiple times. They know what my income is and have boosted my monthly payment every time I submitted a request for cosigner release so that they can say that I dont make enough money to qualify for cosigner release. 

The school exaggerated likely after-graduation earnings and during the recruiting process, I was told and lead to believe that, in my field, I should expect to make upwards of {$70000.00} per year upon graduation. The school also promoted direct access to XXXX 's relationships with big corporations '' that would offer expected salary. Unfortunately, neither claim by the school was legitimate. The school misrepresented it's partnerships with employers. I was told that for my graduation class ' XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX, there would be job recruiters specific to my field in attendance. I was under the impression that recruiters would be present and that I would have an opportunity to present my skills and resume to increase hiring opportunities. there were no recruiters specific to my major/career field in attendance. I was presented the idea that the career services department at each school has built strong relationships with big corporations and small businesses but none were present and no direct referral of my skills and services to these companies was made. 
As a result of the misleading a predatory behavior from XXXX  XXXX XXXX, I was left with the decision to submit and file a U.S. Department of Education Borrower Defense to Repayment Application to studentaid.gov in XXXX of XXXX. The decision on the BDR application is still pending as of XX/XX/XXXX. 

Effective XX/XX/XXXX, XXXX  XXXX XXXX system of schools permanently closed. As a result, my degree can be considered illegitimate and I am left with the burden of paying student loans that were acquired from attending the school. Consequentially, I believe that XXXX  XXXX XXXX pernicious business practice of collecting funds from student loans and then deciding to close down the schools within its system was ultimately an elaborate money-grab scheme leaving thousands of students with insurmountable debt, illegitimate degrees and the schools corporate staff rich. Now, I would like to submit a complaint regarding XXXX  XXXX XXXX for its ill-natured business practices, Navient Solutions , LLC and XXXXXXXX XXXX XXXX predatory loan operation.

To Whom It May Concern, I am writing to file a formal complaint against Navient regarding my private student loans that were taken out when I attended the XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX in XXXX. The U.S. Department of Education has recently granted loan forgiveness to students who attended the XXXX XXXX due to widespread and pervasive substantial misrepresentations that deceived students about the value they would be receiving from their education. 

Despite the recognition of these fraudulent practices and the subsequent loan forgiveness for federal loans, my private student loans remain outstanding, and Navient is threatening legal action against me. I currently owe {$18000.00}. 

I have consistently tried to make my payments, but with the rising cost of living, my payments have become unaffordable for me and my family. I have paid them what I could afford and I reached out to Navient to request an affordable payment plan. However, their only option was to lower the monthly payment slightly, which still left the payment above the threshold I could afford each month. When I asked them to work with my term limits, they declined and insisted that I either take their only payment option or face litigation. 

During my last conversation with XXXX, a representative from Navient, I explained that I couldn't afford their proposed payment option and that I couldn't sacrifice my family 's necessities to make the payments. XXXX rudely cut me off, stated she wasn't going to argue with me, and said she would forward my case to their lawyers to take me to court before abruptly hanging up on me. 

This treatment is not only unfair but also disrespectful. I believe that Navient should take into consideration the fraudulent practices of the XXXX XXXX and work with me to find a reasonable and affordable repayment solution. 

I am requesting the CFPB to investigate Navient 's handling of my case, their refusal to offer a reasonable payment plan, and their aggressive and unprofessional behavior towards me. I seek your assistance in resolving this matter and protecting my rights as a consumer. 

Thank you for your attention to this serious issue. I look forward to your prompt response.

Consumer complaint narrative:
Thousands of students were scammed by Navient into taking out predatory private loans to attend for-profit online schools such as the one I attended, XXXX XXXX XXXX and XXXX XXXX  ( now known as XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXXXXXX XXXX ) . As a matter of fact, XXXX XXXX XXXX and XXXXXXXX XXXX  was investigated by the Department of Education. I had to consolidate my private loans which I had no idea that they were not a federal loan program. Because I was young, My dad had to co-sign and he is being drug into this and it's ruining his credit along with mine. Because of the numerous claims of fraud and misconduct perpetrated by these online for-profit schools, such as XXXX XXXX XXXX and XXXXXXXX XXXX , I was able to file a Borrower Defense claim with the Dept. of Education against XXXX XXXX XXXX and XXXXXXXX XXXX, and my Fed. loans of XXXX were discharged and my credit repaired. 
My Borrower Defense Claim was also part of the XXXX XXXX XXXXXXXX settlement for which I was a full class member. 
I am aware that Navient was sued by 39 state AGs regarding their predatory loans to attend these online for-profit schools and that Sallie Mae/Navient were a " preferred '' lending company in a " deal '' with these schools during the early XXXX XXXX. These private loans with a high risk of default were part of a package deal offered to " for profit online schools ''. But loans made to students in states outside of the agreement, or those who were not in default for 7 months or more during a " specific '' time frame, were excluded. I am sure this was a big win for Navient, but what a sham of a settlement deal for the rest of borrowers scammed into taking loans to at least 150 for profit online schools. After the AG settlement, didn't Navient also get out of the Federal student loan business due to scrutiny from lawmakers and borrower advocates? Didn't Navient have to pay restitution to the Federal student loan borrowers for not informing students of IDR/IBR payments students could have enrolled in, but instead steered toward forbearance? Furthermore, hasn't Navient been sued at least a half dozen times for other predatory loan practices and illegal collection practices? 
I am also aware of a " pilot '' program by which Navient is sending out " applications '' to select students who may have filed Borrower Defense claims against their schools and were approved. This application is a sham. Why do we need to prove anything? Navient knows who we are. Under the FTC " Holder Rule '' Navient is liable for giving predatory loans in connection with online for-profit schools. Time is running out for Navient to do right by students who were scammed into taking out private loans to attend online for profit colleges who have committed misconduct and misrepresented themselves to the public to entice students to enroll. Senator XXXX XXXX has sent a letter to Navient 's CEO asking to discharge these loans NOW! It's time Navient do the right thing and discharge/refund all these predatory private loans made to attend online for profit schools.

Consumer complaint narrative:
I attended the XXXX XXXX of XXXX from XXXX to XXXX. I was an older student coming from a very humble family with no high school or college education. 

I was in a dead end job, just making ends meet, not being able to make rent or pay for my car. I decided to enroll at the XXXX XXXX to better my life and future after listening to their sales pitch. I do admit I did not know anything about school loans, federal vs Private, interest rates. I was told that my job prospects would be worth it. After attending a couple years, my significant other educated me on school loans, etc and I saw that my private/federal loans were in the tens of thousands already. I decided to stop the financial bleed and attend a state school. My federal loans were forgiven as part of the XXXX vs XXXX XXXX, but my private loans are still active. These private loans with over XXXX  % interest ballooned up to {$97000.00} at their peak. Originally the principal was {$30000.00}. Once I started paying on them in XXXX, after I finally finished college through a state school, the payment was over {$1600.00} between both loans, with the private loans being {$1200.00} of this amount. After paying them for a year and not making a dent, I refinanced the loans through XXXX as we were very close to filing for bankruptcy. During this time our credit card debt ballooned up to tens of thousands of dollars as we have being paying the refinanced loans for the last XXXX years. I hate myself for not being well educated as to the financial burden I locked my future family into for attending the XXXX XXXX and falling for their fraudulent tactics. I was not the only student to fall for this. The XXXX XXXX administration recently forgave {$6.00} XXXX in school loans for former XXXX XXXX XXXX. This is only for federal loans though. The XXXX Department of Education found that the XXXX XXXX made " pervasive and substantial '' misrepresentations to prospective students about post-graduation employment rates, salaries and career services.

Consumer complaint narrative: After several intense recruiting calls from thXXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXXXXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX ) I enrolled into their XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX in 2006, taking out many federal and private loans to attend this school. I have since suffered a great deal of financial harm, emotional and mental damage, and professional difficulty as a result of their misrepresentation of their hiring rates, graduation/completion rate, and abusive and confusing lending practices. I am a member of the XXXX XXXX XXXXXXXX, so my federal loans for this predatory college have been forgiven, however, despite many calls to Navient 's private loan department over the years, they refuse to give me a discharge despite several lawsuits and several rounds of loan forgiveness for The XXXX XXXXXXXX XXXX XXXX XXXXXXXX . I ask that the CFPB review my case, as I feel I took out these loans for a college that was predatory in their approach in recruitment and financing and completely misrespresented the value of their degree ( which is essentially worthless, barring me from an opportunity to pursue a XXXX XXXX in my field of study ).

Issue: Dealing with your lender or servicer
Sub-issue: Trouble with how payments are being handled
Consumer complaint narrative:
I borrowed from Sallie Mae {$120000.00} between XXXX to pay for my studies and living expenses. After my graduation in XXXX I called for help, asking for options that could lower my payments from {$1000.00} to {$500.00} but, the only option I was given was forbearance. 

Later, my loans were transferred to Navient and the same issue continued. No one offered me help to lower my payments. From {$1000.00} my payments increased to {$2100.00} per month. From the beginning, Navient knew that I am struggling to find a job in my field because it is highly competitive profession. For every position there is between XXXX and XXXX applicants. For now, I am XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX  while I search for a better job. My yearly income is below {$9.00}, XXXX. Everything I make goes towards paying Navient loans. 

When I called again asking for help, explaining that I am unable to pay such a high amount, and asking for options that would lower the payment to {$500.00}, I was told it was not possible. Finally, I was offered a XXXX XXXX XXXX which brought the amount between {$900.00} and {$1100.00}. I was on this program from XXXX to the end of XXXX until, I was told that I no longer qualify for the program. 

When I called again asking for help, XXXX XXXX and XXXX XXXX told me that there is nothing that could be done for me, my only option to lower my payment is Interest Only Program. I was on this program from XXXX until I cancelled it on XXXX, XXXX XXXX because I realized that I was making payments of {$1200.00} but they did not reflect on my loans. I did not know for what I was paying. To this decision Navient threatened me that if I cancel before the program ends, then they would never enrol me on any of their programs again because I do not appear serious. 

Finally, to help me pay off a portion of my loan my parents, who are retired seniors, took out a loan and in XXXX, XXXX we were able to pay in full three loans out of nine. But this did not ease the burden. Navient still demands that I pay {$2000.00} monthly, and they keep raising the interest. Now it is at 15 %. 

When I called Navient on XX/XX/XXXX, I have spoken with XXXX and the manager. I asked her for help, explained my financial situation, and that I am struggling. Also, I confronted her why are my monthly payments so outrageous. The more I pay the more outrageous my payments become. To that she replied that I should work more and cut all my expenses. Which I already did for the past 14 yrs. I can not even afford to have a cell phone or a car, and everything I make goes towards paying Navient. Then she suggested that the only thing she could do for me is to put me on the XXXX XXXX XXXX again, which would bring my payment to XXXX $ per month. Which is still a huge burden for my family. 

Therefore, up until XX/XX/XXXX, together with my parents, we were making those large payments. But every time I checked my Navient account the amount of my loans did not change. Instead, they kept growing and the payments kept growing. All the payments that I made I do not know where they went. Everything is very confusing. When I called Navient asking why I do not see any change, no one gave me a clear answer. I was only told that it is their system of payment, it does not get lower but grows like a ladder. 

Also, throughout all these years, Navient used fraudulent tactics in order to make me pay extra charges and blame me for delinquency or they would withdraw more money than what was agreed on. 

For example, ever since I have been in repayment, I was set up on an automatic payment. Each month Navient was supposed to withdraw 2 payments from our family account I split the due amount in two parts, to be taken out at different dates of the month, as it helped to reduce the burden of a big amount taken at once. Instead Navient was withdrawing between XXXX to 6 times per month. 

For example, in XX/XX/XXXX, I was supposed to pay {$870.00} but they withdrew {$1400.00}. In XX/XX/XXXX, I was supposed to pay {$900.00} per month but Navient withdrew {$1500.00}. And there are many more months like that. Other times Navient would skip a payment and it looked as if I was behind on my payments. Immediately they would start harassing me that my loans were in delinquency, and that I need to pay a certain amount to bring it current. Throughout all these years I could not fix this problem. Each time I confronted Navient that they should stop doing it, I was told that it was the system failure and they will fix it. It would stop for some months but, then it would repeat again. 
Furthermore, when I wanted to find out the total amount that I have paid for my loans since XXXX, this information was nowhere to be found on my Navient account. The only amount that is shown is the balance and nothing else. When I called Navient in XXXX, XXXX asking why it is not available, XXXX told me that she does not know why and this information has to be requested. Why does it have to be requested? It has to be directly stated on our account for us to see. 

When I finally received my payment history from Navient it confirmed that I already paid in full what I owed and even more. I already paid {>= $1,000,000}. However, Navient claims that I still owe them {$110000.00}. Where is this amount coming from? I did not borrow this much. This is why I am asking CFPB for help. For fourteen years I have been treated unfairly. My family suffered undue hardship while paying my loans. Please, help me to resolve this issue.

Consumer complaint narrative:
I hope this message finds you well. I am writing to request an investigation into XXXX handling of student loans in relation to alleged misconduct by educational institutions. There have been widespread reports and personal experiences indicating that XXXX practices in addressing issues of school misconduct are inadequate and warrant serious review. 

Several issues have come to light, including : Inaccurate Information : I have received misleading or incorrect information about their loan terms, repayment options, and eligibility for relief related to school misconduct. 

Mismanagement of Accounts : There are reports of improper application of payments and mismanagement of accounts, which have led to unnecessary financial strain on borrowers. 

Lack of Support for Misconduct Claims : Despite evidence of school misconductsuch as false advertising or breach of contractborrowers have struggled to receive appropriate remedies or discharges from Navient. 

1. XXXX XXXX forced me to complete a speech in my workplace if not I would fail the class and I advised them I worked in a hospital. FF I complete the speech record it to send it to class which I got a D in. OnXXXX day later I was fired by my job for HIPAA Violation 2. XXXX told me about a private student a loan, they stated all students do it to help with bills and I could consolidate the loan only to find out years later that was not the case. 

3. I've reached out to Navient for years about this and they stated it was nothing they could do about it. Never advised me of the " School Misconduct Form ''. I request this form 3 times and they never sent it. I had to XXXX the form in effort to obtain it. 

XXXX. I submitted my " School Misconduct form on XX/XX/year>2024. and provided my borrowers defense letter. I called one week later and I was advised my form was received on XX/XX/year>2024. That it would be reviewed in 30 days. 

5. Today XX/XX/year>2024 I called and I was told my application was denied on XX/XX/year>2024, and I was notified on the XXXX of XXXX. I said I submitted the application on the XXXX so how was I called on the XXXX and today is the XXXX of XX/XX/scrub> 2024. 

I am almost in default as I can not make the payment and the balance in not going down at all. When I got the loan I was told there would only be 3 % interest on the life of the loan, only to find out not the interest rate changes. 

Navient continues its deceptive practices. Please help I also sent Navient my approved Borrowers Defense These issues have significantly affected borrowers, causing financial hardship and emotional distress. Given the critical role the Consumer Financial Protection Bureau ( CFPB ) plays in ensuring fair practices in financial services, I respectfully urge your office to investigate Navients practices and their handling of student loans related to school misconduct. 

If needed, I am willing to provide further details and documentation to support this request. Your attention to this matter is greatly appreciated, and I look forward to any actions that may be taken to address these concerns and ensure fair treatment for all affected borrowers. 

Thank you for your time and consideration. 

Sincerely,

Consumer complaint narrative:
Thousands of students were scammed by Navient/Sallie Mae into taking out predatory private loans to attend for profit schools such as the one I attended, XXXX XXXX XXXXXXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX ( XXXX ), operated by the XXXX XXXX XXXX. As a matter of fact, XXXX  was investigated by 49 state attorneys general and were found to be lying about total costs, accreditation, and were also investigated for distorted program costs and job placement rates and giving admission recruiters bonuses for getting more students to sign up. 
I experienced this in XXXX of XXXX when signing up. The recruiter showed me costs, and the breakdown of how long it would take us to pay back the loans, with promises of a ten-year repayments, and a total tuition rate. I was lied to that I would not qualify for federal loan assistance because XXXX was a private school and federal loans do not pay for our programs. I later found out all this was false. The original amount requested for my loan on XX/XX/XXXX was {$48000.00}. This amount was to cover the entirety of my tenure as a student at XXXX, which was from XX/XX/XXXX through XX/XX/XXXX. In XXXX of XXXX, I was pink slipped to take out additional funds to complete my program because the original amount was not enough to cover tuition from XX/XX/XXXX through XX/XX/XXXX, when I was set to XXXX. On XX/XX/XXXX, I was made to request an additional {$26000.00}. I requested my loan documentation in XX/XX/XXXX, and have discovered that many of the items that are required in a promissory note are missing, including interest rates and signatures from the school on both XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX documents. The original principal amounts on both loans total {$51000.00}, with the first disbursed on XX/XX/XXXX in the amount of {$26000.00}. However, by the time both loans were sent to be refinanced and consolidated, both loan balances were over {$31000.00} each. The total increase in the amount that I was originally told my education would cost is over {$18000.00} higher due to the undisclosed interest rate of 18.125 % ; which was compounding daily while I was in school. It was this incredibly high and criminal interest rate and a monthly payment of over {$1100.00} per month, when I was making {$10.00} as a line cook, forced me to refinance in XXXX. It was this refinance that prompted Navient to respond to my request for a XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX with a denial. 
In XXXX, when trying to reduce overall program costs for my XXXX XXXX in XXXX I found no credits would transfer as my XXXX XXXXXXXXXXXX XXXX transcripts lists XXXX as Unaccredited. When I originally applied, I was informed that the school was an accredited institution and that if I chose to pursue a higher degree, that the classes were eligible for transfer. 
Because of the numerous claims of fraud and misconduct perpetrated by these for-profit schools, such as XXXX, I was able to file a Borrower Defense claim as a full class member, with the Dept. of Education against XXXX however , the entirety of my loans were XXXXXXXX XXXX XXXXXXXX ( {$67000.00} ), and therefore did not qualify for Borrower Defense resulting in a denial of discharge and/or credit repair. 
I am aware that Navient was sued by 49 state AGs regarding their predatory loans to attend these online for-profit schools and that Sallie Mae/Navient were a " preferred '' lending company in a " deal '' with these schools during the early XXXX 's. These private loans with a high risk of default were part of a package deal offered to " for profit schools ''. But loans made to students in states outside of the agreement, or those who were not in default for 7 months or more during a " specific '' time frame, were excluded. I am sure this was a big win for Navient, but what a sham of a settlement deal for the rest of borrowers scammed into taking loans to at least 150 for profit online schools. After the AG settlement, didn't Navient also get out of the Federal student loan business due to scrutiny from lawmakers and borrower advocates? Didn't Navient have to pay restitution to the Federal student loan borrowers for not informing students of IDR/IBR payments students could have enrolled in, but instead steered toward forbearance? Furthermore, hasn't Navient been sued at least a half dozen times for other predatory loan practices and illegal collection practices?

I am also aware of a " pilot '' program by which Navient is sending out " applications '' to select students who may have filed Borrower Defense claims against their schools and were approved. This application is a sham. Why do we need to prove anything? Navient knows who we are. Under the FTC " Holder Rule '' Navient is liable for giving predatory loans in connection with online for-profit schools. Time is running out for Navient to do right by students who were scammed into taking out private loans to attend online for profit colleges who have committed misconduct and misrepresented themselves to the public to entice students to enroll. XXXX XXXX XXXX has sent a letter to Navient 's CEO asking to discharge these loans NOW! It's time Navient do the right thing and discharge all these predatory private loans made to attend online for profit schools.

Consumer complaint narrative: I am a class member of the Sweet v. Cardona Borrower Defense to Repayment lawsuit. I was notified via email by the U.S. Department of Education on XX/XX/XXXX that I was granted a discharge of all federal student loans used to attend a for-profit school. I learned in XXXX of XXXX that Navient, holder of my private loans, offered a possible relief program if a borrower attended a school where misconduct was committed or a lawsuit was brought against the school. I owe about {$7000.00} on XXXX private loans and submitted the XXXX XXXX XXXX application, following all of Navient 's instructions. I also submitted all the documents I had to support my claims and complete all sections of the application. I received an email notification on XX/XX/XXXX that my application had been received and was under review. On XX/XX/XXXX, I received XXXX emails from Navient and each one stated that the " XXXX XXXX XXXX application is denied ''. I contacted Navient by email and asked for an explanation as to why my application was denied and how soon I could reapply. I was told I could submit other supporting documents, but I already submitted all that I had, including the letter from the XXXX Department of Education stating that my federal loans had been XXXX. That letter included the name of the school I attended, which matches the name of the school on all three loans held by Navient. I received a letter from Navient dated XX/XX/XXXX that was vague and did not give a reason why my discharge application was denied.

Consumer complaint narrative:
The XXXX I attended described the student loan process to me ( XXXX ). I was informed that everything was taken care of during registration. They explained there was an option to use private loans if the Department of XXXX could not cover the cost of tuition. I was told that any private loan servicer, would offer flexible payment options. I was provided with statistics of graduation success rates. 

Nearly half way though my tenor in college, I was pulled out of class to work with financial aid to take out private loans. This would typically happen near finals - A high stress time as a student. I was told if I didn't take out these loans, I would be forced to drop out. I was on track to graduate with honors, and meet the " success rates '' of graduation, I was remined that if I did not finish my degree, I would have large sums of debt. With out the credentials to work. 

After graduation, and while actively applying for work. I received my first student loan bill. It was more than my monthly income. 

I worked with the private student loan department at XXXX. I was told my only option was forbearance. By the time I was able to start making payments on these loans, the capitalized interest ballooned from the ball park of $ XXXX at my time of graduation, to $ XXXX. 

Currently, my monthly payments on these loans are in the ballpark of {$XXXX}. with only ( XXXX ) {$XXXX} being put towards the principle balance. Despite my success in college, and XXXX. I have never earned what the school eluded to my earnings would be, XXXX, after hearing my story, has yet to work with me on my payments. 

I have attempted consolidation. I'm rarely excepted by other lenders. And if so, the monthly payments are higher than my simple apartment.

Consumer complaint narrative:
I would like to file a complaint against Navient and their misconduct in not only reviewing and processing my XXXX XXXX discharge application but also in numerous misconduct they have conducted during the management of my loan repayment. 
I am requesting the following : 1 ) I would like an explicit explanation of why my application was denied and the specific factors they are referencing in this very vague and blanket response. I have not been given an opportunity to submit additional proof for any factors thought not to met nor have I been informed what factors result in denial despite a full discharge of my Federal Loans through borrowers Defense and XXXX XXXX XXXXXXXX lawsuit from the same School, loans taken out at the exact same time as those were. I am attaching my application, additional evidence, borrowers defense application for my federal loans that was later approved and my Borrowers defense approval letter for my student loans with Navient. I have an approved XXXX against XXXX XXXX XXXX  due to my schools fraudulent behavior and misconduct. I feel your private loan should be XXXX due to " XXXX XXXX '' since this has been verified not only thought the XXXX XXXX XXXX but also through the numerous lawsuits brough against their parent company XXXX ( which I provided evidence of to Navient in my School Misconduct application ) I have also been advised by the XXXX to complete the application with Navient due to being an original class member in XXXX XXXX XXXX. Navient is aware of the misconduct conducted by these schools with the Private Loans they disbursed and services yet show they are not willing to acknowledge this or their own misconduct by these blanket rejections they are handing out. In XXXX, XXXX XXXX made a similar action of blanket rejection that was ruled as the XXXX XXXX XXXX  not acting in good faith by sending out blanket denials. If this is ruled as not acting out of good faith for Federal loans for the same institution then why would Navient be able to conduct this same sham process to deny borrowers debt relief through blanket, denials regardless of the evidence presented. I am asking for a fair evaluation of my application as well as a fair discharge of these loans due to my schools founded misconduct. 

2 ) I would like to receive a copy of my Master Promissory Note and have requested this through Navient, who has yet to produce it. I have been trying to work with my private student loans since they switched from XXXX XXXX to Navient. My payments have constantly fluctuated resulting first in many pressured forbearance that only added to my debt, but also resulted for the last several years the need for rate reduction programs through Navient because my interest rates also increased and when I asked for an alternative payment plan and those XXXX  month plans expired. have attached my borrowers defense application for my federal loan discharge and hope to have both federal and private loans discharged. XXXX XXXX now Navient, which was sued by XXXX state attorneys generals for its role in facilitating these predatory loans, had a specific agreement with for-profit schools during the early XXXX, making it a " preferred lender ". Despite this, the settlement terms provided by Navient were considerably inadequate, excluding many borrowers who took loans for attendance at these for -profit schools, unless they resided in certain states or had not defaulted for at least XXXX months during a specified period. The only period during which I managed to reduce the principal amount was during the pandemic when interest rates were temporarily lowered to between 0.5 % and 1 %. However, once the regular interest rates resumed my balance skyrocketed again. This financial strain coupled with XXXX  stress and damage to personal relationships, has been overwhelming. Under the FTCs ' " XXXX XXXX '', Navient is accountable for these predatory loans issued in association with for-profit schools. As time is critical, XXXX XXXX XXXX, has urged Navient 's CEO to immediately discharge these loans. It is crucial for Navient to take responsible action now by discharging all such predatory private loans associated with for-profit institutions. 
3 ) XXXX I had a XXXX XXXX XXXX that these loans were not discharged in due to Navients assertion that such loans were not dischargeable. In XXXX, a New York Court of Appeals ruled that private loans are not protected from discharge in bankruptcy. 
Private student loans can be tossed in bankruptcy, appeals court rules | XXXX The exact statement on here is what I experienced with Navient, told me they were not dischargeable and that I would need to continue paying. Whats really egregious about this is Navient has been telling people for years that their loans are non-dischargeable, when in fact they are dischargeable, he said. Ive repeatedly been told that there is no relief, discharge or remedy from these loans other than XXXX and death. Repeatedly I have been told that approved federal borrowers defense of school misconduct does not apply to these loans. And even when a potential remedy was offered ( School misconduct application ) I was again denied with no specific rationale for the denial.

Consumer complaint narrative: DEPARTMENT OF EDUCATION/ NAVIENT is in violation of multiple laws set forth by Congress in regards to the following account # s XXXX. 15 U.S. Code 1681a ( 2 ) ( a ) ( i ) states that the consumer report does not include information solely as to transactions or experiences ( payment history, charge off status ), between the consumer ( myself ) and the person ( DEPARTMENT OF EDUCATION/ NAVIENT ) making the report. Additionally, 15 U.S. Code 1681 s-2 ( a ) ( 1 ) ( A ) states that A person ( DEPARTMENT OF EDUCATION/ NAVIENT ) shall not furnish any information relating to a consumer ( ME ) to any consumer reporting agency ( XXXX, XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXXXXXX ) if the person knows or has reasonable cause to believe that the information is inaccurate. DEPARTMENT OF EDUCATION/ NAVIENT can not collect on a discharged debt. This is now considered a certificate of indebtedness per the IRS and income can not be reported. The IRS Clearly defines a charge off as Gross or Ordinary income, INCOME DOES NOT GET REPORTED ON THE CONSUMER REPORT which in fact makes reporting of this account inaccurate! I provided a screenshot from the IRS website. By Definition, the IRS Clearly says a Cancelled debt or Charge off is Income. I have also included the 1099-C that was received from the IRS showing the discharged amount of {$27000.00} which validates that they have added interest even though they have received paperwork before. The interest needs to be deducted from the total owed. As of the date of the 1099-C that was the amount owed. DEPARTMENT OF EDUCATION/ NAVIENT balance now stands at {$27000.00}. The reporting of this account as a debt is inaccurate. I never received a 1099-C from DEPARTMENT OF EDUCATION/ NAVIENT for the Cancelled debt of {$27000.00} in order to file as ordinary income. Where is my 1099-C DEPARTMENT OF EDUCATION/ NAVIENT is clearly writing off debt with the IRS without sending out 1099-C as required by the IRS for debts greater than {$600.00}. This is unsatisfactory! DEPARTMENT OF EDUCATION/ NAVIENT/XXXX  has been HEREBY PUT ON NOTICE that they are furnishing incorrect inaccurate information. In DEPARTMENT OF EDUCATION/ NAVIENT terms and conditions they agreed not to share my information with non affiliates. XXXXXXXX XXXX XXXXr XXXX is not an affiliate of DEPARTMENT OF EDUCATION/ NAVIENT nor are they " bureaus ''. The only true credit bureau is the CFPB and they DO NOT furnish consumer reports as stated in federal law. I have a right to privacy and Per the Privacy Act of 1974 as a federally protected consumer I am now revoking any and all authorization I the consumer may have given you written, non written, verbal, and nonverbal per 5 U.S. Code 552a. Per the FCRA as a federally protected consumer I am now opting out of any and all authorization I the consumer may have given you written, non written, verbal, and non verbal per 15 USC 6802. I shall also point out their responsibility pursuant 15 U.S. Code section 1681s-2 ( a ) ( 1 ) ( B ) ( ii ) : ( a ) DUTY OF FURNISHERS OF INFORMATION TO PROVIDE ACCURATE INFORMATION XXXX ) PROHIBITION ( B ) Reporting information after notice and confirmation of errors A person shall not furnish information relating to a consumer to any consumer reporting agency if ( i ) the person has been notified by the consumer, at the address specified by the person for such notices, that specific information is inaccurate ; and ( ii ) the information is, in fact, inaccurate. DEPARTMENT OF EDUCATION/ NAVIENT must also refund the remaining balance of the consumer account upon its termination. This is your 7 day notice to return ALL money due from this consumer account. 1026.11 Treatment of credit balances ; account termination. ( a ) Credit balances. When a credit balance in excess of { { {$1.00} } } is created on a credit account ( through transmittal of funds to a creditor in excess of the total balance due on an account, through rebates of unearned finance charges or insurance premiums, or through amounts otherwise owed to or held for the benefit of the consumer ), the creditor shall : ( 1 ) Credit the amount of the credit balance to the consumer 's account ; ( 2 ) Refund any part of the remaining credit balance within seven business days from receipt of a written request from the consumer ; ( 3 ) Make a good faith effort to refund to the consumer by cash, check, or money order, or credit to a deposit account of the consumer, any part of the credit balance remaining in the account for more than six months. No further action is required if the consumer 's current location is not known to the creditor and can not be traced through the consumer 's last known address or telephone number. ( b ) Account termination. ( 1 ) A creditor shall not terminate an account prior to its expiration date solely because the consumer does not incur a finance charge. ( 2 ) Nothing in paragraph ( b ) ( 1 ) of this section prohibits a creditor from terminating an account that is inactive for three or more consecutive months. An account is inactive for purposes of this paragraph if no credit has been extended ( such as by purchase, cash advance or balance transfer ) and if the account has no outstanding balance. ( c ) Timely settlement of estate debts ( 1 ) General rule. ( i ) Reasonable policies and procedures required. For credit card accounts under an open-end ( not home-secured ) consumer credit plan, card issuers must adopt reasonable written policies and procedures designed to ensure that an administrator of an estate of a deceased account holder can determine the amount of and pay any balance on the account in a timely manner. ( ii ) Application to joint accounts. Paragraph ( c ) of this section does not apply to the account of a deceased consumer if a joint account holder remains on the account. ( 2 ) Timely statement of balance ( i ) Requirement. Upon request by the administrator of an estate, a card issuer must provide the administrator with the amount of the balance on a deceased consumer 's account in a timely manner. ( ii ) Safe harbor. For purposes of paragraph ( c ) ( 2 ) ( i ) of this section, providing the amount of the balance on the account within 30 days of receiving the request is deemed to be timely. ( 3 ) Limitations after receipt of request from administrator ( i ) Limitation on fees and increases in annual percentage rates. After receiving a request from the administrator of an estate for the amount of the balance on a deceased consumer 's account, a card issuer must not impose any fees on the account ( such as a late fee, annual fee, or over-the-limit fee ) or increase any annual percentage rate, except as provided by 1026.55 ( b ) ( 2 ). ( ii ) Limitation on trailing or residual interest. A card issuer must waive or rebate any additional finance charge due to a periodic interest rate if payment in full of the balance disclosed pursuant to paragraph ( c ) ( 2 ) of this section is received within 30 days after disclosure.

Issue: Incorrect information on your report
Sub-issue: Account information incorrect
Consumer complaint narrative:
On the XXXX of XXXX, XXXX, I was notified by XXXX of a decline in my credit score. Upon reviewing my account, I discovered that Navient had marked my loan as 60 days overdue. I promptly contacted Navient to rectify this error, as I am no longer legally bound to repay this debt due to the protections afforded to me by the Consent Judgment issued by the state of New Jersey. Despite my explanation, Navients representatives incorrectly insisted that I was mistaken and continued to insist on repayment. 

Throughout our conversation, Navients representatives made false and misleading assertions, claiming that I was ineligible for debt relief because the loan did not meet the necessary criteria, including a lack of seven consecutive missed payments. These claims were not only untrue but also intentionally deceptive. 

According to the Final Consent Judgment, Navient committed to canceling certain private student loans, provided they met one of three specified criteria. My loan falls under Category 3, the Non-Traditional criterion, which includes loans disbursed to borrowers with a FICO score below XXXX at the time of origination for attendance at a public or private non-profit educational institution. 

At the time of my loans origination by Navient, my FICO score was indeed below XXXX, and I was enrolled in a public educational institution, thus qualifying for forgiveness. 
Moreover, Navients official disclosures state that loans are written off after 120 days of delinquency. Contrary to this policy, my credit report indicates that my loan was delinquent for seven months without being charged off. This discrepancy not only demonstrates a failure to adhere to their stated policies but also constitutes a significant misrepresentation in their financial statements regarding their charge-off timeline. 

The combination of Navients falsehoods, misleading statements, and unwarranted demands for payment constitutes a blatant breach of the Final Consent Judgment.

Consumer complaint narrative:
" The Fair Credit Reporting Act ( 15 U.S. Code 1681 ) says ( 1 ) The banking system is dependent upon fair and accurate credit reporting. Inaccurate credit reports directly impair the efficiency of the banking system, and unfair credit reporting methods undermine the public confidence which is essential to the continued functioning of the banking system.

So whenever there is a violation under the FCRA, it impairs the efficiency of the banking system. This is a violation of TILA US Code 1666B since I was never late.

I recently reviewed my consumer report and noticed an incorrect late payment record on my NAVIENT - XXXX, NAVIENT - XXXX, NAVIENT - XXXX, NAVIENT - XXXX, NAVIENT - XXXX, NAVIENT - XXXX. I have always maintained timely payments on this account. Under the Fair Credit Billing Act ( FCBA ) and the Truth in Lending Act ( TILA ), creditors are required to accurately report consumer transactions and provide a mechanism for correcting errors in a timely manner. Please conduct an investigation into this matter, and if you can not provide documentary evidence of these supposed late payments, I demand these payments to be updated to on time as they should be as I was NEVER late. I expect these updates to be made promptly, in compliance with the law. 
"

Issue: Dealing with your lender or servicer
Sub-issue: Co-signer
Consumer complaint narrative:
I am submitting this complaint to bring attention to the various federal laws that Navient has violated in its handling of my obligations as a cosigner. As you are likely aware Navient has been subject to numerous lawsuits and investigations by numerous states and XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX due to unfair and deceptive practices, including those related to co-signers agreement and releases. Navient practices have resulted in significant financial harm and damage to my credit, all of which stems from violations of the following laws : Violation of the FTC XXXX XXXX XXXX has XXXX to adhere to this rule which mandates that creditors provide cosigners with clear conspicuous disclosures about the potential risks of co-signing a loan. Navient failure to provide these required disclosures at the time of the loan origination constitutes clear violation of this rule, leaving me uninformed of the risks and unprotected in the financial agreement. 
Breach of the FTC XXXX XXXX ( XXXX CFR Part XXXX ) - The primary borrower has invoked their rights under the FTC XXXX XXXX which allows borrowers to assert claims or defenses against the creditor that they could assert against the seller of the financed goods and services. Despite this active dispute regarding the debts validity Navient has continued to report the loan to credit bureaus, negatively impacting my credit as a co-signer. This disregard for the ongoing dispute under the FTC XXXX XXXX represents a breach of XXXX XXXX, unfairly punishing me as a cosigner without consideration of the borrowers claims. 
Violation of the Fair Credit Reporting Act ( FCRA XXXX XXXX Code XXXX ) -Navient reporting of the disputed debt to credit bureaus also raises serious concerns under Fair Credit Reporting Act ( FCRA ). The FCRA requires that any information furnished to credit reporting agencies be accurate and fully reflective of any dispute or any other relevant circumstances. By continuing to report this debt without properly notifying the borrowers of the dispute under the FTC XXXX XXXX, Navient is violating its obligations under the FCRA. This inaccurate reporting has caused undue damages to my XXXX XXXX and financial reputation Violation of the Fair Debt Collection Practices Act ( FDCPA XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX ) - In addition to the above, Navient actions may also constitute a violation of the Fair Debt Collection Practices Act ( FDCPA ) which prohibits creditors from engaging in unfair, deceptive or abusive practices in the collection of debts. Navient failure to inform me of my rights as cosigner combined with the continued aggressive pursuit of payments despite the borrowers legitimate dispute constitutes unfair and deceptive practices under the FDCPA Failure to Comply with Truth in Lending Act ( TILA, XXXX XXXX ) -Furthermore Navient may have failed to comply with the Truth in Lending Act ( TILA ) which requires creditors to disclose clear and accurate information about the terms of the loan, including the responsibilities and risks associated with cosigning. Navient failure to provide this information adequately has left me at a significant disadvantage, unaware of the full extent of my obligations and the potential impact on my credit. 
Unfair and Deceptive Practices ( Violation of Consumer Protection Act-CFPA ) - Navient misrepresented the requirements for co-signer release, creating confusion and miscommunication regarding eligibility for XXXX XXXX despite the loan being over a decade old

I was barely XXXX and did not fully understand what this would mean latter in life. Nor were the details of this loan or subsequent ones. They had this extensive process to get graduates into high earning jobs in the XXXX area. This is now well documented part of XXXX XXXX deceptive and fraudulent practices.

Today 's action brings the total amount of student relief approved by the Biden-Harris Administration to almost {$160.00} billion for nearly 4.6 million borrowers. 

After my graduation my loans started to activate and I needed to pay on these loans, added in my income I was now into a forced poverty. I struggled too many times to make these payments and needed several " breaks ''. I remember the first time I needed to decide if I was going to pay or be broke. I called and spoke to a rep. I remember when I started making more money and I called to resume payments and suddenly, they could help. Help is probably a strong word. They asked for savings, XXXX, for me to beg relatives for money. Literally I was asked to find family or friends I could beg for money. I couldnt pay my loans, I had no savings or XXXX and I did not have anyone who could help. The help they could provide was to make a payment and push the past due onto the balance so I wouldnt be in default anymore. Navient ruined my life. This debt will consume my entire life. I will never be financially stable. I think about this so often. This one decision when I was barely an adult ruined the next XXXX  years of my life. I will never retire, own a home, know what security is. Now we know that Navient was not a good faith actor.

Consumer complaint narrative:

Thousands of students were scammed by Navient into taking out predatory private loans to attend for profit online schools such as the one I attended, XXXX ( XXXX  XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX ). As a matter of fact, XXXX has been sued numerous times over their fraudulent practices. 

Because of the numerous claims of fraud and misconduct perpetrated by these online for profit schools, such as XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX  XXXX, I was able to file a Borrower Defense claim with the Dept. of Education against XXXX  XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX, and am waiting the final judgement. 

My Borrower Defense Claim was also part of the XXXX XXXX XXXX settlement for which I was a post class member. 

I am aware that Navient was sued by 39 state AGs regarding their predatory loans to attend these online for-profit schools and that Sallie Mae/Navient were a " preferred '' lending company in a " deal '' with these schools during the early 2000 's. Consumer complaint narrative:
I attended XXXX XXXX from fall XXXX through XXXX. When I was accepted into the school they told me to reach out to Sallie Mae, now Navient, to apply for financial aid. I was approved for a {$100000.00} student loan in less than 10 minutes at the XXXX XXXX XXXX, with absolutely no credit history. I later found out that this was a private loan and did not qualify for any debt relief programs, bankruptcy, forgiveness, etc. Since being approved for my loan, it has doubled due to interest rates and fees. These Navient loans should be illegitimate and forgiven due to XXXX XXXX misleading me. I was sold false information about the school and programs. In XX/XX/XXXX, the California Bureau for Private Postsecondary and Vocational Education ( BPPVE ) accused the XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX and its then parent corporation XXXX XXXX XXXX of persuading prospective students to enroll by " willfully misleading '' them, and " falsifying and omitting critical information. '' Dealing with Navient has also been a struggle. Their customer service representatives are often cold, rude, and disrespectful. Ive been told by them that I just need to make more money to pay off my loans and that I should have known better than to take out the loan in the first place. They purposely take out my automatic payments for the month past the due date, and then tact on late fees. Ive discussed this with them numerous times and each time they put the blame on me, even though its an automatic payment that they take directly out of my bank account. 
I have paid them around {$12000.00} a year since XXXX and they treat me like Ive never made a payment. Ive never defaulted on my loans and I do everything in my power to make sure they get paid every month. Often having to choose between paying my loans or buying groceries, which usually means I forgo groceries for the month. These loans have completely debilitated my life financially. I live with the burden every single day, knowing that I will probably never pay these loans off. I live each day knowing that I cant fully provide for my family how I want to because these loans will always take precedence over anything else. 
I was scammed by a school, took out a loan, as a naive XXXX XXXX XXXX kid with no financial literacy, had that loan doubled due to interest, and have spent my entire adult life working feverishly to pay it back. These loans should considered illegitimate and be forgiven due to the predatory nature of a for profit school.

Issue: Struggling to repay your loan
Sub-issue: Problem with forgiveness, cancellation, or discharge
Consumer complaint narrative:
Many students, including myself, were misled by Navient into securing predatory private loans to fund education at for-profit online institutions, such as The XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX I attended from XXXX to XXXX with an original principal loan amount of about XXXX. Despite having paid the total amount towards these loans, my current balance is paid off in full while ahead of the amount of time given to pay it back. 
Notably, XXXX XXXX XXXX and their parent company, XXXX, were subject to investigations by various state attorneys general and found to have engaged in deceptive practices. In response to widespread allegations of fraud and misconduct by XXXX XXXX XXXXXXXX, the Biden administration recently announced a comprehensive loan discharge for students enrolled at these institutions from XX/XX/XXXX, to XX/XX/XXXX. This led to the discharge of my federal loans totaling about XXXX and the restoration of my credit. 
Navient, which was sued by the attorneys general of 39 states for its role in facilitating these predatory loans, had a specific arrangement with for-profit schools during the early XXXX, makin~ it a " preferred '' lender. Despite this, the settlement terms provided by Navient were considerably inadequate, excluding many borrowers who took loans for attendance at approximately XXXX for-profit online schools, unless they resided in certain states or had not defaulted for at least seven months during a specified period. 
The only period during which I managed to reduce the principal amount was during the pandemic, when interest rates were temporarily lowered to between 0.5 % and 1 %. However, once the regular interest rates resumed, my balance skyrocketed again. This financial strain, coupled with the emotional stress and damage to personal relationships, has been overwhelming. 
Moreover, Navient exited the federal student loan servicing business amidst legislative and advocacy scrutiny, following allegations of steering borrowers away from income-driven repayment plans towards forbearance, an action for which they had to provide restitution. 
Navient has also faced multiple lawsuits for other predatory lending and illegal collection practices. 
Currently, Navient is distributing " applications '' to select students who may qualify for Borrower Defense claims against their schools. However, this process feels unnecessary and opaque, as Navient is already aware of the affected students. 
Under the FTC 's " Holder Rule, '' Navient is accountable for these predatory loans issued in association with for-profit online schools. As time is critical, XXXX XXXX XXXX has urged Navient 's CEO to immediately discharge these loans. It is crucial for Navient to take responsible action now by discharging all such predatory private loans associated with for-profit online education.
